*The Purple Palace Mysterious Writ*

It is said that of all afflictions that plague human breath, none is more grievous than consumptive wasting. No physician or shaman in the world can cure it. Once one person falls ill, the malady spreads through the entire clan, even to the point of extinguishing the family line. None dare approach, hence it is called "corpse-transmitted consumption." Some burn the dead in the mountains and wilds; others cast them into rivers, refusing burial. Descendants sever ties of bone and flesh; husbands and wives lose the bond of mutual regard. How tragic indeed!

Those who treat this illness fail to suppress the Three Corpses and Nine Worms. Talismans prove ineffective—how could mere physicians or shamans succeed? Now, a treasured secret is revealed, to be imparted only to those deemed worthy, transmitted through the heart. If one whose nature and conduct are not gentle and sincere obtains this text without the master’s guidance, recklessly practices it, or carelessly divulges it, the calamity will extend to nine generations—an unforgivable sin. Beware, beware!

Households afflicted by this malady must submit a written petition to the altar, declaring their life’s origin and detailing when the illness began and its present symptoms. If they experience inauspicious nightmares or see ghosts of deceased kin, they must clearly describe these omens. Upon verification of the worms’ presence through talismanic fumigation, a memorial is submitted to the Celestial Emperor and the Ancestral Master, dispatching generals to seize the corpse-transmitting ghosts and the wrongfully deceased kin. After imprisonment and interrogation, talismans are issued to expel the corpse-worms.

After ingesting the talisman, within twenty-one days the disease’s source is expelled. If the body sweats and itches as though worms crawl beneath the skin, swiftly wipe the entire body with cloth and burn it. Some may vomit worm-like forms; others may experience abdominal rumbling and pain, followed by diarrhea. The talisman’s power, infused with thunder-fire and lethal qi, incinerates the corpse-worms, leaving no chance of escape. The worms vary in form, but once the disease’s source is expelled, place them in a vessel and cast it into flowing water.

Then, administer the *Report-and-Response Talisman* to determine which organ is depleted, and use the *Tonifying Talisman* to restore what was damaged. For those with qi and blood stagnation, it is also essential to cultivate a calm mind and nurture their nature, avoiding overexertion. The method requires eighty days of treatment, and after a thousand days, the body is purged—such a person is reborn into the world. If they fail to abstain from the bedchamber or regulate their activities appropriately, survival remains uncertain. The utmost care must be taken, as with a woman in childbirth. Without proper nurturing, if the illness recurs, the danger is grave.

Transmitted by Yan Daolong, styled Zilong, of the Tianpeng lineage.

The method for pursuing and eradicating consumption is indeed the most secret text of Heaven and a rare treasure in the world below. Yet today’s practitioners, without examining the root, merely grasp at the branches, vainly attempting to practice it. I first studied under Master Wu Youkai, who received the transmission from Guo Jundaguan. Guo’s master was Chen Zangxiu, whose master was Guo Jun Huangxi, a disciple of Fan Xuan. Though I obtained this transmission, I remained uncertain whether the root and branches were complete.

My neighbor, Master Xueya, received the lineage from Fan Xuan. Having traversed rivers and lakes, he was a pioneer in this art, reviving the dead and saving lives beyond count. In his later years, he returned home, and I became his disciple. How rare is such a text! I served my master for years, fulfilling the duties of a disciple, even providing his burial shroud and coffin. Fan Xuan, pleased with my devotion, imparted all the profound mysteries of the methods.

For over forty years, I wandered rivers and lakes, and the efficacy of my master’s teachings was as responsive as an echo. Though many sought the Dao, few were deemed worthy of transmission. As the saying goes: "Disciples seek masters easily, but masters seek disciples with difficulty." This is no idle claim.

Moreover, today’s practitioners often corrupt talismans and incantations, rendering them flawed and erroneous. When applied to healing, no response is received. Is the method itself inefficacious? No—it is the failure of transmission. At seventy, I met you, who have studied diligently and whose aspirations are admirable. I shall fully transmit the master’s teachings to propagate the true doctrine.

To future learners: unless you offer gold and treasures, pledge your devotion, and swear before Heaven and Earth, do not lightly divulge this. This is my wish and the fortune of the method. I, Yuanchang, have faithfully upheld my master’s transmission, and its efficacy in practice has long been known. Thus, I compile this volume as a treasured inheritance for saving the world. Should later scholars obtain this text, cherish and practice it, and the ranks of immortals may be attained. To carelessly divulge or profane it invites severe retribution from the Mysterious Tribunal. May the generals and officials of the Ancestral Master bear witness.

Respectfully inscribed by Zhang Yuanchang, fourth-generation descendant of the Tianpeng lineage.

*The Origins of the Tianpeng Lineage*

Long ago, the lineage’s founder, Master Pinlefeng, suffered from consumption. In a dream, a divine being said: "Seek the true immortals of Mount Hua, and your illness may be cured." The master ascended the mountain and resided there for over two months, but his condition worsened. The mountain’s Daoists, fearing his death, refused him lodging. Leaning on his staff, he descended, and halfway down the slope, exhausted, he sat. Suddenly, three Daoists appeared and asked: "Why are you here?" The master explained his plight. The Daoists replied: "Return to the mountain. I have a prescription beneath the seat of the Perfected Wang. Seek Lu Yanghao, and memorialize your illness—it will soon be cured." With that, they vanished.

The master marveled and returned to the mountain. Beneath the seat of the Perfected Wang, he indeed found the text. Lu Yanghao had just ascended the mountain, and the master had him copy and memorialize it. His illness was immediately cured. Thereafter, the master practiced this method among rivers and lakes, achieving manifest responses, and many sought the Dao.

In truth, this transmission employs the Four Generals of the Dharma’s Expedient Methods and the Four Immortals of Mount Shenshan as its foundation, establishing a method to deliver people, called the *Four Generals*. The *Purple Court* incorporates common medicinal herbs like *Yi* and *Qi*, which also prove efficacious.

At that time, Yan Tongpan of Fuzhou, styled Jing’an, established a Daoist abbey to welcome masters of the Dao from across the land. One day, the master arrived, and Yan received him with great courtesy.

Jing’an’s younger brother, Fan Yuanxuan, served him with even greater reverence. The master, pleased by his devotion and recognizing his aptitude for receiving the Dao, transmitted this method to him. Yuanxuan practiced it with remarkable efficacy, though he had yet to deliver others. In his later years, beset by worldly upheavals and family poverty, he relocated to Lixian Township in Chongren, beneath an osmanthus tree on Huolu Ridge. He married a woman of the Zhao clan, whose nature inclined toward drink.

At that time, Guo Xueya of Huangxi, a clansman of the master’s elder brother, also studied under Yuanxuan, and both received the transmission of the *Eight Generals*. Xueya’s practice yielded verification, and he issued a talisman declaring: *"The Daoist methods are further refined across the land, yet the* Purple Court *remains unmatched among rivers and lakes."* Upon seeing this, Yuanxuan remarked, *"Even I have no end to my harmony."* From then on, Huang and Han incurred the master’s displeasure.

Yet Xueya remained at Yuanxuan’s door day and night, serving with labor and obedience beyond that of a slave, though he had still not received the full transmission. When Yuanxuan’s illness grew critical, he said to Xueya, *"Among my four or five disciples, none have served me as you have. I shall die soon, yet I regret that my burial clothes, shroud, coffin, and outer casket remain unprepared—what is to be done?"* Xueya replied, *"Master, do not trouble yourself over this; your disciple will see to each detail."* Yuanxuan, pleased, swore an oath: *"If you provide me with garments, I shall ensure you wear brocade. If you furnish the planks, I shall return two coffins to you."*

He then instructed, *"Bring down the chest from my bed frame."* One by one, he examined the method texts within and handed them to Xueya, saying, *"All has been thoroughly entrusted to you. Yet the method for pursuing consumptive ailments still holds the profound mysteries of the Inner Court—all of which are transmitted orally. Now I pass them to you."* And so he revealed all his secrets.

After Yuanxuan’s death, Xueya clothed him in the prepared garments and buried him in the coffin from his own hall. By this method, Xueya’s name resounded across rivers and lakes. Though some of his disciples received the transmission, only my late father and Shi Yuru did so in full. The two families exchanged letters frequently yet never met, each unaware of what the other had attained.

When Xueya transmitted the method to my late father, he said, *"A hundred taels for the* Purple Court*, fifty taels for the* Flowing Water *method—this is all I teach you. If your son is unteachable, I shall not transmit further. If your grandson proves worthy, you must teach him for me."*

One day, my late father again prepared a token of sincerity and presented it, knowing Xueya had urgent need. Seizing the opportunity, he sought to exhaust all secrets. Xueya smiled and said, *"The method is already complete; there is no need to ask further. The texts you may copy, but you must answer my urgency as I answer yours—like unending gold, I teach you so your descendants may benefit without end."*

From my youth, I followed my late father in treating consumptive ailments for twenty years. Practicing this method for over twenty more, I have seen swift and resonant responses, aided by the efficacy of my late father’s spirit and the authority of his assisting generals.

I have often reflected that those afflicted with consumptive illnesses, as the saying goes, *"hide their ailments."* Truly, this is so. Those who contract such diseases fear others knowing or speaking of it—yet how can they not speak? The afflicted are deluded by ghosts, despising any mention of their condition. By the time they awaken and seek treatment, the illness has already deepened.

Moreover, some physicians, though aware of the consumption and their own inability to cure it, conceal the truth to mislead the patient. Even as death approaches, they claim the illness is harmless. Alas, how can such medicine effect a cure?

Consumption arises from five sources: *wine exhaustion, sexual exhaustion, depletion exhaustion, qi exhaustion,* and *transmitted exhaustion.* Their symptoms appear similar, but *transmitted consumption* involves worms and malevolent spirits, bringing calamity that even kin cannot sever.

Transmitted consumption stems from five causes: contracting the illness from the clothing or fabrics of a consumptive household (*clothing transmission*); acquiring it through the utensils of an afflicted family (*utensil transmission*); inhabiting a consumptive’s dwelling (*dwelling transmission*); consuming food or drink sent by a consumptive household, or partaking of their wine and meat (*food transmission*); or mourning the dead and inhaling the *qi* of their corpse (*corpse transmission*). Those who fall ill without cause suffer from *flying corpse* or *wandering consumption*, often due to grudges, curses, or oral hexes.

When one first contracts the illness, symptoms include alternating chills and fever, aching joints, vexing heat in the five centers, withered hair, dizziness, coughing with phlegm, vomiting or coughing blood, nausea, palpitations, shortness of breath, chest oppression, abdominal distension or pain, heartburn, bitter taste, dry tongue, sallow complexion, weakness, cravings for meat, or sudden aversion to food, swollen lymph nodes, nightmares of ghostly unions, seminal emissions, turbid urine, pain radiating from the back to the heart, throat sores, throbbing headaches, and disrupted yin-yang balance. Over years, the symptoms grow increasingly strange: worms may move throughout the body, or one may feel biting in the abdomen or back, or sense them intercepting food in the throat, or emerging from the genitals or anus—such bizarre manifestations are limitless.

In prolonged cases, symptoms worsen: edema, diarrhea, spontaneous sweating, night sweats, emaciated calves, loss of complexion, sore throat, wheezing, chest tightness, crimson lips, flushed face, blood-spotted skin, involuntary seminal emissions in men, uncontrolled vaginal discharge in women, blocked menstruation, throat sores—all dire signs, with ten out of ten cases proving fatal.

For those seeking treatment, one must first compose a sincere petition, detailing the symptoms and their causes. Relying on this, issue talismans for fumigation and verification, submit memorials to the spirits, pursue the worms, and administer restorative treatment to dispel the symptoms. The afflicted must cultivate themselves with utmost care, avoiding physical exertion. If they fail to observe the precepts—succumbing to cold or heat, excessive joy, anger, sorrow, or anxiety, overindulging in food or drink, neglecting hunger or overeating, or violating abstinence from wine and sex—if they disregard restorative care and moderation, the illness will soon recur, leaving no hope for recovery.

On the first day of the jiashen year of the Zhizheng era, fifth-generation descendant Zhang Shunlie respectfully inscribed.

**Procedures for Practice**

For all who come to the altar seeking treatment, first write three *Wash-Hand Talismans*, then seven *Fumigate-Brush Talismans*. Have the patient wash their hands with the *Wash-Hand Talisman* and soap, without drying with cloth to avoid lint, allowing the hands to air-dry. Some claim medicinal ingredients are used in the talismans, but I employ only water for washing. Once the hands are dry, rub them together briskly, then examine them closely.

Next, light incense in a censer and burn one *Fumigate-Brush Talisman*, folding it into the flame. Have the patient hold their hands over the smoke, repeating the process for each talisman. Some may show results after one, others after three or five. If fine hairs appear in the smoke or upon re-fumigation, it confirms *consumptive transmission*; if none appear, the condition is not present. Careful observation is essential—mistaking lint for hairs wastes effort in treatment.

When hairs emerge, note their color and location. The five viscera—green, yellow, red, white, and black—each correspond to specific afflictions. The hairs reveal which organ is damaged, their length, thickness, quantity, and whether they stretch, contract, soften, stiffen, or fork. If they appear at the *Heavenly Gate*, *Tiger’s Mouth*, *Ghost’s Door*, palm center, beneath fingers, on the back of the hand, or the upper joints of fingers—left for men, right for women—red or black, long or thick, contracted or extended, numerous, soft, or forked, with strange colors, these are all inauspicious signs. Careful examination reveals the depth of the illness.

If others have been preemptively sought for treatment and fumigation, and hairs appear, pursue the worms; if none appear, return to this altar for re-fumigation. The absence of hairs may result from improper invocation of the spirit-generals to restrain the worms during the initial talisman use, allowing them to escape into the bodies of the patient’s family or hide within walls. Use the proper method to summon and confine them to the patient’s original site of injury. After one or two days, reapply the talismans for fumigation—hairs will surely appear.

In cases where the worms have damaged the kidneys, fumigation often yields no hairs, yet pursuit may still reveal worms. This is a known occurrence.

When hairs appear during fumigation, record the symptoms and submit a petition to the *Northern Emperor*, the *Northern Dipper*, the *Four Saints*, and the *Zongshi of Mount Hua*. Issue talismans to pursue the worms: first, place one *General Talisman* at the front of the room. Then, use forty-nine talismans, ingesting seven daily while awaiting a response.

When the worms descend, signs will manifest akin to the three therapeutic methods of sweating, vomiting, and purging in medicine. Three, seven, or fifteen days after ingesting the talismans, the body may grow hot and sweat—remain still until itching arises, as if insects crawl across the skin. This is the *sweating* response. Wipe the body clean with clothing, then boil and rewear it. Burn the bedding as well.

If nausea and retching occur, the patient will vomit worms, foul phlegm, or undigested food—examine the contents for worms. This is the *vomiting* response. If the abdomen rumbles or aches, signaling a bowel movement, avoid using the latrine. Collect the excrement in a chamber pot; whether loose or hard, worms will be present. This is the *purging* response. Worms expelled through vomiting or purging are large and visible, while those in sweat are small and hard to see.

The forms of worms vary: some resemble infants, snakes, rats, loaches, eels, toads, tadpoles, mosquitoes, gnats, ants, lice, or other creatures; others appear as tangled silk, rotting floss, flesh balls, hair, horsehair, palm fiber, grass seeds, hemp, millet, fruit pits, essence-blood, glue, lacquer, rotting dough, or phlegm—countless shapes, impossible to describe fully. Examine them closely and burn them to prevent recurrence. If discarded outdoors, rain and dew may revive them. The worms, pressed by thunder and fire, may die if small, but larger ones survive—this has been observed in expelled worms.

The original method of pursuing worms relies on the three responses of sweating, vomiting, and purging. After years of practice, variations have emerged. Some patients sweat first from the feet, then the legs, followed by the buttocks, arms, flanks, and head, recovering in stages. Others, after twenty-one days of pursuit, show no response but nosebleeds; upon washing and examining the blood, worms as thick as shoelaces and over six inches long were found. Still others expelled centipedes from their ears, or worms the size of ants crawled from their beards and faces. Such strange phenomena are limitless. Without proper method, worms may flee.

When pursuing worms with talismans, proceed gradually—do not invoke the *Seven Ghosts* or impose deadlines for responses. Trust in the spirit-officers’ discretion. If the talismans are ingested too hastily, the worms may thrash and die within the consumed organs, worsening the damage and making restoration difficult. The patient may soon perish. A gradual approach allows thunder and fire to weaken the worms, preventing further feeding until they perish from exhaustion. The talismans in this tradition include restorative treatment, so by the time the worms descend, the damaged areas have already begun healing—delay is thus preferable. Premature expulsion leaves the viscera depleted and *original qi* weakened, making restoration difficult. Delay ensures the viscera remain firm and *original yang* intact, facilitating easy recovery. Other traditions prioritize swift responses, but many fail to recover.

In households where many have perished from this illness, the worms grow large and gain intelligence, able to move in and out of bodies, hide in walls, circulate *qi*, and spread toxins to infect others.

Moreover, the worms may exit the body of the afflicted and enter the body of one yet uninfected, roaming and feeding before returning to the sick. In critical cases where the five viscera are failing, the corpse-worms emerge one month—or even half a month—before the patient’s death, hence the saying: *"When the worms depart, the person perishes."* Some claim the worms must not be expelled, warning that their removal leads to death—this is a grave error. Others, observing the patient’s critical state, advocate first restoring then expelling, but this too is misguided. If the worms are not pursued and eradicated, they will fester within, consuming the flesh like maggots, spreading corruption—how then could the patient survive? After expelling the corpse-worms, restoration must begin at once, not delayed even a single day. One must obtain a pig’s leg bone. For coughing, add pig’s lung, simmer until tender, then mix in a little rice. Once cooked, cut fifteen strips of the restorative talisman into fine pieces and stir them into the broth, ensuring the paper does not clump. Take this at dawn each day, and after consuming it, do not return to sleep, for this is most harmful. Salt must not be added.

After consuming the talisman for four or five days, the abdomen settles, food becomes palatable, daily meals increase, and the symptoms gradually recede—even the critically ill may recover. If, however, the stomach rejects it, the abdomen swells, or diarrhea persists, or if one feels nauseous after eating, even a mild case may turn perilous. Strict dietary restrictions must be observed: pond fish, leavened bread, baked cakes, sesame cakes, beef, lamb, goose, sow pork, rapeseed oil, fried or roasted foods, cured meats, alcohol, raw or cold items, and all toxic substances must be avoided with utmost care. Daily meals should not be excessive, nor should one undertake long journeys, carry heavy loads, or strain the sinews and vessels, lest the injured areas suffer further damage and the illness relapse. Sexual abstinence is imperative, and one must maintain vigilance for a full year, allowing the injured flesh—both old and new—to knit together, so that movement and rest may proceed without hindrance. Even in mild cases, convalescence for half a year is essential to ensure lasting vitality and longevity.

"By imperial decree, the supervisory marsh officials are jointly commanded to ensure the capture of the household of [Name], who have defied Heaven and Earth, disobeyed the imperial decree, and harbored the vengeful ghosts of consumptive ancestors and karmic spirits. Seize them and imprison them, that their transgressions may be manifestly revealed and requited."

Upon completing the incantation and obtaining the divination blocks, he employs the Dipper Ladle and *guan* ritual implements, concluding with the slaughter-sealing and decapitation-sealing rites.

The altar’s light vanishes. With the **Arcuate Seven-Circuit Incantation**, he binds them with rope, pressing them down with the **Tai Mountain Seal** in his left hand, then commands: *"See the **Yá’é** Ridge fly, sealing the prison!"*

He solemnly invokes the **Elemental Sovereign of the Original Response**, the **Grand Marshal of the One-Qi Commandery**, **Bear the Great General** leading the **Pursuing Consumption Army**, and **Liu the Great General** leading the **Severing Consumption Army**, along with all subordinate officers and generals, to swiftly seize the household of [Name], whose **consumptive, vengeful, and karmic ghosts** now wreak havoc. They are to be **conveyed to the Supreme Black Prison of Judgment**, where they shall be **forever confined**.

Now, O Great Marshal, **hasten and arrest them immediately!**

After the incantation, he commands: *"The Patriarch oversees the altar. Officials and soldiers encircle, then draw the **Five-Seal Well of Heaven and Earth**."*

**Ziwen**, the **Northern Qi**, and the **Black Waters** enter within. The **Scattered Incantation** is chanted universally—all generals, heed the order!

Again, the **Fire Incantation** is chanted universally, envisioning **flaming fires raging through heaven and earth**. The **Reverse Scattered Incantation** follows, imagining **swords and spears clashing above and below**. He commands the celestial generals to **subdue and imprison the malevolent forces within the Supreme Black Prison**, where they shall **perish and be annihilated**.

After descending the altar, he raises the **Sword Seal** with both hands, holding up the **talisman-decree**, envisioning the Patriarch in the sky, dispatching generals to **guard the Ghostly Gate**.

He solemnly invokes the **Elemental Sovereign of the Original Response**, commanding the **One-Qi Commandery’s Grand Marshal** and the **Hundred Million Subordinate Officers, Generals, Soldiers, and Officials** to descend. Wherever this talisman is cast, they shall encircle it **threefold**, **solemnly seizing and binding** the **flying transmission corpses**, **wandering cadaverous insects**, **vengeful ghosts**, **consumptive qi**, **karmic spirits**, and **malevolent spectral forces**, delivering them beneath the talisman’s decree to **perish and be annihilated**.

Next, he affixes a talisman to the left ankle, just outside the external malleolus, then leads them into the **Well Altar**, sealing it with earth. He declares:

*"The Heavenly Way is sealed. The Earthly Way is sealed. The Human Way is open. The Ghostly Way is sealed."*

Then he strikes the axe, proclaiming:

*"The Heavenly Way is severed. The Earthly Way is severed. The Human Way is open. The Ghostly Way is severed. All flying transmission corpses, wandering cadaverous insects, and consumptive ghosts are **forever severed**.*

*For ten thousand years, they shall not meet. For a hundred thousand years, they shall not encounter.*

*This talisman now severs—all ghosts are **rootedly exterminated**.*

*Heaven’s annihilation seizes. Earth’s annihilation seizes. Annihilation seizes, seizing annihilation. Seizing annihilation, annihilation seizes. Heaven and Earth’s annihilation seizes, seizing annihilation of heaven and earth. Heaven’s collapse and Earth’s ruin seize annihilation, seizing ruin and collapse of heaven and earth."*

The Master takes **three steps in the Ding-Gang formation**, applying the **Great Heavenly Killing Energy** to his body, declaring, *"I am the Emperor."*

Facing east, he chants the **Mystic Void Incantation**, solemnly invoking **Heaven-Encounter the Grand Marshal**, commanding him to **hasten to my presence** for orders.

When the Marshal arrives, he turns south, chanting the **Mystic Void Incantation**, solemnly invoking **Heaven-You the Grand Marshal**, commanding him to **hasten to my presence** for orders.

When the Marshal arrives, he turns west, solemnly invoking **Yìshèng the True Lord**, commanding him to **hasten to my presence** for orders.

When the Lord arrives, he turns north, solemnly invoking **Yòushèng the True Lord**, commanding him to **hasten to my presence** for orders.

Facing east again, he recites the **Heaven-Peng Incantation**, solemnly summoning **thirty thousand soldiers of the Original Response Imperial Palace**, commanding them to **hasten to my presence**.

Next, he recites the **Heaven-You Incantation**, solemnly summoning **thirty thousand soldiers of the Yuan-Jǐng Dan-Tian Palace**, commanding them to **hasten to my presence**.

Next, he recites the **Northern Incantation**, solemnly summoning **thirty thousand soldiers of the Yuan-Zhào Purple Void Palace**, commanding them to **hasten to my presence**.

Finally, he recites the **Yòushèng Incantation**, solemnly summoning **thirty thousand soldiers of the Yuan-Hé Relocation Academy**, commanding them to **hasten to my presence**.

As he reaches the **collapsing peaks**, he envisions **heaven and earth trembling**, soldiers gathering like clouds, **ten thousand armies massing**, filling half the realm. He draws the **highest qi from the northwest**, aligning his gaze with the **Lù character**, wielding the **Sword Seal** to **carve and execute**, commanding the generals and officials to **slaughter the city and sever the land**. The Master then **triggers the mechanism**, flips the **Zhuzi**, and falls backward, striking the axe **three times**, chanting:

*"Consumption severed, ghosts annihilated. Deep grudges dissolved in darkness.*

*With one glance, heaven collapses and earth splits."*

The incantation ends—**heaven overturns, earth inverts**. There is **neither thing nor self, neither ghost nor god**. All is **chaotic and formless**, **void and still**. At the moment the chant begins, **heaven and earth divide anew**, the **Two Principles separate**, and only the **Three True Saints** shine above in **golden radiance**, illuminating the **eight extremes**.

Residing within the **great crimson golden light**, he rises, **sacrifices to the Thunder**, and **thanks the Patriarch** before departing.

**The Mixed Master** first **calms his mind and concentrates**, inscribing the **three golden Shàngluó characters** on his chest with his gaze. He recites the **Proclamation in three reverences**, and though the golden characters vanish, he sees **three Immortals**.

He recites the **Proclamation of the Three Immortals**:

*"The High Holy Void Emperor of the Jade Purity,
The Supreme True Mixed-Origin Immortal Master,
Manifesting the Original Soul, embodying the Dao,
His virtues and practices perfected.
He drives thunder and commands lightning,
Bringing prosperity to the realm and peace to the people.
Assisting loyal and filial virtues,
Eradicating sins and prolonging life.
The **Hua-Gài Patriarch**, the **Teacher of Humankind and Heaven**,
Jointly inscribed by the **Three Thunderous Provinces’ Grand Vizier of the Golden Gate Great Immortal**,
The **Naively Auspicious Spirit-Responding Protector-of-the-Realm Floating-Qiu True Lord**,
The **Nine-Heaven Salary Director, High Mystic Emperor, Marvelous Dao Master**,
The **Five-and-Three Flying-Step, Rectifying-Auxiliary Miraculous-Spirit, Piercing-Response Supreme Void King True Lord**,
The **Southern Pole Life-Regulating Immortal Official, Mystic Bright Emperor, Sincere Dao Master**,
The **Nine-One Upper Clarity, Manifestly Auspicious Spirit-Responding, Sincerely Responding Miraculous-Far Guo True Lord**,
The **Northern Pole Examining Official Immortal, Supreme Bright Emperor, Three-Realm Transformed Body Celestial Venerable**,
The **Heaven-Peng, Heaven-You, Yìshèng, Yòushèng**—
**Wood, Fire, Water, Metal, Earth**—
**The Fire-Heaven Venerable’s Edict, the Victorious Sovereign**,
The **Fierce Blood Rapid-Form True Lord**,
**The Heaven-Peng Incantation’s Master and Subordinate Talismans, the Six Qi-Seals entering the Pine**,
**The Fierce Blood Great General Ding-Song**, whose **divine prowess pursues consumption and subdues karmic afflictions**.
Commanding the **Vice-General Gēng Jiǔjiǔ**, who **hurls fire ten thousand li to annihilate cadaverous insects**.
To the left stands the **Flying Eagle Rapid General**, **cutting off all traces above and below.**"

**Directly piercing the patient’s marrow and innermost depths,
Further into the patient’s pores and openings.
Swiftly search without a single loss,
Hastily obeying the Emperor’s command to assist Heaven-Peng.**

I, bearing the **Ancestor’s, Human-Heavenly Teacher’s, Three-Spirit, Three-Aid, Three-Response True Lord’s** decrees,
**Summon the Fierce Blood Emperor of Flame, the Four-Clear Shatter-Corpse Heavenly General, the Master and Subordinate Two Marshals, and the Five-Thunder Messengers:**
**Lèshà, Móumíng, Hùndiàn, Èhōng, Hèměng.**
**Right-hand invocation, marking names and entering—**
**Covering the ears as thunder’s voice, flashing eyes as lightning, swallowing saliva as rain,**
**Conducting the Thunder-Symbol into the talisman,**
**Calm and steady, focusing the gaze into a single point, entering the General, then drawing in the Fierce Blood Fire-*qi* from the South, merging it in the *dantian*,**
**Fostering great wrath, closing and consolidating.**
**Recite:**
*"First turn—Thunder Lord’s roar,
Second turn—Clap of thunder erupts,
Third turn—Dynamic Arc of the Pole,
Fourth turn—Four Executions vanish,
Fifth turn—Five Peaks tremble,
Sixth turn—Six Spirits conceal,
Seventh turn—Seizing the Heaven-Defying, transmitting consumption, flying cadaverous toxins, cadaverous insects, and ghostly creatures—*
*All malevolent essences.*
**Submit to my Five-Thunder Talisman’s command—die without movement, without resistance.**
**Seventh turn—close and consolidate, do not disperse *qi*—**
**Let heat pervade the body, then with the Left Array stir the *dantian*’s True Fire,**
**Circulating Kidney Water to surge against Heart Fire, extracting the True Fierce Blood through the gaze’s point,**
**Entering the Three [Seals],**
**Only seeing the Fierce Blood blazing, thunder’s rumble hidden within—**
**Then recite the Nine Executions, inscribing the Dark Execution, the Yin Execution, the Blue Execution,**
**Applying the Forward and Reverse Heaven-Peng’s Rage, the Forward and Reverse Seizing,**
**From within outward, outward inward,**
**Burning the Dark, refining the Blue, circulating the Inner Arc,**
**Gazing outward to enter the vital points, pressing tightly to inscribe.**

**Soul-Stabilizing, Spirit-Settling Talisman**
*"Mixed Primordial-*Qi* God, Ten-Thousand Spirits’ Gate—*
**Protecting the Body, eternally guarding against ghosts and spirits’ rebellion,*
**Returning to the Bright Platform, entering the Dark Essence’s swift progress,*
**As the Most High Laozi’s Soul-Stabilizing, Spirit-Settling Decree.**
**Heaven-Peng’s Spear-Slaying Technique cuts the Essence,*
**The Auxiliary Saint’s Descending-*Qi* aids the Saint’s Descending-Spirit.*
**Upper Primordial Heavenly Official Tang Hong, Middle Primordial Earthly Official Ge Yong, Lower Primordial Waterly Official Zhou Wu—**
**Six Techniques’ Master and Subordinate Generals’ *qi* entering,*
**Heavenly Generals seizing [the patient’s] true soul and spirit at [their] exact year, month, day, and hour,*
**Halt the pen within, steady the mind,*
**Greedy for the Arc’s ascent, the Arc’s descent, Execution’s entry, Yin’s absorption,*
**Forward and Reverse Seizing halting within,*
**Demanding retribution, refining and entering,*
**Heaven-One Earth-Two—all things complete,*
**Water and Fire’s source, the Mixed Primordial True-*Qi*.*
**Spirits submit to my command, ghosts submit to my control,*
**Moving, stopping, sitting, or standing—auspicious without fail.**
**Heaven clears, Earth settles, spirits converge—**
**Swiftly attach to my form.**
**Again, with Heaven’s gaze encircle within,*
**Halt the pen, steady the mind, adding Three-Sevens-Nines,*
**Before fumigation, first command hand-washing.**

**Reverse Heaven-Peng Incantation**
*"Collapse from ten thousand ghosts,*
**One stroke severs the spirit.*
**Destroy the Heavenly You, shatter the Four-Clear Corpse.*
**Fierce Blood’s Emperor of Flame,*
**Execute the Five Ghosts with punishment.*
**Great Heaven’s Axe, the Celestial Hammer’s form appears,*
**Ghosts dare not resist, omens do not retreat.*
**Thousand-layered cadaverous repulsion,*
**Ninefold protection—my defense.*
**Thirteen thousand troops,*
**Blades bearing the North’s might.*
**Fierce Heaven’s Excitement,*
**South’s menace governs.*
**Soldiers’ strength—Heaven’s Ding,*
**Old Man’s gaze—Four Directions.*
**Teeth green, tongue ashen.*
**Wind-drinking body sprawls.*
**Ghosts eat, demons devour,*
**Black mist surging into the Elixir Field.*
**Heaven’s *qi* rides purple,*
**Traces vanish, evils severed.*
**Kingly Spirit’s sword威,*
**Dragon-Qilin’s stern procession.*
**Three-eyed Jackal’s white,*
**Emperor’s grip holds firm.*
**Beast’s massive skull,*
**Fierce brilliance above.*
**Eight officials, seven laws,*
**Northern bandit’s height.*
**Ding the Capital’s Five,*
**Child Executioner’s Nine,*
**Heaven-Peng, Heaven-Peng!"**

**Heaven-You Incantation**
*"Heaven-You, Heaven-You,*
**Fierce and mighty lords!*
**Above aiding the Northern Pole,*
**Below governing the Nine Regions.*
**Clad in golden armor,*
**Wielding spear and halberd.*
**Eyes like bursting lightning,*
**Claws like golden hooks.*
**Riding clouds, exhaling mist,*
**Ghosts tremble, spirits despair.*
**Encountering demons—inch by inch beheaded,*
**Meeting ghosts—seized and bound.*
**Severing evil, returning to rectitude,*
**Commanding Heaven’s Steeds.*
**Ghosts in harmony—unharmed,*
**Ghosts in rebellion—heads severed.*
**Where the Heavenly Talisman arrives,*
**No lingering allowed."*

**Auxiliary Saint Incantation**
*"Northern Black Emperor,*
**Supreme among Ten-Thousand Saints.*
**Six Stellar Constellations of Taiwei,*
**Five-*Qi* Spirit Lords.*
**Luminous as sun and moon,*
**Powerful as Heaven and Earth.*
**Flying Talismans and Seizing Scriptures,*
**Severing the Ghostly Gate.*
**Deploying Spirits, dispersing *qi*,*
**Warding off the Five Calamities.*
**Left and Right Officers and Soldiers,*
**Thirty-Five Generals.*
**Thunder Lord’s claps,*
**Lightning’s surging clouds.*
**Swords and blades like rain,*
**Processions like clouds.*
**Holding the Imperial Bell,*
**Wearing Kunlun’s crown.*
**Marching across the land,*
**Hunting demonic essences.*
**Nine Regions’ communal edicts,*
**Guests at the blood-feast.*
**No resistance permitted,*
**Dare to raise scales!*
**Constellation-Star binds hands,*
**Northern Emperor reclaims the soul.*
**Three Platforms, Seven Stars,*
**Sword-wielding execution.*
**Crime not lightly interrogated,*
**Calamity extends to your body.*
**Malevolent spirits and *xiāo* demons,*
**Ears dare not hear.*
**Hearing my incantation,*
**Skull splits, brain shatters—*
**Crushed to fine dust."*

**Aid-Spirit Incantation**
*"Great Yin’s Transformation-Giving,*
**Essence of Water’s Position.*
**Vacuous Danger’s celestial response,*
**Tortoise-Serpent’s merged form.*
**Circulating the Six Extremes,*
**Dominating ten thousand spirits.*
**No darkness unobserved,*
**No wish unfulfilled.*
**At the end of the kalpa, at its beginning,*
**Severing and punishing demonic essences.*
**Rescuing and protecting all ranks,*
**Nations and families in eternal peace.*
**Dare any minor ghost*
**Attempt to manifest!*
**My gaze—one glance,*
**Five Peaks crumble.*
**Great Virtue-Power Incantation**
**Om Ah Hung Hung.**
**San Dan Na Jù Zhī Dīnà Zhà Hàn Nàn Yán Qián Yí Chì.**
**Arise, O Nine-Heavens Fire-Thunder Department’s Boundless Great Strength God-King,*
**Nine-Heavens Fire, Thunder-Fire, Lightning-Fire, Flying Fire, Sudden Fire,*
**Seven-Star Fire, Thunderclap Fire, Blazing Thunder-Fire,*
**Nine-Heavens Thunder-Fire.**
**Thunder King’s stern chariot—Qilin Dragon,*
**Steed—Flying Tiger,*
**White [Unclear],*
**Qíniè, Qílín,*
**Fire Dragon, Fire Elephant,*
**Fire Phoenix, ten thousand troops,*
**Copper-head, iron-brow,*
**One hundred thousand divine soldiers."*

**The Five Emperors’ rites surpass all bounds,*
**The Four Celestial Ones traverse the skies—*
**The Imperial Bell tolls, its resonance shaking,*
**Demons and heretics tremble in fear.**

**Caverns of bliss, blessed lands,*
**Mountain sanctuaries, hidden spirits,*
**Peaks topple, waters surge,*
**A hundred valleys boil in tumult.**

**What mortal dare resist,*
**Who would not submit and obey?**

**Fire-Dragons, Fire-Horses,*
**Fire-Wolves, Fire-Women,*
**Descend from heaven, surge from the hominid days,*
**Homing on the *Bing-Ding* [days of fire].**

**Fire-Tigers disperse *qi*,*
**Fire-Dragons race through the skies,*
**The Five Marshals of the Celestial Host*
**Roar thunder, unleashing their might.**

**Sand flies, stones roll,*
**Trees uproot, roots shift,*
**The Wind-Wheel spins left,*
**The Fire-Chariot wheels right.**

**Illuminating the Three Realms,*
**Transformed into the Crimson City.**

**Within the Eight Trigrams’ arena,*
**The Four Directions arrayed in order.**

**Virtue-Power envelops the land,*
**Flame-Wrath soars in majesty.**

**Ghostly spirits who dare gaze*
**Plunge a ten-thousand-*zhang* abyss,*
**Crushed to flying ash.**

**Ancient trees, accursed shrines,*
**Forever buried in the mud of kalpas.**

**Urgent! Urgent! The Edict of the Primeval Lord of Great Unity.**
**The Forty-Sixth Scroll of the *Fa Hai’s* Bequeathed Pearl—now complete.**

chunks.original_text: 法海遗珠 经名：法海遗珠。 撰人不详。 约成书於元末明初。 四十六卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》太平部。 法海遗珠#1卷之一 神霄十字天经#2 混炼玄隐 凡欲受持十字天经，下工混炼者，每於子午卯酉四时，面巽跌坐，叩齿集神，称睿号九声，望神霄引青炁一口，舌拄上腭，书天经。 存碧英满口。 咽下心中，绕心不散。 良久，冲开泥丸，而出青炁，化为炁球。 口诵睿号不已，忽霹雳一声，自球中出见欻火，合青炁光中。 即时心礼祝事，欻火忽化天火青光，从泥丸直下重楼至丹田，坐於丹元之中，三部八景之神，皆来朝谒，齐诵天经。 倏忽之间，寂无遗响。 朝夕行之，九年则尸毒消亡，形神俱妙，与道合真矣。 书经秘用 天经符文，焚香静坐，心诵十字天经，不计遍数。 书此十字为符，或排书，或迭书。 书毕，仍召九天应元捷令灵飞神元符使张束，存符使天丁冠，青面，金甲，玄衣，绿靴，风带，手执玉斧，自巽户降，以祖炁合之。 存至密祷，所求事意，或析祷，或驱治，或吞或需，或佩或镇，如意行用，无不感应。 十字天经 召符使符

**Precious Gems from the Dharma Ocean**

*Scripture Title:* Precious Gems from the Dharma Ocean. Author unknown. Likely compiled between the late Yuan and early Ming dynasties. Forty-six scrolls in total. Base text sourced from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, Peace Section.

---

**Precious Gems from the Dharma Ocean, Scroll 1, Part 1**
**The Divine Empyrean Scripture of the Ten Celestial Characters**

### **Arcane Refinement in Hidden Practice**
For those who wish to receive and uphold the *Scripture of the Ten Celestial Characters* and engage in the work of arcane refinement, perform the following at the four cardinal hours of *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you*: face the *xun* direction, sit cross-legged, knock the teeth to gather the spirit, and recite the sacred title nine times. Envision the Divine Empyrean drawing in a breath of azure *qi*, press the tongue against the upper palate, and inscribe the scripture. Hold the jade-green essence within the mouth, swallow it into the heart, and circulate it without dissipation. After a long while, it will surge upward, piercing the *Niwan* (Mud Pill Palace), and emerge as a sphere of *qi*. Continuously recite the sacred title until suddenly, with a thunderous crack, a spark of fire bursts forth from the sphere, merging with the radiance of the azure *qi*. At that moment, perform the rites of reverence and invocation. The spark of fire will instantly transform into celestial fire and azure light, descending straight from the *Niwan* through the *Chonglou* (Double Storied Tower) to the *Dantian* (Cinnabar Field), where it takes seat within the *Danyuan* (Elixir Origin). The deities of the Three Passes and Eight Scenic Realms will all come to pay homage, chanting the celestial scripture in unison. In an instant, all sounds vanish into silence. Practicing this morning and evening for nine years will dissolve the corpse’s toxins, refine both form and spirit to perfection, and unite one with the True Dao.

### **Secret Applications of Inscribing the Scripture**
For the talismanic script of the *Celestial Scripture*, burn incense, sit in stillness, and recite the *Scripture of the Ten Celestial Characters* without counting the repetitions. Inscribe these ten characters as a talisman, either in sequence or layered. Upon completion, summon *Zhang Shu*, the Swift Commanding Numinous Flying Divine Talisman Envoy of the Nine Heavens’ Responsive Primordial Realm. Envision the talisman envoy as a Heavenly Soldier (*Tianding*) wearing a crown, with a blue-green face, golden armor, black robes, green boots, and a wind-swept sash, wielding a jade axe. He descends from the *xun* gate, merging with the ancestral *qi*. Silently pray with utmost sincerity for your intended purpose—whether for supplication, exorcism, ingestion, display, wearing, or consecration. Employ it as you wish, and it will respond without fail.

### **The Scripture of the Ten Celestial Characters**
*Summoning the Talisman Envoy Talisman*

The humble servant [Name] respectfully summons—
Having recited the Celestial Scripture above and inscribed the talisman, envision golden light entering the talisman. When invoking it for service, there is nothing it cannot penetrate.

**The Jade Pivot Scripture, Fifteen Talismans**
For each of the fifteen talismans, one must purify the heart, sit in silence, clench the fists, concentrate the spirit, and recite the Heavenly Worthy’s sagely name without counting the repetitions. Envision the Heavenly Worthy descending from the *xun* gate, and with utmost reverence, silently pray for your purpose. Visualize golden light entering the talisman, then recite the corresponding prayer for your request.

*Black of the Nine Heavens’ Responsive Primordial, the True Form is revered Fire.
The thunder’s roar opens the primordial kalpa, the lightning’s flash illuminates the hidden depths.
Divine transformations manifest in wondrous ways, sagely virtue crowns all numinous beings.
How marvelous are these ten characters—worth more than reciting ten thousand scrolls of scripture.*

**Chapter Two:** Summoning the Nine Numinous and Three Essences.
**Chapter Three:** Resolving clashes and conflicts of the Five Phases and Nine Luminaries.

**Chapter Five:** Eliminating slander and verbal strife.
**Chapter Six:** Warding off earthly spirits, baleful stars, and taboos.

**Chapter Nine:** Dispelling malevolent spirits, exorcising demons, and countering sorcery and nightmares.
**Chapter Ten:** Eliminating parasitic afflictions and delivering ancestral spirits.
**Chapter Eleven:** Ensuring safety in travel by land and water.
**Chapter Twelve:** Praying for rain, beseeching clear skies, and averting floods and fires.
**Chapter Thirteen:** Gazing at the stars and paying homage to the Dipper.
**Chapter Fourteen:** Hearing the scripture to eradicate sins.
**Chapter Fifteen:** Wearing the scripture to gain blessings, command human respect, and instill fear in spirits.

**Esoteric Instructions of the Cavernous Mystery, Section One**

chunks.original_text: 元始玉枢混合雷章 内炼 平定，人我两忘，想元始於金阙中说雷章，字皆金光。 然后存每一字遍满太空，皆成金书，光华闪烁。 次念雷章，辛帅立现矣。 合炁炼神 凝神静坐，天地洞然皆空。 即以舌拄上腭，待华池水满咽下心中，如此三度。 次想西北方上黑云之中有神，如波斯之状。 吾以鼻炁吸入心中，由心下入肾，由肾入心，如此三度，足。 想此炁入於丹田之内，乃脐之中也。 混合成形，十分显现在吾丹田。 次吹呵出坛，任意行用。 如平时坐炼，则静定片时，物我两忘，一炁规中矣。 誓章 天合吾真，地合吾真，日月合吾真，二十八宿合吾真，吾神入师神，师神入我神，周行三界内，代师救万灵，功成附玉历，待师归紫庭。 一如元降律令。 咒毕，随意祝事。 祝毕，与辛君一揖，合为一体，正坐泥九不动，吾身即辛君，辛君即吾身，号召雷神。 如存炼，则入中官，内外二功，各下八十一日。 存养三九，以后行持大获感应。 九阳内炼雷章 静扫尘虑，坐定，良久，攒簇五行，五行和合，精神魂魄，皆聚中官。 金光灿然，中有辛君，再静定心神，下入黄房，刘君见矣。 次心念：九木余玉四字，九遍。 运上泥丸，兆顶天立地。 合誓，念誓雷章： 天地未分，阴阳未判，我於此时，无头无面。 我既有我，五行俱备。 尔於此时，是我之神。 吾附於汝，汝生於我。 吾今咒汝，类我类我。 却默念后咒忖帝部临。 此四字念八十一遍与我同升，上朝玉清。 汝乃天之精，吾乃地之灵。 将汝之精，助吾之灵。 吾扣天鼓，呜法鼓三十六通海个河倾。 吾今与汝，永为弟兄。 遣汝上天，朝奏帝君。 遣汝入地，直至泉扃。 遣汝入水，摄遍溟冷。 遣汝救大旱，真炁运雷霆。 遣汝捉精怪，束缚来现形。 普救世间苦，同共立功勋。 功成行满日，与汝同飞升。 急急如 元始三炁天君，昊天玉皇大天尊，玄穹高上帝元降律令勑摄 次静坐定，存金光一团中有字母，永镇黄庭，十二时行住坐卧，默默护持，俗事繁务，亦须点检，遇有行持，俯仰太虚，神随意出。 法海遗珠卷之一竟 #1《法海遗珠》：此书为宋元道教符箓振中的神霄振、太乙振、北帝派、正一振、混沌派、西河派及金丹派南宗等符咒，雷法之总集。 凡收符咒雷法共五十余种，包括符箓、云箓、显咒、秘咒、雷法、存炼、内运、上章、奏传、文书等，用以召神役鬼、祈禳梼告，兴云起雷，催风役电，止雨祈晴，呼风唤雨，移度妖星，灭殃镇魔，炼度亡魂，治病除疾，斩鬼捉祟等，皆一一详备法诀仪轨。 虽沿承汉唐以来符箓振之传统，但其道法内容非常丰富，面目焕然一新，且多以内功丹法为基础，以役使雷法为外功，并采取佛教之密咒与修法，充分显示了宋元道教新符法的概貌及盛况。 书中有叔道法渊源者多处，对于研究宋元道教流派的历史及考辩宋元全真振与正一派相互吸收交流的状况，颇具参考价值。 #2《神霄十字天经》：此书为宋元神霄振着作。 #3《玉枢经》：全称为《九天应元雷声普化天尊玉枢宝经》。 《道藏》中收录。 有题名『海琼白真人注』之《集注》本二卷，卷末有至顺癸酉上元日嗣三十九代天师太玄子书序，可知《集注》刊于元末。 内亦收有十五章符，符形大同小异，当为书写之误。
chunks.translated_text:
**Primordial Jade Pivot Mixed Thunder Chapter for Internal Refinement**

When all is settled and stabilized, self and other are forgotten. Visualize the Primordial Beginning expounding the Thunder Chapter within the Golden Portal, each character radiant with golden light. Then, envision each character filling the vastness of the Great Void, all transforming into golden script, shimmering with luminous brilliance. Next, recite the Thunder Chapter, and Marshal Xin will instantly manifest.

**Uniting Qi and Refining Spirit**
Compose the spirit and sit in stillness, where heaven and earth dissolve into emptiness. Press the tongue against the upper palate, wait until the Flower Pool’s waters fill, then swallow them into the heart—do this three times. Next, visualize within the black clouds of the northwest a deity resembling a Persian. Draw in *qi* through the nose into the heart, from the heart descend to the kidneys, then from the kidneys return to the heart—repeat this three times, and it is sufficient. Envision this *qi* entering the Cinnabar Field, which is the center of the navel. When fully coalesced into form, it becomes distinctly manifest within one’s Cinnabar Field. Then exhale with a *he* breath, releasing it from the altar to employ as desired. For regular seated refinement, settle into stillness for a time, where self and objects are forgotten, and *qi* circulates within the compass of the One.

**Oath Chapter**
Heaven unites with my true self, Earth unites with my true self,
Sun and Moon unite with my true self, the Twenty-Eight Constellations unite with my true self.
My spirit enters the master’s spirit, the master’s spirit enters my spirit.
Circulating throughout the Three Realms, I act on the master’s behalf to deliver the myriad spirits.
Upon completion of the merit, I ascend to the Jade Register, awaiting the master’s return to the Purple Court.
*As the Primordial Decree commands.*

Once the incantation is complete, make any prayer as desired. After the prayer, bow once to Lord Xin, merging into one body. Sit upright in perfect stillness, where my body is Lord Xin, and Lord Xin is my body—thus summoning the Thunder Spirits. For refinement practices, enter the Central Palace. Both internal and external practices require eighty-one days each. Cultivate and nourish for three cycles of nine, and thereafter, great responses will be attained in all undertakings.

**Nine Yangs Internal Refinement Thunder Chapter**
Sweep away all worldly concerns, sit in stillness for a long while, then gather and concentrate the Five Agents. When the Five Agents harmonize, spirit, essence, *hun*, and *po* all converge in the Central Palace. Golden light blazes forth, and within it stands Lord Xin. Still the heart and spirit further, descending into the Yellow Chamber, where Lord Liu appears. Next, silently recite the four characters *Nine Woods, Surplus Jade* nine times. Circulate them upward to the Mud Pill Palace, where the practitioner stands between heaven and earth. Then recite the Oath Thunder Chapter:

Before heaven and earth divided, before yin and yang were distinguished,
I existed in this moment, without head or face.
Since I have become myself, the Five Agents are all complete.
You, at this moment, are my spirit.
I am united with you, and you are born from me.
I now command you: be like me, be like me.

Then silently recite the following incantation: *Cǔn Dì Bù Lín*, eighty-one times, ascending together with me to pay homage in the Jade Clarity. You are the essence of heaven, I am the spirit of earth. Take your essence to assist my spirit. I strike the celestial drum, sounding the Dharma drum thirty-six times, causing the seas and rivers to overturn. From now on, you and I shall be as brothers forever. I dispatch you to heaven to present memorials to the Imperial Lord. I dispatch you to earth to reach the deepest springs. I dispatch you into water to pervade the dark and frigid depths. I dispatch you to relieve great droughts, where true *qi* commands thunder and lightning. I dispatch you to capture specters and demons, binding them to reveal their forms. Universally deliver the world’s suffering, and together we shall establish merit. On the day when merit is complete and the Way fulfilled, I shall ascend with you in flight.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Three Qi Heavenly Lords, the August Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, the Highest Lord of the Mysterious Heavens decree and command.*

Next, sit in stillness and visualize a mass of golden light containing seed-characters, eternally guarding the Yellow Court. In all twelve hours, whether moving, staying, sitting, or lying down, silently maintain this protection. Even amidst worldly affairs and duties, one must remain vigilant. When engaging in practice, bow to the Great Void, and the spirit will follow the intent to emerge.

*End of the First Scroll of* **Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls**

According to Xue Shichun of the Yuan dynasty, as recorded in *The Harmony of Daoist Methods* (vol. 147), this pertains to the *Cavernous Mystery Jade Pivot Thunder Rites*, passed from Bai Yuchan to Chen Niuwang, and from Chen Nan to Xin the Heavenly Lord. By the Yuan era, it flourished widely in society, with over five hundred disciples under Xue’s lineage alone, thus making *"the teachings of the Cavernous Mystery renowned in all directions."*

---

**Second Scroll of** *Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls*
**Arcane Essentials of the Cavernous Mystery**
**Summoning the Thunder Chapters**

I take purity and stillness as my foundation,
Uprightness as my majesty.
I command ghosts and spirits to clench their fists in attendance,
I bid wind and clouds to gather and disperse at my will.
With each inhalation and exhalation,
I embody the pivot of Heaven and Earth.
In every action and deed,
I follow the discipline of the Primordial August Emperor.
Thus, within the Three Heavens above,
Beneath the Nine Earths below,
All heed my command.

**Heavenly Lord Liu Ju**, you are the essence of the Upper Heavens,
None are more numinous than you.
I dispatch you to the heavens—
Ascend and present your memorial at the Imperial Court.
I dispatch you to the earth—
Descend straight to the gates of the Yellow Springs.
I dispatch you to the waters—
Proceed directly to the Dragon Court.
I dispatch you to seize demonic specters—
Bind them and force them to manifest.
I dispatch you to relieve suffering—
Let the afflicted find peace at once.
I dispatch you to strike down demonic shrines—
Shatter and destroy all ghostly encampments.
I dispatch you to deploy thunder and lightning—
Let true qi animate the thunderclaps.
Now I stand within the altar,
Awaiting your swift return.
Do not neglect the smallest detail,
Nor betray the sacred covenant.

*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Three Qi Lords of the Highest Origin, the Cavernous Mystery Thunder Sovereign decrees and commands.*

chunks.original_text: 见师立南斗口中，皂衣，披发，跣足，按剑　斗口中，立卓剑下，观顶门上有毫光，上有万灵慈母，跣足，眼顾下二道火光中交射，左邓刘二帅，右张宁任三帅。 再以神光一运，万亿雷真，罗列围绕，历历分明。 存我元命真人，至师前心礼三拜，白事。 兆祝云：夙缘有幸，获嗣宗教，恭望师慈，允某所恳。 特赐师旨，告下刘宁任三大元帅，扶助行持。 某干冒师严，下情无任激切，俟命之至。 若祈雨或为某事祝之，存师允所奏。 毕，心誧： 天合我真，地合我真，日月合吾真，三台盖吾顶，二十八宿合吾真。 吾神入师神，师神入我神。 周行三界内，代师救万灵。 功成附玉历，侍师归紫庭。 吽曙啼哒啊嘲嚤娑煞。 咒毕，或心祝事意。 毕，即复神。 如欲召雷神，则於此接诵。 会雷章 混沌无象，一炁化生。 开朗天地，雷霆运行。 嗒唷大梵，吽冀律亨。 阴阳交际，日月奔钦。 俱奴时那，至赫俱真。 呼吸吽咤，咭波祥精。 包和辖绿，风火奔吽。 忠应树朗，无量朗吽。 上和下律，山海川平。 真乌既穆，真令朝宗。 诵持一遍，雷霆降临。 急急如洞玄雷霆帝君告召律令。 如上内炼，此乃团驻云陈之法，呼召雷雨之秘。 又内炼 炼此九九八十一日，工夫纯熟，报应如响。 平定端坐，静虑凝神，良久调匀，八十一息。 一呼一吸为一息俯视神府，阳炁渐盛。 意常在神府，至八十一息足，则刘君真相具足矣。 心诵神想鸠盘咤三字，九次。 存三字丹光九道，到神府结成刘君真相，朝谒帝师。 存黄庭中恍为神霄玉府，有玉枢上帝，开襟盘足，按剑端坐，碧光旋绕，雷神环列左右。 复视神府，心，诵混沌无象雷章誓章。 次以二字召咒□□，心诵唇音，仰视离方，作怒，大开目怒视，见元帅乘火云，自左目而出，顶天立地在前。 晴用此雨则乘黑云，自右目出。 存天君飞腾霄汉，奋厉风云，雷雨大作。 至此朗召天君到坛，宣意发遣去讫。 再俯视黄庭，心诵策役雷章，即混沌无象叹一遍。 字皆金色。 再怒目，瞠视，两目两道金光射出。 存帅乘金光而去，手剔风火，令罡风发。 亥火作，卯雷震令行。 未剔出二字咒□□，大事八十一遍，小事三十六遍，或十五遍，或九遍。 再鼻引长吸一炁，瞠目怒视，神随意出，腾身在霄汉中，君真相分明。 前法平常存炼谓之炼神。 存自中宫上两目，一视神随眼出，谓之出神。 临事役使之际，两目神光射去，助天将威送之，谓之遣神。 见刘以鼻引入，自泥丸宫复归元宫，谓之归神。 一俯一仰，为出入妙用。 师曰：神定炁升，光出神现。 心诵咒云 归神咒 神归神府，炁返丹元。 后召复临，一如故事。 咒毕，存刘天君足踏火轮，手执金鞭，从泥九官降，吸归神府，请之归神。 秘之秘之。 洞玄紫霄家书合同符

Behold the master standing within the mouth of the Southern Dipper, clad in black robes, hair unbound, barefoot, grasping a sword. Within the Dipper’s mouth, he stands resolute beneath the sword’s point. Observe the radiant hair-like light above the crown’s gate, where the Mother of Myriad Spirits resides, barefoot, her eyes glancing downward at two intersecting beams of fire. To the left, Marshals Deng and Liu; to the right, Marshals Zhang, Ning, and Ren.

With a single movement of divine radiance, ten thousand billion thunder spirits array themselves in orderly ranks, each distinct and clear. Visualize your Primordial Destiny True Person approaching the master’s heart and bowing three times to present your petition. The disciple prays:

*"By long-standing affinity, I have been fortunate to inherit this teaching. Humbly, I beseech your compassion, Master, to grant my request. May you bestow your decree, commanding the Three Great Marshals—Liu, Ning, and Ren—to aid and uphold my practice. I, so-and-so, dare not offend your solemn authority; my heart is filled with boundless gratitude, awaiting your command."*

If praying for rain or petitioning for some matter, visualize the master granting your plea.

Conclude with the heart’s incantation:

*"Heaven unites with my truth,
Earth unites with my truth,
Sun and moon unite with my truth.
The Three Terraces crown my head,
The Twenty-Eight Constellations unite with my truth.
My spirit enters the master’s spirit,
The master’s spirit enters my spirit.
I traverse the Three Realms,
Acting on the master’s behalf to save the myriad spirits.
When the work is done, I ascend the Jade Register,
Attending the master to return to the Purple Court.
Hūng śrī tī tā ā chāo mó suō shā."*

After the incantation, or when the heart’s petition is complete, restore your spirit.

If summoning the thunder spirits, proceed here with the recitation:

**Thunder Rites Chapter**
Chaos without form, the One *qi* gives birth.
Heaven and earth unfold, thunder and lightning move.
Tā yō Great Brahmā, hūng jì lǜ hēng.
Yin and yang intersect, sun and moon hasten in reverence.
Jū nú shí nà, zhì hè jū zhēn.
Breathing forth hūng chà, jī bō xiáng jīng.
Encompassing harmony, wind and fire surge hūng.
Zhōng yìng shù lǎng, wú liàng lǎng hūng.
Above harmonizes with below, mountains, seas, and rivers are at peace.
True crow is solemn, true decree commands homage.
Recite once, and thunder and lightning descend.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Edict of the Lord of Thunder from the Cavernous Mystery commands!*

The above is the method for gathering and stationing clouds, the secret for summoning thunder and rain.

**Further Internal Refinement**
Refine this for eighty-one days, nine cycles of nine. When the work is pure and ripe, the response will be as swift as an echo.

Sit upright and composed, settle the mind and concentrate the spirit. After a long while, regulate the breath—eighty-one cycles. One inhalation and one exhalation count as one breath. Gaze downward at the spirit palace, where yang *qi* gradually flourishes. Keep intent fixed on the spirit palace. When eighty-one breaths are complete, Marshal Liu’s true form will be fully realized.

Silently recite and visualize the three syllables *Jiū pán chà* nine times. Envision nine beams of cinnabar light from these syllables converging in the spirit palace to form Marshal Liu’s true form, who then pays homage to the Imperial Master.

Visualize the Yellow Court transformed into the Jade Capital of the Divine Empyrean, where the Jade Pivot Emperor sits cross-legged, grasping a sword, encircled by swirling azure light, with thunder spirits arrayed to his left and right.

Gaze again at the spirit palace. Silently recite the *Chaos Without Form* thunder chapter and the oath chapter. Then, with the two-character summoning incantation □□, recite it in the heart’s voice, look upward toward the *Li* direction, assume a wrathful expression, and open the eyes wide in anger. See the Marshal emerge from the left eye upon a cloud of fire, standing between heaven and earth before you. If summoning rain in clear weather, have him ride a black cloud emerging from the right eye.

Visualize the Heavenly Lord soaring through the empyrean, stirring wind and clouds, as thunder and rain erupt in full force. At this point, clearly summon the Heavenly Lord to the altar, state your intent, and dispatch him.

Then, gaze downward at the Yellow Court and silently recite the *Strategy for Commanding Thunder* chapter—*Chaos Without Form*—once. Each character appears in golden hue.

Again, glare fiercely, eyes wide, and shoot forth two beams of golden light from both eyes. Envision the Marshal riding the golden light away, wielding wind and fire, commanding the *qi* of the *Gang* wind to rise. At *Hai*, fire ignites; at *Mao*, thunder roars, and the decree is executed.

For major matters, recite the two-character incantation □□ eighty-one times; for lesser matters, thirty-six, fifteen, or nine times. Then, draw a long breath through the nose, glare fiercely, and let the spirit follow intent outward. Ascend into the empyrean, where the Heavenly Lord’s true form is distinct.

The preceding method of regular visualization and refinement is called *refining the spirit*. Directing the spirit upward from the Central Palace to the two eyes, so that the spirit follows the gaze outward, is called *exiting the spirit*. When dispatching for practical use, the spirit’s light from the eyes shoots forth, aiding the Heavenly Generals in conveying authority—this is called *dispatching the spirit*. When Marshal Liu is seen, draw him in through the nose, returning from the Muddy Pellet Palace to the original palace—this is called *returning the spirit*. One downward and one upward movement constitute the wondrous function of exit and entry.

The master says: *"When the spirit is settled and *qi* ascends, light emerges and the spirit manifests."*

Recite the incantation:

**Returning the Spirit Incantation**
*"Spirit returns to the spirit palace,
*Qi* returns to the cinnabar origin.
When summoned again, return as before,
All as in the original rite."*

After the incantation, visualize Marshal Liu, the Heavenly Lord, treading a wheel of fire, wielding a golden whip, descending from the Muddy Pellet Palace. Draw him in and return him to the spirit palace, inviting the spirit’s return.

*Guard this well, guard this well.*
*Sealed in accord with the* Cavernous Mystery Purple Empyrean Family Script.

**Thunder Incantation**
Thunder possesses generals, commanding wind and clouds.
Seizing and slaying demons, they fiercely aid the thunder’s might.
With my single summons, winds arise across ten thousand leagues.
*Hasten! Hasten! As the Azure Flower Supreme Thearch’s statutes and decrees command.*

**Thunder Talisman**
Inscribe the right talisman with the six characters *pili feng huo ting chi* (霹雳风火霆勑) as a seal. After use, recite the thunder-awakening incantation to activate it. Then intone:
*“By my decree, I summon the Central Heaven’s Thunder-Water Spirit.
At *zi* (子), the Earth’s Thunder-Fire Lord; at *wu* (午), the Altar’s Command unites the qi.
At *si* (巳), summon General So-and-so; in accord with the Vermilion Thearch’s talismanic mandate,
let the thunder resound at once, sweeping away demonic bandits. At *mao* (卯), behead and annihilate the malevolent spirits.
*Hasten! Hasten! As the Wind-Fire-Thunder-Rain Division’s authority compels.”*

**Depart at *wu* (午)**

**Lightning Talisman**
*Employ above the clouds—*
*Xuyuan □lun chi she* (欻垣□纶勑摄), *zi-wu* (子午), *Dou-Bi* (斗毕).

**Incantation**
*“Mighty and valiant Primordial Marshal, Kang Bo obeys the command.
Thunder executes its duty; at *wu* (午), thunder and rain issue forth.
Thunder, fire, lightning, and sun—Minister and Aide, hasten to act!
*Hasten! Hasten! As the statutes and decrees command.”*

**Further:**
*“Wind-Fire-Thunder Mandate, *pili feng huo ting chi* (霹雳风火霆敕).”*
Add the character *lei* (雷) above *yun* (云), then:
*“Thunder One, Thunder Two, Thunder Three, Thunder Four, Thunder Five.
Thunder Duke and Lightning Mother, Wind Earl and Rain Master.
Celestial Fire-Thunder Spirit, Terrestrial Fire-Thunder Spirit,
Yang Fire-Thunder Spirit, Yin Fire-Thunder Spirit—
the Five Thunders descend, binding demons and sealing spirits.
*Hasten! Hasten! As the statutes and decrees command.”*

**Recite again:**
*“□Spirit’s first revolution circles the heavens, □Ji (箕);
the second, the Purple Court births □Jiao (角);
the third, the Jade Armillary turns □Xing (星);
the fourth, yin’s light shines upon □Wu (乌);
the fifth, the Great Void moves □Lou (娄);
the sixth, thunder quakes □Jing (井);
the seventh, annihilates demonic calamities, swiftly eradicating misfortune and ghosts.
*Hasten! Hasten! As the Great Scarlet Heavenly Thearch’s statutes and decrees command.”*

**For talismans treating demons**, add this trigram above the character *lei* (雷).
Apply the Five Revolutions, infusing the Five Qi into the talisman.

**Shattering Pearl Talisman**
This talisman serves as the foundation; follow the preceding sequence, then augment it with the Eight Thunders.
Infuse with Fire Qi.

**Right Talisman**
Compose with the *Tianpeng* incantation; within, the *Xuhuo* (欻火) talisman is employed as needed.
Visualize the heart’s fire descending, kidney water ascending, merging with the ancestral qi,
which emerges from the Celestial Eye and is projected inward.
Once the talisman is complete, add the three characters *heng tian ba* (横天霸) at the talisman’s base, then strike the earth with a thunderous crash.

**Dispatching Incantation:**
*“How shall retribution be delivered?”*
If no response manifests, inscribe and dispatch the talisman anew as before,
directing the ancestral qi to emerge from the Celestial Eye, forming the three characters *cheng* (), *chou* (), and *chou* (),
and infusing them into the talisman, resplendent with golden light.

**For all manner of Wood-Demons, Mountain Specters, Five Penetrations, or entities manifesting wanton forms**,
inscribe this talisman in cinnabar, affix it to the head of the document, and burn it in the stove—
response is assured. At the moment of burning, a sound will resonate.
Profound and wondrous, profound and wondrous—do not employ it lightly.

**Wind-Thunder Division Incantation**
*“Jade Clarity swiftly summons General So-and-so of the Central Thunder Division.
At *si* (巳), the might of wind and rain’s soldiers; at *zi* (子), hasten to my left and right.
At *wu* (午), together slay the malevolent spirits.
*Slay! Hasten! Hasten! As the statutes and decrees command.”*

**Escort and Memorial Incantation**
*“By the Great Scarlet Heavenly Thearch’s mandate, I present the Jade Scripture’s edict.
At *zi* (子), General So-and-so of this day; at *si* (巳), fire swiftly pursues the soul.
At *chou* (丑), the hun-po returns to the living; at *mao* (卯), I execute the mandate to sweep them away.
If any dare defy this command, at *wu* (午), I shall report directly to the Thearch’s presence.
*Hasten! Hasten! As the Fire Mandate’s decree compels.”*

**Thunder-Awakening Augmented Incantation**
*“Jade Clarity’s salvation summons the Central Heaven’s Thunder, the Earth’s Thunder at *zi* (子),
the Yin Thunder at *chou* (丑), the Yang Thunder at *si* (巳), the Mountain Thunder at *wu* (午),
the Thunder Marshal at *chen* (辰), the Thunder Soldiers at *wu* (午), the Thunder Clerks,
and the Fierce Clerk Perfected Lord at *si* (巳).
At *mao* (卯), I uphold the Supreme Thearch’s statutes; at *wu* (午), fire swiftly resounds.
At *zi* (子), Mountain Specters and Wood-Demons are seized and transformed to dust.
At *zi* (子), stone spirits and earth qi; at *chou* (丑), execute and behead inauspicious forces.
At *wu* (午), the sagely deities of the Three Realms heed the command and comply.
Expel and eradicate demonic beings; at the command’s sound, they are overthrown.
When merit is fulfilled and virtue perfected, ascend together to the Jade Court.
*Hasten! Hasten! As the Jade Clarity Thearch’s decree commands.”*

**Central-Central Extraction**
Add the Eight Thunders to the right talisman.
Upon completion, append additional talismans and inscriptions as desired, recite the heart mantra,
dispatch the general into the talisman, and affix the title.
For the *Wind-Fire-Thunder Mandate* and other titles, adjust according to the gravity of the matter.

**Dispatch as before**, adding *Tianpeng* into the talisman. Inscribe only the three characters *Tianpeng Zhuang* (天蓬庄),
recite the *Tianpeng* incantation, apply cinnabar, and visualize the Fire Qi rising from the brush.

**This talisman is employed to behead major calamities**—inscribe it on tile.
First, burn white charcoal in the stove, then place the tile talisman atop the fire, burning it together with the document and memorial.
For beheading major calamities or urgent dispatches, add a talisman to the reverse of the document.

**For all purposes, its application is boundless.**

chunks.original_text: 敕天皇。 云雾雷令。 。 右用天蓬咒、九炁咒，涂。 遣心咒出将入符。 风符 巽炁入 唵。 苍舌绿齿，四目老翁，天丁力士，威南御凶。 急急如律令摄。 云符 乾炁入 唵。 天驺激戾，威北衔锋，三十万兵，卫我九重。 急急如律令敕。 雷符 震旡入 唵。 天蓬天蓬，九元杀童，五丁都司，高刀北翁。 急急如律令摄。 电符 离炁布 唵。 紫气乘天，丹霞赫冲，吞魔食鬼，横身饮风。 急急如律令摄。 雨符 坎炁人 刘概诽冷： 唵。 辟尸千里，祛却不祥，敢有小鬼，欲来现状。 急急如律令摄。 闭日阴符 右符闭四黑，收阳亢阴，造化书成。 存肾水上顶门，却念勑咒： 天黑雾起，子地黑雾起，卯日黑收光，坎月黑闭阴。 坎天黑雾起日不见，子地黑雾起闭幽灵，卯日黑风伯飞沙尘，坎月黑雨师驱雨轮。 坎急急如大赤天帝律令敕敕敕敕敕。 坎勒午出，五剔，念五敕字 收阳纵阴法 师运肾水，升上顶门。 次念闭四黑：晴开雨闭 □神一转周天度□箕，二转紫庭生□角，三转璇玑运□星，四转阴光发□乌，五转运太虚□娄，六转雷霆震□井，七转斩邪精旱魃，为灾疾速灭。 急急如元始天尊律令敕。 七转毕，仍於符背面，加雷符三道。 背面雷符一道 背面雷符二道 背面雷符三道 又名兴云雾符 右三符，如大杀伐，亦加此三道於背上。 治万病符 符成，加用卦画於雷字上，随某事加之。 如治某事，则加某卦震字上，亦好加。 八卦发用 雷火丰　　治邪鬼怪颠狂人催生亦宜服之 雷天大壮　治百病及催生 雷泽归妹　安精神安志意 水雷屯　治祟遣鬼祈雨斗盖五方炁布 雷水解　解秽治寒热咒水服 雷风恒　驱邪催生小儿夜啼用瓦书符安灶上 风雷益　治颠镇怪祈雨晴镇龙井用铁牌书 火雷噬嗑　祈晴摄祟附体治颠邪 符并用北斗名转了书盖雷字，后面写年月日时具法位盖之。 治病驱邪，宜仔细行持，正直无失。 凡治颠醒魂解秽，望空取炁一口，吹在符中，醋炭熏，妙。 勑符咒 唵哺□神乾咤魁魒摄。 咒毕，於雷字上念斗讳，七转涂震上，或雷上，加卦五转，斗咒敕五方炁入，书将名入事意盖之。 治颠醒魂，取火炁呵入，烧熏用油醋，烟冲病人立醒。 治妖怪，析雨，击龙井，并用铁牌镇之。 凡书符，取火炁一口，闭炁，一炁成符，然后书斗讳及卦。 法海遗珠卷之三竟 #1《太乙火府秘法》：据此书与《太乙火府五雷大法》、《太乙火府奏告祈禳仪》等言，太乙火府雷法传自华山陈搏，继为宗师者有刘浩然、许志高、杨耕云、黄云庄、叶玉田、黄澄心、陈清溪等。 《道法会元》卷一八八《太乙火府五雷大法》有南宋咸淳辛末年黄云庄所撰《法源事绩》，记述该振渊源、传承非常清晰，谓其法肇自中唐，以西蜀青城为祖庭，广播京师、江南，其徒甚众。 #2希夷陈真人：即华山陈搏。 据《法源事绩》希夷陈搏居华山，『得其接于石室中，此书传于西蜀。 』故该振奉其为祖师。 #3通玄刘真人：据《太乙火府五雷大法》载，刘系该派二代祖师。 号浩然，字仲方，讳晋。 为成都青城大面山丈人观观主，尝在观中收六天魔女，而显太乙秘法，曾奉南宗　高宗诏至京师治大内妖怪，阐教于青城，赐号通玄。 年一百五十而仙化。 #4伏魔许真人：据《太乙火府五雷大法》载，许系该派三代祖师，字志高，讳翊。

**Command the Celestial Sovereign.**

For the right [talismans], employ the *Tianpeng Incantation* and *Nine Qi Incantation*, then apply [them with liquid]. Dispatch the *Heart Incantation* to summon the generals and infuse the talismans.

**Wind Talisman**
Infuse with *Xun* qi:
*Oṃ.* Green-tongued, jade-toothed, four-eyed elder, Celestial Ding warrior, wielding might to subdue the south and quell evil. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command.

**Cloud Talisman**
Infuse with *Qian* qi:
*Oṃ.* Heavenly couriers stir fury, wielding blades to the north, three hundred thousand troops guarding my ninefold layers. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command.

**Thunder Talisman**
Infuse with *Zhen* qi:
*Oṃ.* Tianpeng, Tianpeng, Nine Primes’ slayer of youths, Five Ding marshals, High Blade of the Northern Elder. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command.

**Lightning Talisman**
Disperse with *Li* qi:
*Oṃ.* Purple qi ascends the heavens, crimson clouds surge fiercely, devouring demons and consuming ghosts, traversing the body to drink the wind. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command.

**Rain Talisman**
Infuse with *Kan* qi:
*Liu Gai Fei Leng:*
*Oṃ.* Banish corpses a thousand leagues, dispel misfortune. Should any petty ghost dare approach, let it manifest its form. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command.

**Yin Talisman for Sealing the Sun**
This talisman seals the four black [directions], gathering yang and restraining yin. Once the transformative script is complete, envision kidney water ascending to the crown of the head, then recite the command incantation:
*Heaven darkens with mist, the Zi earth darkens with mist, the Mao sun blackens to withdraw light, the Kan moon blackens to seal yin.*
*Kan heaven darkens with mist—sun unseen, Zi earth darkens with mist—sealing hidden spirits, Mao sun blackens—Wind Earl stirs dust, Kan moon blackens—Rain Master drives the rain wheel.*
*Kan, swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Great Crimson Celestial Emperor’s law and command! Command, command, command, command, command!*

**Kan restrains Wu, five excisions.** Recite the five command characters.

**Method for Gathering Yang and Releasing Yin**
The master circulates kidney water, ascending it to the crown of the head. Next, recite the *Sealing the Four Blacks*:
*Clear skies open, rain seals.*
*First revolution: the Dipper traverses the heavens, the Winnowing Basket.*
*Second revolution: the Purple Court generates the Horn [Star].*
*Third revolution: the Jade Armillary moves the Star.*
*Fourth revolution: yin light emits the Crow.*
*Fifth revolution: the Great Void moves the Straddler.*
*Sixth revolution: thunder quakes the Well [Star].*
*Seventh revolution: slay demonic drought spirits—disasters swiftly vanish.*
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Primordial Celestial Venerable’s law and command.

Once the seven revolutions are complete, inscribe three additional thunder talismans on the reverse side:

**Reverse-Side Thunder Talisman (First)**
**Reverse-Side Thunder Talisman (Second)**
**Reverse-Side Thunder Talisman (Third)**
Also named the *Talisman for Rousing Clouds and Mist*.

For these three talismans, when engaging in great battles or exorcisms, inscribe these three on the reverse as well.

**Talisman for Curing Myriad Illnesses**
Once the talisman is complete, add the trigrams above the "thunder" character, adapting them to the specific matter. For treating a particular ailment, inscribe the corresponding trigram above the *Zhen* character or "thunder," as appropriate.

**Applications of the Eight Trigrams**
- **Thunder-Fire Feng (䷶):** Treats malevolent ghosts, demonic possession, and mania; also aids in hastening childbirth.
- **Thunder-Heaven Great Strength (䷡):** Cures all illnesses and hastens childbirth.
- **Thunder-Marsh Returning Maiden (䷵):** Calms the spirit and stabilizes the will.
- **Water-Thunder Zhun (䷂):** Exorcises spirits, dispatches ghosts, prays for rain, and spreads the five directional qi for the *Dougai* ritual.
- **Thunder-Water Jie (䷧):** Purifies defilement, treats chills and fever; ingested as consecrated water.
- **Thunder-Wind Heng (䷟):** Drives away evil, hastens childbirth, and stops night crying in children (inscribe on tile and place above the stove).
- **Wind-Thunder Yi (䷩):** Treats mania, suppresses anomalies, prays for rain or clear skies, and subdues dragon wells (inscribe on iron plaques).
- **Fire-Thunder Shi Ke (䷔):** Prays for clear skies, seizes possessing spirits, and treats manic evil.

For all talismans, inscribe the names of the Northern Dipper’s stars, revolving them to seal the "thunder" character. On the reverse, write the year, month, day, hour, and the master’s rank before affixing the seal.

For treating illnesses and exorcising evil, proceed with meticulous care and upright conduct, avoiding errors.

**For treating mania, awakening the soul, and purifying defilement:** Gather a mouthful of qi from the void, blow it into the talisman, and fumigate with vinegar and charcoal—most efficacious.

**Incantation for Commanding Talismans**
*Oṃ bhu [ ] shén Qián zhà kuí piāo shè.*
After reciting the incantation, invoke the Dipper’s taboo name over the "thunder" character, revolving it seven times over *Zhen* or "thunder." Add the trigram five times, infuse the five directional qi with the Dipper incantation, inscribe the general’s name, and seal with the intent of the matter.

**For awakening the soul from mania:** Draw fire qi, exhale it into [the talisman], burn and fumigate with oil and vinegar—the smoke will rouse the afflicted instantly.

**For subduing demonic anomalies and splitting rain:** Strike the dragon well, using iron plaques to suppress them.

**For inscribing talismans:** Draw a mouthful of fire qi, hold the breath, and complete the talisman in one breath. Then inscribe the Dipper’s taboo name and the trigram.

*Dharma Sea’s Lost Pearls, Scroll Three concludes.*
*#1 "Secret Methods of the Taiyi Fire Mansion":* According to this text, *Taiyi Fire Mansion Thunder Rites*, and *Taiyi Fire Mansion Memorials for Prayer and Exorcism*, the Taiyi Fire Mansion Thunder Method traces its lineage to Chen Tuan of Mount Hua. Successive patriarchs include Liu Haoran, Xu Zhigao, Yang Gengyun, Huang Yunzhuang, Ye Yutian, Huang Chengxin, and Chen Qingxi.

*Comprehensive Anthology of Daoist Methods, Scroll 188, "Taiyi Fire Mansion Five Thunder Great Method"* contains *Records of the Dharma’s Origins and Achievements*, composed by Huang Yunzhuang in the Xianchun reign’s *xinyou* year (1271) of the Southern Song. It details the tradition’s origins and transmission, stating that the method originated in the mid-Tang dynasty, with Qingcheng Mountain in western Shu as its ancestral seat. It spread widely in the capital and Jiangnan, with many disciples.

*#2 Chen the True Man of Seclusion and Harmony (Xiyi):* Chen Tuan of Mount Hua. According to *Records of the Dharma’s Origins*, Chen Tuan resided on Mount Hua, "receiving the transmission in a stone chamber; this book was passed down in western Shu." Thus, the tradition venerates him as its founding patriarch.

*#3 Liu the True Man of Pervasive Mystery (Tongxuan):* According to *Taiyi Fire Mansion Five Thunder Great Method*, Liu was the second-generation patriarch of the lineage. Styled Haoran, courtesy name Zhongfang, personal name Jin. He served as abbot of the Zhangren Temple on Damianshan in Qingcheng, Chengdu. While at the temple, he subdued the Six Heavenly Demonesses, revealing the Taiyi secret methods. Summoned by Emperor Gaozong of the Southern School to the capital to exorcise palace demons, he propagated the teachings on Qingcheng and was granted the title *Tongxuan*. He ascended at the age of one hundred and fifty.

*#4 Xu the True Man of Subduing Demons (Fumo):* According to *Taiyi Fire Mansion Five Thunder Great Method*, Xu was the third-generation patriarch of the lineage. Styled Zhigao, personal name Yi.

According to *Records of the Dharma’s Origins*, Huang the True Man, styled Yixuan, was a native of Nanpu in Fujian. He studied the Dao under Yang Gengchang, mastering all his secrets.
