**Seated Practice**
At midnight, the hour of *zi*, rise and sit up. Don your robe, then rub your hands together until they grow scorching hot. Mimic washing your face, and wipe your eyes. Open them, exhale the turbid *qi* from your abdomen, and draw in pure *qi* through your nose to fill your heart and belly. Strike your teeth three times, and visualize your Original Destiny Perfected within your brows, standing in your likeness.

Next, recite the *Incantation for Gathering Spirits*:
*"True King within the radiance, your might shakes the Nine Heavens.
Hands cradle the Three Pristine, feet tread the Nine Mysteries.
Golden Tiger veils the sun, Azure Dragon coils the *Qian*.
Yellow Spirit wields iron, Green-Toothed lashes the whip.
Patrolling the Five Peaks, harmonizing the Seven Primes.
By imperial decree, I transform and prolong life.
Since the Great Ultimate first stirred, years have passed for me.
Now wielding talismanic command, I grasp authority’s thunder.
Wind and thunder clash, lightning roars in fury.
Dividing day from night, I examine ghosts to their roots.
Master of the Thunder Bureau—justice knows no bias.
All I command must obey my word.
Swift as the law’s decree!"*

After the incantation, visualize your primordial spirit ascending to pay homage to the True King. Three *cun* above the brows lies the True King’s palace. Next, envision the Ten Officials and Great Unity Perfected Lords encircling you.

Recite the next incantation:
*"Jade Clarity congeals brilliance, the Nine *Qi* arise naturally.
Transformations birth spirits across the Thirty-Six Heavens.
Sun and moon’s majestic light, thunder chariots vast as clouds.
Heaven azure, earth black—annihilate demons, purge spirits.
I now examine and judge, all heavens descend in audience.
Wind flies, lightning turns—ten thousand spirits obey.
Swift as the Primordial One *Qi* Heavenly Lord’s decree!"*

Next, visualize the nine *qi* of the liver, emerald-hued, ascending to coil around the *Milo* Heaven. Then envision the three *qi* of the south, crimson, merging with the heart to form golden *qi*, blending within the spleen’s palace. Briefly hold your breath, and exhale this golden *qi* from the spleen to encircle your body.

With both hands, first lift the left external kidney with your left hand. Hold your breath once, and visualize kidney water surging upward then descending, uniting with heart fire to coalesce at the navel wheel. Press your tongue against your lower teeth, awaiting the water’s rise and fire’s descent. Swallow into the lung’s palace, where golden light intertwines, forming a Perfected who ascends to pay homage to the Primordial Void Emperor.

Recite the *Lesser Golden Light Incantation*, swallow saliva three times, then stretch your hands to circulate the *qi* through mountains and peaks. The practice concludes—sleep as if in the outer Dipper.

**Rainbow Manifestation Method**
Before noon, face west; after noon, face east. Assume the thunder mudra with your hands, gaze at the sun, and recite:
*"Sun’s soul, vermilion radiance, gleams through green jade.
Crimson lads of returning mist, dark flames in whirlwind guise.
By my oral decree, swiftly reveal your true form!
A thousand-mile rainbow, five-colored barrier.
Swift by the Solar Emperor’s command!"*

Additional incantation:
*"Rainbow, appear swiftly! Rain divides east and west.
Hasten! Stretch across the sky! Fill the void!"*

After reciting, exhale three breaths—it will manifest instantly in the air.

**Shenxiao True Writ for Summoning Thunder and Invoking Rain**
Write every four characters as a separate line.

Use azure paper, one *chi* and six *cun* long, inscribed in cinnabar. Face the *xun* direction to summon thunder spirits. Cast it into a dragon pool or present it to the Thunder Bureau—responses are unfailing. Writing one or two characters can cure myriad illnesses, expel all malevolence, and ensure safe passage through storms, dragons, or other perils. Upon achieving mastery, wear it to ascend to the Jade Clarity Heaven of Shenxiao, becoming an attendant minister of the Golden Towers.

To treat madness or demonic afflictions, add the *Xuhuo* talisman—results are immediate.

**Convenient Talismans**
*Eastern Barbarian Thunder Envoy Ma Yulin, swiftly arise! Chen writ, eastern azure *qi*, inscribe and activate!*
*Southern Barbarian Thunder Envoy Guo Yuanjing, swiftly arise! Wu writ, southern crimson *qi*, inscribe and activate!*
*Western Barbarian Thunder Envoy Fang Zhonggao, swiftly arise! You writ, western white *qi*, inscribe and activate!*
*Northern Barbarian Thunder Envoy Deng Gongchen, swiftly arise! Zi writ, northern black *qi*, inscribe and activate!*
*Central Barbarian Thunder Envoy Tian Yuanzong, swiftly arise! Slaying writ, Heaven’s Gate *qi*, inscribe and activate!*

*"Open Heaven’s Gate to rouse wind and clouds!
Shatter Earth’s Door to stir thunder and lightning!
Shoulder the sky’s might, break through with straight force!
Water Court’s Gate detains mortals, births all things!
Seal demon paths—Fengdu’s eight directions bow in submission!
Exterminate the hordes of souls!"*

**Jade Clarity True King’s Decree: Five Thunders’ Command**
*"Six Wave Heavenly Lord, descend rain in torrents!
Wood Youth Great Spirit, Great Unity Perfected, swiftly arrive!
August Rain Department, pour down like a deluge!
Lord, lightning flashes! Thunder’s rope-light illumines the Eight Poles, pervades the Four Seas!
Azure Lads, Azure Lads, raise clouds and snatch lightning!
Eight directions bridle rainbows! Stretch across the sky to drink wind!
Whip dragons, bind the hideous, behead ghosts, erase traces!
Heaven’s might, act swiftly! Si writ!
Rain and thunder, swiftly arise! Zhen writ!
Dragon thunder, swiftly rise! Chen writ!
Heavenly thunder erupts! Divine thunder erupts! Dragons, hasten!
Thunder erupts! Water thunder erupts! Earth’s decree: Barbarian thunder, erupt swiftly!
Swiftly obey the Celestial Emperor’s decree to summon Fire Thunder Lord!"*

Recite the *Mud-Coating Incantation*:
*"Turn the sea’s spirit drum, dance the wind, drive the Five Dragons!
Unlock the key, surge the rivers, roar the floods!
Xuhuo Lord, three mountains’ might, stone springs flow!
Steam thick rain, vanguard against drought—Thunder’s merit!
Swiftly descend! Om hum hum kṣit khaṭ!"*

*"Wind, clouds, thunder, rain, lightning!
Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth—Five Stars descend true *qi*!"*

With your right hand form the *tian* character, with your left the *yi* and *zhen* characters. Silently circulate water and fire to overcome thunder, rubbing twenty-four times until your palms grow hot. Channel enraged *qi* into the talisman, silently leading the Thunder Marshal and all bureaus to the altar.

Decree:
*"By Tianpeng’s decree, descend rain in torrents!"*

chunks.original_text: 天灵地灵，六甲六丁。 风伯雨师，五雷神兵。 电母威光，霹雳将军。 随符奔去，速伐鬼精。 急急如律令。 太乙三山大木郎神咒 乾精流辉玉池东，盟威圣者名青童。 掷火万里坎震宫，勇骑迅发来太蒙。 混沌凿开透崆峒，绿波擎天转勾戎。 青华密旨令司封，总领符命下皇宫。 木郎太乙三山雄，上奉玄微循至恭。 歙欻驱雷起垊，霹雳破石泉源通。 坤至巽户皓灵翁，流晶郁光奔祝融。 猛马四张欻火冲，巨乘太华登云中。 金锤玉铁烁火弓，惊天鼗鼓呜冬冬。 天罡大圣降真聪，神霄符命耀灵通。 震击万邪无遗踪，我今奉命召雷公。 东西南北欻火丛，旗旛昼下扬虚空。 修罗隔日回桑雍，毗离使者田元庸。 鲲尾摆动天纸，炎帝蒸雨屯云浓。 须臾坎位黑气隆，虚皇赫烜射双瞳。 阏伯撼动昆仑峰，驱雷掣电跨火龙。 飞沙走石扬虚空，幽灵翻海玄冥同。 冯夷鼓舞长呼风，织女四哥号前锋。 句娄吉利赶苍龙，丁辛滴昔握帝锺。 盟威使者霜凝冬，玉光童子长舂舂。 哑□啧恕号穹窿，蠢明期灭焚毒蚣。 黄利持剑斩□，汉臣奉命阅汝躬。 蓬莱弱水兴都功，瀛洲仙仗回玎。 玉府令下无懒慵，百司捧檄无不从。 天雷隐隐撞金钟，神雷威烈摧帡幪。 龙雷震动天火红，水雷鼓浪海盈充。 社令击伐妖孽丛，离阳旱魃灭其踪。 隅康长弩扫霓虹，六一捷疾先御凶。 朱发巨翅双目瞳，雷电吐毒驱五龙。 四溟霭霭罗阴重，随吾禹步降灵通。 震响天地皆匆匆，斩馘旱灵诸魔宗。 火光一撒万里红，烧尽邪魔无尘踪。 符命一到即雨通，起发雷电鼓冬冬。 驱驾雷部黑雨从，一声四海皆蒙蒙。 金华兑泽飞肃雍，坎肇离伦勑玄宗。 水文催变天门颙，电光迸空烈焰烘。 公宾统戟降共工，雨阵所至川流洪。 霹雳大震环海中，君亮元皇号前锋。 商羊呼呣云髻松，赤鸡紫鹅翻金笼。 流丹瑞气将蒙茸，天门九重垂丹枫。 泰山丈人将逢蒙，南岳衡灵领赤松。 西华金天役四凶，恒山黑陶惊郁供。 中弥五曜朝天嵩，百神降空驰神驄。 咄遮鸠罗诛飞虫，冰鸠暖寮石阿雄。 执圭延年贞耳熊，昊猛黄荆钊振宗。 荣雄圭延闪鸠蓬，思全子真威天公。 洞渊二祖回帝衷，持夫使者横吹空。 天魔塞道无相攻，芙蓉锦江歌崆峒。 神霄察人善恶悰，玉札大驱雷神众。 斩馘虎豹诛狞狨，无鞅将吏忧心憧。 一心顶戴礼玉容，诸天列宿无错综。 万象皆属璇玑宗，运水使者来往中。 天泽降下长溶溶，辅我道法日兴隆。 辅我救旱变时丰，辅我救旱功勋隆。 万邪杀伐灭其踪，万物成就归陶镕，天荣共享功无穷。 勑南极紫皇元君降。 急急如火令摄。 又勑咒 都天大雷公，霹雳震虚空。 刀兵三十万，炎赫紫洞中。 敢有不伏者，严令辄不容。 摄赴魁罡下，永为清静风。 急急如律令。 遣咒

chunks.translated_text:
**Quiet Stabilization and Talisman Inscription**
In stillness, inscribe these two characters—*hēng* and *xián*—within the circle. Once the talisman is complete, recite the *Celestial Numen’s Splendor Mantra*. Draw in the eastern *qi*, then trace the following sequence: *gé-sì-zhèng-chén-jī-mǎo-gāng-yín-héng*, marking each on the thumb—first the upper joint, then the middle, then the root. Repeat and inscribe the *shà* character.

**The Divine Empyrean’s Supreme Dao: Transmission of the Divine Empyrean’s Vibrant Teachings**

**Arcane Secrets of Thunder’s Mechanism**
**The Flying *Gang* and Interlocking *Qian* for Deploying the Dipper**

The Fire Master said: The Jade Clarity’s hidden language, the Primordial Origin’s secret texts—these are not for the uninitiated to hear. Once, the True King of Jade Clarity transmitted them to the Five Marchmounts’ Elders, who then passed them to the world.

Thunder and lightning are the *qi* of yin and yang clashing fiercely. There is the divine being Xie Xianhuo, the supreme commander of the seventy-two divisions of wind and fire. And there is the mighty spirit Deng Bowen, who wields the authority to issue decrees, burn demonic shrines, topple temples, summon rain, and command clear skies—he is the marshal of the Thunder Department’s statutes and ordinances.

Those who uphold this method must practice it with care. Each year, during the three days before and after the *Jingzhe* (Awakening of Insects) festival in mid-spring, when thunder first sounds, enter profound meditation and transform the spirit as prescribed. Fill yourself with the *gang qi*, purify the viscera, and amplify divine might.

Next, form the Five Thunder Seal, retract the claws and conceal the nails, cross the arms at the waist, sit upright, and with a stern voice and fierce countenance, shake the Gate of Heaven. Draw in the *qi* of lightning to align with the yang’s nine-by-nine configuration. From the earth gate, gather the *qi* of thunderfire to correspond with the yin’s six-by-six completion. Seize the lightning and flying thunder, and contain them within the primordial palace. Conceal them in the *Kan* trigram; whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, maintain this practice.

Whenever thunder and lightning converge, act without delay. With sufficient *qi*, you may summon thunder in broad daylight, and it will naturally respond. In spring and summer, visualize the Wind Earl and Rain Master, the Thunder Duke and Lightning Mother, descending swiftly from the sky. In autumn and winter, envision thunder and lightning emerging from the stars and constellations.

For regular use, dispatch an observer to note the direction from which ominous clouds or malevolent winds arise. The ritual master then gathers primordial *qi*, hurls lightning, and roars thunder toward that direction, releasing it from the crown of the head. The response will arrive within an hour. After three years of practice, every invocation will yield immediate results.

When summoning thunder, form the Five Thunder Seal and issue the command from *xū-hài* to *shēn*. Once the method is mastered, practice diligently to wield Heaven’s authority, succor the people and all beings, and expel demonic forces—this is no trifling matter.

The adept’s spirit merges with the divine, and their essence flows in communion with Heaven and Earth. Though Heaven and Earth are said to be eighty-four thousand *li* apart, the adept’s spirit traverses this distance within their own body. Thus, the myriad transformations arise within the self, and the cosmos rests in the palm of the hand.

Reflect deeply upon this, guard it well, and do not disclose it to the unworthy. The Dao does not betray those who attain it; through diligent effort and unwavering focus, one naturally achieves transcendence.

**Master Wan’s Transmission** states: Thunder withdraws its voice in the eighth month, concealing itself beneath the *Kun* earth. From the eighth month (*yǒu*) to the tenth (*hài*), it nurtures within the three yin. From the eleventh month (*zǐ*) to the first (*yín*), it matures within the three yang. Only after the interplay of three yin and three yang does it resound in the second month (*mǎo*), marking the inception of Heaven and Earth’s generation and the first stirrings of all things. It must extend its pent-up emotions and release its stagnant *qi*, causing the pulse of Heaven and Earth to quake and the vitality of life to flow. Without great power, such a vast release would be impossible. After half a year of accumulation, it erupts in a single day—nothing in the myriad things can resist it, for it is the earth’s surplus blackness venting forth.

Thus, the day of its emergence is not arbitrary: it may be *wù-jǐ*, *chén-xū-chǒu-wèi*, or the day of *Lìchūn* (Beginning of Spring), all tied to the earth’s resonance with the cyclical signs of generation. Though exceptions exist, eight or nine out of ten cases align with this pattern. This is why the sages of old drew upon these correspondences to model the divine thunder’s fire.

For when the first yang returns and takes form beneath *wù-jǐ*, its momentum becomes irresistible. Thus, the creative forces of half a year’s decree must be nurtured in concealment for another half-year before their power is realized—how could this be a shallow matter?

**Lightning Incantation**
*Lightning, lightning,*
emerging from the *Kan* direction.
Spewing fire for ten thousand *li*,
ascending to the Celestial Palace.
I invoke the Emperor’s salvation,
drawing it into the heart’s sovereign.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as lightning seizes!*

**Jade Emperor’s Personal Mechanism Talisman and Mudra**
Wind as Heaven, *yín* fire as Earth,
* sì* the sun and moon as conduits,
*shēn* the four mountains to command and restrain.
*hài* mountain’s fire blazes,
*yín* mountain’s fire blazes,
*mǎo* severs, *chén* severs, *sì* annihilates, *sì* seizes.
At *wǔ*, thunderfire emerges—point backward and flick once.

**By Decree of the Three Clarities’ Emperors:**
Jade Clarity’s Supreme Emperor,
Supreme Clarity’s Supreme Emperor,
Grand Clarity’s Great Emperor,
Thunder Ancestor’s True August Emperor.

**Constellation Decrees:**
*Jiǎo, Kàng, Dǐ, Fáng, Xīn, Wěi, Jī,*
*Dǒu, Niú, Nǚ, Xū, Wēi, Shì, Bì,*
*Kuí, Lóu, Wèi, Mǎo, Bì, Zī, Shēn,*
*Jǐng, Liǔ, Xīng, Zhāng, Guǐ, Yì, Zhěn.*

**Five Planets’ True Lords:**
Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth Star Lords.
Palace of the Sun, Palace of the Moon.
Eastern Well and *Jī* Envoys, Thunder Duke,
Twenty-Four *Qi* Thunder Dukes, Twelve Hourly Thunder Dukes,
Thirty-Six Celestial Dragon Thunder Hosts.

**Thunder Summons:**
Heavenly Thunder, rise swiftly!
Water Thunder, rise swiftly!
Dragon Thunder, rise swiftly!
Divine Thunder, rise swiftly!
Earth Altar Thunder, rise swiftly!
As Heaven and Earth darken and sun and moon lose their light,
the Five Directions’ Thunder Gods descend swiftly to the Mystic Altar’s precinct.

Close the eyes, rotate nine times, and with a single stroke ascend past the character *shān*.

**Incantation:**
First rotation: the cosmos quakes.
Second rotation: fierce winds arise swiftly.
Third rotation: yin thunder merges.
Fourth rotation: the Great Monad’s *Lí* Palace.
Fifth rotation: the Five Thunders rise swiftly.
Sixth rotation: thunderbolts surge and strike.
Seventh rotation: the Jade Talisman descends.
Eighth rotation: the myriad spirits hasten to obey.
Ninth rotation: thunder, lightning, wind, and rain—
flying sand and hurtling stones—
burst forth from the earth gate,
descend to the altar’s seat,
hear the command and act,
dare not disobey the decree!

chunks.original_text: 雷祖真皇大帝劫降呜雷律令。 咒毕，抬诀就掷笔，指震巽速应，指离三时应，指坎兑坤不应，指乾艮半应。 玉帝亲机咒 金阙命令，颁降玄真。 亲机垣赫，天地皆惊。 玉符真字，点画分明。 一咒斗黑，再咒日冥。 七咒电掣，霹雳震声。 金符才至，不得久停。 万魔皆折，化作微尘。 急急如玉帝敕摄。 四十九遍 雷霆要妙 阴阳大煞最通灵，祷雨祈晴顷刻生。 玉帝亲机留秘诀，谪仙方始得留传。 不将文字飞金阙，举目长呼闪电倾。 披发步呈寻煞炁，剑尖然火爇真文。 须臾只见长空黑，仿髴之时起火云。 霹雳一声天地震，阎浮处处避天声。 雷霆玉经绿水内功#1 绿水青波湛湛清， 先步豁落斗，至天英星，结伽坐星，两手握固，掐亥文，以口吸上肾炁，入心府交会，却叩华池三十六咽，存神水清明。 千斤斧刃背头轻。 以两手按坐，存千筋脉络皆通，神水自复脊骨度，白虎河车直至泥丸宫顶门。 傍河柳树风吹倒， 存见天树倒天池上，下至十二楼，入三关。
chunks.translated_text:
The Thunder Ancestor, True August Emperor, descends with thunderous decree by the karmic law. The incantation complete, raise the mudra and cast the brush—point toward *Zhèn* and *Xùn* for swift response, toward *Lí* for response within three hours, toward *Kǎn*, *Duì*, and *Kūn* for no response, toward *Qián* and *Gèn* for partial response.

The Jade Emperor’s personal mechanism incantation,
the Golden Watchtower’s command,
issues forth to the Mystic True.
The personal mechanism blazes with majesty,
heaven and earth both tremble.
The Jade Talisman’s true characters,
each stroke distinct and clear.
Once invoked, the Dipper darkens;
twice invoked, the sun dims.
Seven invocations, lightning flashes,
thunderclaps shake the heavens.
The moment the golden talisman arrives,
it must not linger long.
The myriad demons all shatter,
reduced to fine dust.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Jade Emperor’s decree commands.

Forty-nine recitations—
the thunder’s essential subtlety:
Yin and yang’s great executioner, most efficacious,
pray for rain or beseech clear skies, and it manifests in an instant.
The Jade Emperor’s personal mechanism preserves the secret formula;
only the banished immortal may transmit it.
Without sending written words to the Golden Watchtower,
one lifts their gaze and cries aloud—lightning crashes down.
Disheveled, they pace the steps to seek the *sha* qi,
the sword’s tip ignites with fire to burn the true script.
In an instant, the vast sky blackens,
and in that fleeting moment, fire-clouds arise.
A single thunderclap shakes heaven and earth,
and in every realm of *Jambudvīpa*, all flee the celestial roar.

**Thunder and Jade Canon: Green Water’s Internal Workings #1**
Green waters, blue waves, limpid and clear,
first step through the *Huòluò* Dipper,
reach the Celestial Flower Star,
assume the *vajra* seated posture,
clench both fists firmly,
press the *Hài* seal,
and with the mouth, draw in the upper kidney *qi*,
unite it with the heart’s palace,
then tap the *Huáchí* thirty-six times and swallow,
visualizing the divine water’s clarity.

A thousand-catty axe’s blade, light upon the back.
Press both hands to the seat,
visualize the thousand sinews and meridians all unobstructed,
the divine water naturally ascending the spine,
the White Tiger’s river chariot reaching the *Níwán* Palace at the crown.
Willows by the riverbank, blown down by the wind—
visualize the celestial tree toppling into the celestial pond,
descending through the Twelve Towers,
entering the Three Passes.

chunks.original_text: 柳，星名。 天池，额也。 抱着姮娥也不惊。 以两手相叉，於脐下兜定，有神水灌溉五脏不泄，有姹女居中制神水。 白时白如天上雪， 以两手结五雷印，口中吐风云，出巽户震宫，会合天雷风，自坎至兑过巽出也。 红时红似猩猩血。 以两手雷局，舌为雷斧，胆为霹雳，心为效火，领五炁，兴雷雨，出天门，彻巽户，为风云，际会造化，两手雷局，从胁至头，起手挑诀。 轻时轻如空裹尘， 诸神既出，两手络中指中，集脾神守舍。 重时重如千斤铁。 再两手五雷诀，收所出诸神入，各变雷霆正真之炁覆身，是谓冲悦身已重千斤也。 织女四哥， 二十八宿，土蝠是也。 领八方八卦雷神，在吾身八节手足即是也。 句娄吉利。 八卦之姓名，以二雷火相合，下坐雷神拥从。 急急如雷霆欻火律令。 即持令牌上坛，化效火印信符命合同。 右咒五遍，取巽方真雷炁五口入茶内，存神光紫炁注入，换午诀，移丁向面南，念： 持运迦持。 家车大火输，南方丙丁摄。 真火疾降。 右咒三遍，吸南方火炁三口，吹入茶内，变神，破地罡，默召雷神，咒事意，献茶，焚合同符命并牒文合明天帝符、大煞雷符，用阳光阴光印、合同印，乃风云雷雨电总印也。 再步破地罡，不念破地罡咒，但内作用雷神三步罡诀。 默念起雷咒： 唵。 啮□□□吽□□萨婆诃。 呼唬呼唬嚧呼嚧呼轰轰轰。 又咒 青帝之巾，赤帝之节，白帝之衣，黑帝之勒。 黄帝之孙，太昊之职。 来自无来，去向无域。 出为风雷，动为霹雳。 火星奔驰，雷光垣赫。 鬼哭神愁，天地昏黑。 日月交会，阴阳顺则。 吾佩天印，奉帝之敕。 召汝变化，汝急动息。 真炁聚手，速速急急。 准真王便宜运雷律令勑。 动已五岳四渎，想欻火扇动，天地皆黑也。 丙丁神，勑摄灵。 轩辕命欻火，急急从吾行。 想效火自东南而下降坛前。 离吉利，娄吉利。 轩辕命欻火，急急随吾行。 想雷神从五方乘黑云，上冲霄汉。 默念运雷咒。 唵。 玉帝嚤呢总雷吽咤钵呵摄。 驱雷伐恶致雨咒坎至午 太玄皓师离火精，结阴聚阳守雷城。 阏伯风火澄渊庭，作雨兴雹起幽灵。 飘诸太华命公宾，上帝有勑急速行。 收阳降雨顷刻生，驱雷掣电出玄泓。 我今奉勑急速行。 此乃天帝命君名， 敢有违者罪不轻。 急急如律令。 用此符咒驱邪治病祈祷，皆可行之。 务在精心虔恭，无有不感不灵也。 运雷密咒 唵。 嘿咧□雷兵吽吽□哩不见形摩呢帝勑。 吼煞合猛将烈神都摄。 邪魔化作微尘。 右两手雷局，东北炁吹，想黑云中雷公电母神雷哮吼。 去某处行雨，或往患人身中打邪鬼。 阳光咒 相从三界，首赴元洪。 江波化命，微听玄穹。 隐藏之日，惊动炁浓。 普化人天，邪不敢当。 急急如雷霆律令。 阴光咒 波流胁真江，河伯仙真火，仙炎洪通真。 急速摄。 阴阳雷霆停天太岁煞方起例 甲子寻猜甲戌寅，甲申辰上起分明。 甲午离宫甲寅戌，甲辰申上好安身。 逆行隔一宫闻之子丑冤雠路，次第逢之不可行。 唯有丑寅连位去，逢癸之年跳两辰。 若起雷霆激出煞，金刚犯着也成尘。 且如甲寅旬十年，太岁从戌上逆行。 跳一官至寅上，即是戊午年头，太岁便於太岁上起，正月逆行连官数去，寻见本月，便从月上顺行连官数去，起亥时数至卯，即是霆煞。
chunks.translated_text:
The willow is a star’s name. The Celestial Pond is the forehead. Even if embracing Chang’e, one remains unstartled.

Clasp both hands together, cupping them below the navel, where divine water irrigates the five viscera without leakage, and the Alchemical Maiden resides within to govern the divine water.

When white, it is white as snow in the heavens.
Form the Five Thunder Seal with both hands, and from the mouth exhale wind and clouds, issuing from the *Xùn* Gate and *Zhèn* Palace, converging with celestial thunder and wind, passing from *Kǎn* to *Duì* and exiting through *Xùn*.

When red, it is red as the blood of the crimson ape.
With both hands in the Thunder Formation, the tongue becomes the thunder axe, the gallbladder the thunderclap, and the heart the verifying fire. Lead the five *qi*, summon thunder and rain, emerge from the Celestial Gate, penetrate the *Xùn* Gate to become wind and clouds, and harmonize with the workings of creation. From the flanks to the head, raise the hands in the Thrusting Seal.

When light, it is light as dust in the void.
Once all spirits have emerged, interlock the middle fingers of both hands and gather the spirit of the spleen to guard its abode.

When heavy, it is heavy as a thousand-catty iron.
Again form the Five Thunder Seal with both hands, drawing back all emitted spirits, each transforming into the *qi* of true thunder and covering the body—this is called the "Joyous Surge," and the body now weighs a thousand catties.

The Weaving Maid and the Fourth Brother—
these are the Twenty-Eight Constellations, specifically the Earth Bat.
Lead the thunder spirits of the eight directions and eight trigrams, who reside in the eight nodes of the body—hands and feet.

*Jùlóu jílì.*
These are the names of the eight trigrams. With the union of the two thunder fires, the thunder spirits below sit in attendance.

*Hasten, hasten, as the law of thunder and sudden fire commands!*
Hold the command tablet and ascend the altar, transforming and verifying the fire seal, credentials, and joint decrees.

Recite the right-hand incantation five times, drawing five breaths of true thunder *qi* from the *Xùn* direction into the tea, visualizing divine radiance and purple *qi* infusing it. Shift to the *Wǔ* Seal, turn *Dīng* toward the south, and intone:
*Chíyùnjiāchí.*
*Jiāchē dàhuǒ shū, nánfāng bǐngdīng shè.*
*True fire descends swiftly.*

Recite the right-hand incantation thrice, inhale three breaths of southern fire *qi*, and blow them into the tea to transform the spirits. Break the Earthly Stem, silently summon the thunder spirits, and present the tea with the joint decree, burning the credentials along with the memorial text, the Celestial Emperor’s Talisman, and the Great Slaying Thunder Talisman. Use the Yang Light Seal, Yin Light Seal, and Joint Decree Seal—these are the master seals of wind, clouds, thunder, rain, and lightning.

Again step the Earth-Breaking Stem, omitting its incantation, and internally perform the Three-Step Stem Seal of the thunder spirits. Silently recite the Thunder-Raising Incantation:
*Oṃ. Nyeḥ □□□ hūṃ □□ sarva-buddha-svāhā.*
*Xūxū xūxū lúlū xū lúlū xū hōnghōnghōng.*

Also recite:
The Green Emperor’s kerchief,
the Red Emperor’s staff,
the White Emperor’s robe,
the Black Emperor’s bridle.
The Yellow Emperor’s grandson,
the Grand Brilliance’s office.
Coming from non-coming,
departing toward no realm.
Emerging as wind and thunder,
stirring as thunderclaps.
Fire stars race,
thunder’s light blazes.
Ghosts wail, spirits grieve,
heaven and earth darken.
Sun and moon conjoin,
yin and yang align in order.
I bear the Heavenly Seal,
by the Emperor’s decree.
I summon you to transform—
respond swiftly, cease delay.
True *qi* gathers in hand,
hasten, hasten, swiftly, swiftly!
By the authority of the True King’s Convenient Thunder Law.

Once the Five Peaks and Four Waterways are stirred, visualize the sudden fire fanning, and heaven and earth turn black.

*Bǐngdīng* spirits, by decree seize the numinous.
Xuanyuan commands the sudden fire—
hasten, hasten, follow my steps!
Visualize the verifying fire descending from the southeast before the altar.

*Lí jílì, lóu jílì.*
Xuanyuan commands the sudden fire—
hasten, hasten, follow my steps!
Visualize the thunder spirits from the five directions riding black clouds, surging into the celestial vastness.

Silently recite the Thunder-Moving Incantation:
*Oṃ. Yùdì mó ní zǒng léi hōng zhà bō hē shè.*

The Rain-Summoning, Evil-Expelling Incantation from *Kǎn* to *Wǔ*:
The Supreme Mystery’s Radiant Master, essence of *Lí* fire,
binds yin and gathers yang to guard the Thunder City.
*Yànbó*’s wind and fire settle the abyssal court,
bringing rain, raising hail, rousing hidden spirits.
Command the lofty Hua, summon the Duke’s guests—
the Emperor decrees: act swiftly!
Gather yang to descend rain in an instant,
drive thunder, wield lightning from the dark abyss.
I now carry out the decree with haste.
This is the name the Celestial Emperor commands—
dare any disobey? The crime is not light!
*Hasten, hasten, as the law commands!*

This talisman and incantation may be employed to expel evil, cure illness, and offer prayers. Success lies in wholehearted reverence—none shall fail to be moved or remain unresponsive.

The Thunder-Moving Secret Incantation:
*Oṃ. Hēi liè □ léi bīng hōng hōng □ lǐ bù jiàn xíng mó ní dì chì.*
*Roaring slaying, fierce generals, vehement spirits—all are seized!*
*Evil demons are reduced to fine dust.*

With both hands in the Thunder Formation, blow *qi* from the northeast, visualizing within the black clouds the Thunder Duke and Lightning Mother, the divine thunder roaring. Proceed to a designated place to bring rain, or to the afflicted person’s body to strike evil spirits.

The Yang Light Incantation:
Following the Three Realms,
first hasten to the Primordial Vastness.
River waves transform destiny,
subtly heed the dark heavens.
On the day of concealment,
stir the thick *qi*.
Universally transforming humans and heavens,
evil dare not oppose.
*Hasten, hasten, as the law of thunder commands!*

The Yin Light Incantation:
Waves flow beside the true river,
River Earl, immortal true fire,
immortal flame, vast penetrating truth.
*Seize swiftly!*

The Method for Halting Yin-Yang Thunder and Activating the Grand Year’s Slaying Direction:
*Jiǎzǐ* seeks *chái* in *jiǎxū* and *yín*,
*jiǎshēn* and *chén* clearly mark the start.
*Jiǎwǔ* in the *Lí* Palace, *jiǎyín* in *xū*,
*jiǎchén* and *shēn* are fine positions.
Moving counterclockwise, skipping one palace, one hears of enmity’s path in *zǐ* and *chǒu*—
proceeding in order, one must not act.
Only when *chǒu* and *yín* connect in sequence may one go;
in a *guǐ* year, leap two celestial stems.
If thunder is raised to excite the slaying force,
even a vajra will be reduced to dust.

For example, in the *jiǎyín* decade of ten years, the Grand Year moves counterclockwise from *xū*. Leaping one palace to *yín*, this is the *wùwǔ* year’s beginning. The Grand Year then starts from its position, moving counterclockwise through consecutive palaces to find the current month. From the month, proceed clockwise through consecutive palaces, beginning the count at the *hài* hour and continuing to *mǎo*—this is the thunder-slaying direction.

chunks.original_text: 起处为雷，止处为霆。 起月例 太岁支辰便起正，逆来寻月要知情。 本月将住时加亥顺，起处为雷煞数至卯宫是煞神心止处煞为霆若起雷霆激出煞，金刚犯着也成尘。 雷霆金虎流火凶星日时大煞起例#2 甲乙居坤戊癸西，顺飞甲子细寻推。 乙庚离位逆甲子，丁壬巽上顺行移。 巽上起甲子丙辛震动雷声，逆飞入中宫仔细推。 看逆顺先起飞六甲，但看日辰所属，在甚甲内，便以此旬甲头寻数，至本日日辰住处，便从日辰上加起子时，数至所用时，即是大煞所临之方也。 顺则顺行，逆则逆行，但到中官，并寄坤位用事。 假令戊午年七月十三日庚申日为例，起逆行甲子，便自午上起六甲，甲子、甲戌、甲申、甲午、甲辰、甲寅、甲寅，在巽震上，起乙卯，遁到所用日辰上，便就此加子时，遁到所用时辰，即是大煞。 余仿此例甲子一旬是，甲头不用寻，六甲便从乙丑数去。 飞煞炁诀 甲已龙飞鸡正啼，辰酉出乙庚虎啸怕羊飞。 寅出未丙辛猴犬同其炁。 申戌出丁壬南宫坎户归。 午子出戊癸雷从兑宫发，卯酉出天雷杀伐盛天机。 天下邪魔皆怕惧，霹雳从空电掣辉。 如甲已日，金虎暗雷在辰，巳日在酉，即对此方步斗，依法焚符，叱叱之。 变用风火令罡 第一常用治鬼 第二祈雨 第三祈晴 第四祈雪 第五起雷 太上皇老帝君说运雷天童真经 启经咒 天之所育，地之所成。 一受灵符，已得长生。 神仙辅我，玉女佐形。 上清无极，捕鬼天丁。 断邪仆射，收摄邪精。 随声降下，侍卫身形。 所犯吮者，诛刑。 有一不从，雷斧速诛。 急急如皇老帝君律令。 运雷经 太上曰： 皇天生我，皇地载我，日月照我，罗致神王，罗魔神王。 星辰荣我， 诸仙举我，罗根神王，罗和神王。 司命与我，太乙任我，罗呼神王， 罗迦神王。 玉宸召我，三官保我，罗吸神王，罗世神王。 五帝卫我， 北辰相我，罗江神王，罗枳神王。 南极佑我，北斗辅我，罗须神王， 罗灵神王。 三台护我，四圣助我，呵罗神王，呵植神王。 金童侍我， 玉女从我。 呵修神王，呵僧神王。 六甲直我，六丁进我，呵卒神王， 呵婆神王。 天门开我，地户通我，呵妙神王，呵提神王。 山泽容我， 江河渡我，呵式神王，呵枝神王。 风雨送我，雷电随我，呵呮神王， 呵法神王。 八卦遵我，九宫遁我，波耶神王，波政神王。 阴阳宗我， 四时成我，波罗神王，波摄神王。 五行扶我，我命着我，波斗神王， 波伽神王。 太清玄籍，三宫升降，波普神王，波稽神王。 上下往来， 无穷不息。 波竟神王，波弥神王。 金饭玉浆，向求皆至，波既神王， 波澄神王。 虚梵日月，与天为誓，五帝雷公，阴阳雷公。 □□□□， □□□星，四令雷公，六甲雷公。 唵嚤咤瀶，唵咭□咤，霹雳雷公， 发水雷公。 嚤摄馘哪，唵咽炁和，八风雷公，十雨雷公。 中养三魂， 内育七魄，六道雷公，闪电雷公。 雷公电母，随鼓而击，兴风雷公， 行雨雷公。 铜爪唵飞，羽毛咤摄，五岳雷公，四读雷公。 唵冲南北， 摄至东西，八节雷公，六候雷公。 临色灰，馘逐飞空，大川雷公， 溪谷雷公。 黄中理炁，黑暗荡荡，江河雷公，四海雷公。 震起斗牛， 笑奔鬼愁，呜鼓雷公，轰轮雷公。 三令闭塞，五申徘徊，火车雷公， 火轮雷公。 金神腾驾，木郎大神，移山雷公，走石雷公。
chunks.translated_text:
Where it begins is the thunder, where it ceases is the lightning.
**Method for Determining the Starting Month:**
The Grand Year’s earthly branch marks the start of the first month.
Moving counterclockwise, seek the current month to know its position.
From the month’s position, proceed clockwise beginning at the *hài* hour;
the starting point is the thunder-slaying force, counting to the *mǎo* palace where the slaying spirit’s heart resides.
Where it ceases, the slaying becomes lightning.
If thunder and lightning are raised to excite the slaying force,
even a vajra will be reduced to dust.

**Directions for Major Slaying Forces on Inauspicious Days and Hours (Metal Tiger, Flowing Fire, and Malevolent Stars):**
*Jiǎ* and *yǐ* reside in *kūn*; *wù* and *guǐ* in *xī*—proceed clockwise from *jiǎzǐ*.
*Yǐ* and *gēng* occupy *lí*, moving counterclockwise from *jiǎzǐ*.
*Dīng* and *rén* shift clockwise from *xùn*.
From *xùn*, begin at *jiǎzǐ*; *bǐng* and *xīn* stir thunder in *zhèn*—fly counterclockwise into the central palace for careful reckoning.
First determine whether the flight is clockwise or counterclockwise.
Examine the day’s cyclical sign to see which *jiǎ* sequence it belongs to,
then count from the head of that decade to the day’s position.
From the day’s position, begin at the *zǐ* hour and count to the desired hour—
this is the direction where the major slaying force descends.
If clockwise, proceed clockwise; if counterclockwise, proceed counterclockwise.
Upon reaching the central palace, lodge it in the *kūn* position for application.

**Example:**
In the *wùwǔ* year, the seventh month, thirteenth day (*gēngshēn* day),
begin counterclockwise from *jiǎzǐ*.
Start from *wǔ* with the six *jiǎ* signs:
*jiǎzǐ*, *jiǎxū*, *jiǎshēn*, *jiǎwǔ*, *jiǎchén*, *jiǎyín*, *jiǎyín* (repeated in *xùn* and *zhèn*),
then begin *yǐmǎo* and proceed through the sequence to the desired day.
From there, add the *zǐ* hour and count to the desired hour—
this is the major slaying force.
The rest follow this example.
For the *jiǎzǐ* decade, do not seek the *jiǎ* head; instead, count the six *jiǎ* from *yǐchǒu*.

**Qi Formula for Flying Slaying Forces:**
*Jiǎ* and *jǐ* dragons fly as the cock crows at dawn;
*chén* and *yǒu* see *yǐ* and *gēng* tigers roar, fearing the flight of the ram.
From *yín*, *wèi* emerges; *bǐng* and *xīn* share the qi of monkey and dog.
From *shēn* and *xū*, *dīng* and *rén* return to the southern palace’s *kǎn* gate.
From *wǔ* and *zǐ*, *wù* and *guǐ* thunder issues from the *duì* palace;
from *mǎo* and *yǒu*, celestial thunder’s slaying power flourishes with heavenly mechanism.
All under heaven’s demonic forces dread it,
as thunderbolts cleave the sky with flashing lightning.
On *jiǎjǐ* days, the Metal Tiger’s hidden thunder lies in *chén*;
on *sì* days, in *yǒu*—face this direction to pace the Dipper,
burn talismans according to the method, and command with a shout.
**Adaptations for Wind-Fire Mandates:**
1. Commonly used to subdue ghosts
2. To pray for rain
3. To pray for clear skies
4. To pray for snow
5. To summon thunder

**The Most High Sovereign Lord Emperor’s Scripture on Commanding Thunder, as Spoken by the Heavenly Youth Perfected:**
**Opening Incantation:**
That which Heaven nurtures, Earth brings to fruition.
Once receiving the numinous talisman, one attains longevity.
Divine immortals assist me; jade maidens attend my form.
The Supreme Clarity’s boundless realm, the Heavenly Soldiers who capture ghosts.
Cut down deviance, cast down demonic essences.
Descend at my call, guard and protect my body.
Those who violate this shall be executed.
Should any disobey, the thunder-axe swiftly strikes.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Sovereign Lord Emperor’s law commands!

**Scripture on Commanding Thunder:**
The Most High says:
August Heaven gives birth to me, August Earth bears me,
Sun and Moon illuminate me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of the Net of Demons,
the Spirit Kings of the Net of Harmony.
The stars and constellations honor me,
the various immortals elevate me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of the Net of Roots,
the Spirit Kings of the Net of Balance.
The Controller of Destinies is with me,
the Great Monad entrusts me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of the Net of Roaring,
the Spirit Kings of the Net of Transformation.
The Jade Emperor calls me,
the Three Officials protect me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of the Net of Inhalation,
the Spirit Kings of the Net of Generations.
The Five Emperors guard me,
the Northern Asterism assists me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of the Net of Rivers,
the Spirit Kings of the Net of Thorns.
The Southern Culmen aids me,
the Northern Dipper supports me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of the Net of Beards,
the Spirit Kings of the Net of Numinosity.
The Three Terraces shield me,
the Four Saints assist me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Hēluó*,
the Spirit Kings of *Hēzhí*.
Golden youths attend me,
jade maidens follow me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Hēxiū*,
the Spirit Kings of *Hēsēng*.
The six *jiǎ* serve me,
the six *dīng* advance me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Hēzú*,
the Spirit Kings of *Hēpó*.
The Heavenly Gate opens for me,
the Earthly Doorway is unsealed for me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Hēmiào*,
the Spirit Kings of *Hētí*.
Mountains and marshes contain me,
rivers and streams ferry me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Hēshì*,
the Spirit Kings of *Hēzhī*.
Wind and rain escort me,
thunder and lightning follow me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Hēzhī*,
the Spirit Kings of *Hēfǎ*.
The Eight Trigrams obey me,
the Nine Palaces conceal me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Bōyē*,
the Spirit Kings of *Bōzhèng*.
Yin and Yang honor me,
the four seasons complete me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Bōluó*,
the Spirit Kings of *Bōshè*.
The Five Phases support me,
my fate is fixed upon me.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Bōdǒu*,
the Spirit Kings of *Bōjiā*.
The Supreme Clarity’s mysterious records,
the Three Palaces’ ascent and descent.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Bōpǔ*,
the Spirit Kings of *Bōjī*.
Up and down I traverse,
endlessly without cease.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Bōjìng*,
the Spirit Kings of *Bōmí*.
Golden meals and jade nectar,
all I seek arrives.
I summon the Spirit Kings of *Bōjì*,
the Spirit Kings of *Bōchéng*.
Empty Brahman, sun and moon,
I swear an oath with Heaven.
The Five Emperors’ Thunder Lords,
the Yin-Yang Thunder Lords.
[...] stars,
the Four Commands’ Thunder Lords,
the Six *Jiǎ* Thunder Lords.
*Ōm mā chā lín, ōm kī [...] chā*,
the Thunder Lords of Thunderbolts,
the Thunder Lords of Water’s Release.
*Mā shè guó nǎ, ōm yàn qì hé*,
the Eight Winds’ Thunder Lords,
the Ten Rains’ Thunder Lords.
Nurturing the Three Hun,
cultivating the Seven Po,
the Six Paths’ Thunder Lords,
the Lightning Flash Thunder Lords.
Thunder Lords and Lightning Mothers,
striking in time with the drum,
the Wind-Raising Thunder Lords,
the Rain-Bringing Thunder Lords.
*Ōm* with copper claws, *chā* with feathered wings,
the Five Peaks’ Thunder Lords,
the Four Streams’ Thunder Lords.
*Ōm* surging south and north,
seizing east and west,
the Eight Nodes’ Thunder Lords,
the Six Qi’s Thunder Lords.
Approaching with ash-gray hue,
seizing and pursuing through the flying void,
the Great Rivers’ Thunder Lords,
the Ravines’ Thunder Lords.
Within the Yellow Center, governing qi,
in the black darkness, vast and boundless,
the Rivers’ Thunder Lords,
the Four Seas’ Thunder Lords.
Shaking the Dipper and Ox,
laughing as they rush, ghosts in sorrow,
the Drum-Beating Thunder Lords,
the Wheel-Roaring Thunder Lords.
Three commands seal, five proclamations linger,
the Fire Chariot Thunder Lords,
the Fire Wheel Thunder Lords.
The Metal Spirit ascends in his chariot,
the Wooden Youth Great Spirit,
the Mountain-Shifting Thunder Lords,
the Stone-Rolling Thunder Lords.

For example, in the *jiǎyín* decade of ten years, the Grand Year moves counterclockwise from *xū*. Leaping one palace to *yín*, this is the *wùwǔ* year’s beginning. The Grand Year then starts from its position, moving counterclockwise through consecutive palaces to find the current month. From the month, proceed clockwise through consecutive palaces, beginning the count at the *hài* hour and continuing to *mǎo*—this is the thunder-slaying direction.

chunks.original_text: 水充玄女， 火降离明，兴云雷公，洒雨雷公。 土安五宫，日月朗明，行云雷公， 布雾雷公。 龙虎交横，风雨应生，打瘟雷公，破阵雷公。 江河倒迸， 山岳摧崩，驱邪雷公，光明雷公。 冲天破地，万丈英行，黑暗雷公， 火印雷公。 福禄如川，金玉丰隆，所求者得，所向者亨，所欲者合， 所为者成。 种种变化，与道合真，何神不使，何令不行。 前有朱雀， 后有玄武，左有青龙，右有白虎，上天有勑，六甲六丁，神灵操恶， 大降威灵，吐雾兴云，动雷掣电，散布乾坤，助吾道法，速赐威灵。 上顶华盖，下蹑魁罡，神通光焰，威震十方。 爱我者生，恶我者殃， 谋我者死，憎我者亡。
chunks.translated_text:
The Water-Full Dark Maiden,
the Fire-Descending Radiant Clarity,
the Cloud-Raising Thunder Lords,
the Rain-Sprinkling Thunder Lords.
Earth stabilizes the Five Palaces,
sun and moon shine bright,
the Cloud-Moving Thunder Lords,
the Mist-Spreading Thunder Lords.
Dragon and Tiger cross in tumult,
wind and rain arise in response,
the Plague-Striking Thunder Lords,
the Battle-Array-Shattering Thunder Lords.
Rivers reverse their flow,
mountains and peaks collapse,
the Demon-Driving Thunder Lords,
the Radiance-Bearing Thunder Lords.
Breaking heaven, rending earth,
a journey of ten thousand fathoms,
the Dark Obscurity Thunder Lords,
the Fire-Seal Thunder Lords.
Fortune and emolument flow like rivers,
gold and jade abound in plenty.
What is sought is attained,
what is faced prospers,
what is desired aligns,
what is done succeeds.
Myriad transformations,
in union with the Dao, in accord with the True.
What spirit will not obey?
What command will not be executed?

Before me, the Vermilion Bird,
behind me, the Dark Warrior,
to my left, the Azure Dragon,
to my right, the White Tiger.
Above, the heavens issue their decree,
the Six Jia and Six Ding spirits,
wielding their might, divine numina descend in power,
spouting mist, raising clouds,
stirring thunder, flashing lightning,
scattering through the cosmos,
aiding my Dao and its methods,
swiftly bestowing their numinous might.

Above, my crown is the Floral Canopy,
below, my feet tread the Demon-Subduing Star.
My divine efficacy blazes with light,
my power shakes the ten directions.
Those who love me live,
those who hate me suffer calamity,
those who plot against me die,
those who detest me perish.

chunks.original_text: 灵童神女，铁甲神王，破邪金刚，三千六百， 常在我傍。 执节捧符，与我同游。 太上摄京，天大吉昌。 琅函宝轴， 金箓玉书。 二十四符，与星历俱。 雷公闪电，所往无虞。 腾云入空， 所以无虑。 龙宫海藏，宝贝骊珠，世间珍宝，由吾所需。 天下鬼神， 受吾所驱，有一不从，雷斧速诛。 明离大神，有功之日，名书上清， 自然清静。 太玄保举，玉班有名，前排力士，后拥天丁。 驱雷霹雳， 飞走火铃，城隍社令，不得留停。 唵罗萨咤，驱役天丁，五方使者， 霹雳大神。 急急准奉太上皇老帝君律令救。 法海遗珠卷之十一竟 #1《雷霆玉经》绿水内功：此内功正文亦收载《道法会元》卷七七，称为『雷霆梵号咒』，唯词句次序略有不同，且缺少数句。 #2雷霆金虎流火凶星日时大煞起例：此诀与《道法会元》卷七八《雷霆妙契》之『金虎大煞起例』所言相同，但词句大异，可相互参订。 法海遗珠卷之十二 璇玑建坛祈告次序

Divine youths and spirit maidens,
Iron-Armored Spirit Kings,

Jade scrolls in jeweled cases,
Golden Registers and Jade Scriptures.
Twenty-four talismans,

Thunder Lords and flashing lightning,
wherever I go, no peril.
Soaring on clouds into the void,
thus, no cause for concern.
Dragon palaces and ocean treasuries,
treasures and black pearls,
worldly jewels and precious things,
all at my command.
The ghosts and spirits of the world
are subject to my bidding;
should any disobey,
the Thunder Axe swiftly executes them.

When the Radiant Li Great Spirit achieves merit,
their name is inscribed in the Upper Clarity,
naturally pure and tranquil.
Recommended by the Supreme Mystery,
recorded in the Jade Roster,
flanked by Mighty Warriors in front,
escorted by Heavenly Soldiers behind.
Driving thunder and lightning bolts,
flying fire bells in motion,
City Gods and Earth Deities
dare not delay.
*Oṃ ra sa tsa*, dispatching Heavenly Soldiers,
envoys of the Five Directions,
Mighty Thunder Deities.
Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and decrees of the Supreme Venerable Sovereign Lord of the Dao!

chunks.original_text: 诵天地咒 洞中虚玄，晃朗太元。 八方威神，使我自然。 灵宝符命，普告九天。 乾罗怛那，洞罡太玄。 斩妖缚邪，杀鬼万千。 中山神咒，元始玉文。 持诵一遍，却鬼延年。 按行五岳，八海知闻。 魔王束首，侍卫我轩。 凶秽消荡，道炁长存。 急急如律令。 入户咒 四明功曹，通真使者，灵宝生炁，侍靖玉女，开明童子，与臣俱入黄房。 急急如律令。 先进左足，洞案前上香，祝白，咒曰： 玉华散景，九炁凝烟。 香云密罗，径冲九天。 侍香金童，傅言玉女。 接侍香烟，上闻帝前。 令臣所启，咸赐如言。 诵仙曹总章 高天之上，玉清为主。 玄罡大魁，太玄生府。 中有帝君，灵虚玉女。 校精辨魔，统制百史。 上达三天，形神司举。 传奏教令，蠲灾救苦。 备卫正道，束缚鬼侮。 流行诸天，济生度死。 解厄摧凶，通达紫府。 十天告命，召其所主。 急急如律令。 次存四圣左右前后，金童玉女侍卫，踼魁斗一座，存金光满室，召将，念天蓬咒： 天蓬天蓬，九元煞童。 五丁都司，高刁北翁。 七政八灵，太上皓凶。 长颅巨兽，手把帝钟。 素枭三神，严驾夔龙。 威剑神王，斩邪灭踪。 紫炁乘天，丹霞赫冲。 吞魔食鬼，横身饮风。 苍舌绿齿，四目老翁。 天丁力士，威南御凶。 天驺激戾，威北衔锋。 三十万兵，卫我九重。 辟尸千里，祛却不祥。 敢有小鬼，欲来见状。 镢天大斧，斩鬼五形。 炎帝烈血，北斗然骨。 四明破骸，天猷灭类。 神刀一下，万鬼自溃。 急急如律令。 护身咒 天帝光明，日月照临。 万邪不干，四灵护身。 南斗保命，北斗延生。 北斗七星，除落死名。 文曲武曲，除去死箓。 北斗延龄，诸天帝君。 禄存廉贞，改易死籍。 贪狼巨门，拥护身形。 急急如天帝律令。 诵立坛咒 天幽地浅，日月轮转。 五星运动，吾依上象。 制此一坛，万鬼皈伏。 神刀一下，万鬼自绝。 急急如律令。 次以右手执纸捻符，起取青炁，卯文弹入。 念请光咒 天之灵光，亥地之灵光，申日月之光，午未星曜之光，五方五斗灵光，掐五方诀北极天罡神光。 辰吾身灵光，上圣威光，急降灵光。 诵捻符纸咒 正一阳光，焰上朱烟，开明童子，一十二人，洞照一室，及臣等身。 百邪摧伏，煞鬼万千。 光明朗彻，通真达灵，升入无形，与道合真。 急急如律令。 诵点灯咒 春夏起魁，秋冬起戌，至辰掐定，闭炁，点灯一灯，一咒。 上帝有敕，发点斗灯。 七王来降，救护群生。 左转右弼，显现威光。 天蓬元帅，统领天兵。 五雷使者，六甲六丁。 玄武大圣，台中三星。 去病除祸，回死作生。 三魂附体，七魄安宁。 违敕者死，准敕者亨。 斗灯一点，身宅光明。 急急如律令。 解厄符 罡诀炁 灯盏下七符 贪狼 巨门
chunks.translated_text:
**Recitation of the Heaven and Earth Incantation**
Within the cavern, emptiness and mystery,
Radiant and vast, the Great Primordium.
The mighty spirits of the eight directions,
Enable me to be natural.
The talisman and mandate of the Numinous Treasure,
Proclaimed throughout the Nine Heavens.
*Qianluo Danna*, the Permeating Vigor of the Great Mystery.
Slay demons and bind evil,
Annihilate ten thousand ghosts.
The Central Mountain Divine Incantation,
The Jade Text of the Primordial Beginning.
Recite once to repel ghosts and prolong life.
Traverse the Five Peaks,
Known to the Eight Seas.
Demon kings bow their heads,
Attending and guarding my chamber.
Malevolence and filth dissolve,
The Dao’s *qi* endures forever.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command.

**Entrance Incantation**
The Four Luminaries’ Merit Officers,
Messengers who communicate with the true,
The *qi* of the Numinous Treasure’s generation,
Jade Maidens who pacify and attend,
Luminous Lads,
Accompany me into the Yellow Chamber.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command.

First, step forward with the left foot,
Before the altar, offer incense and present the prayer, reciting:
Jade blossoms scatter radiance,
Nine *qi* congeal as mist.
Fragrant clouds densely woven,
Pierce straight to the Nine Heavens.
The Golden Lad attending incense,
The Jade Maiden transmitting words.
Receive and convey the incense smoke,
Ascend to report before the Emperor.
What I now petition,
May all be granted as spoken.

**Recitation of the Celestial Bureau’s General Chapter**
Above the lofty heavens,
The Jade Purity presides.
The Mysterious Vigor and Great Chief,
The Palace of the Great Mystery’s generation.
Within resides the Imperial Lord,
The Numinous Void Jade Maiden.
They scrutinize essence and discern demons,
Commanding the hundred scribes.
Upward, they reach the Three Heavens,
Overseeing the forms and spirits’ elevation.
Transmitting and announcing decrees,
Dispelling calamities and rescuing from suffering.
Safeguarding the true Dao,
Binding and restraining demonic insults.
Circulating through the various heavens,
Aiding life and delivering from death.
Dissolving adversity and shattering misfortune,
Communicating with the Purple Palace.
The Ten Heavens proclaim the mandate,
Summoning their respective lords.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command.

Next, visualize the Four Saints to the left, right, front, and rear,
Golden Lads and Jade Maidens attending and guarding,
Kicking the *Kui* Dipper once,
Envision golden light filling the chamber.
Summon the generals and recite the Heavenly Peng Incantation:
Heavenly Peng, Heavenly Peng,
Nine Primal Slayer Lads.
The Five Ding Commanders,
Gao Diao and the Northern Elder.
The Seven Governors and Eight Spirits,
The Supreme White Malevolence.
Long-skulled giant beasts,
Holding the Emperor’s bell.
The Three White Owls and Three Spirits,
Sternly driving the *Kui* dragons.
Mighty Sword Spirit Kings,
Slaying evil and eradicating traces.
Purple *qi* ascends to heaven,
Cinnabar clouds blaze and surge.
Devouring demons and consuming ghosts,
Their bodies transverse, drinking the wind.
Azure tongues and green teeth,
Four-eyed Elders.
Heavenly Ding Warriors,
Mighty in the south, warding off malevolence.
Heavenly Couriers, fierce and wrathful,
Mighty in the north, bearing blades.
Three hundred thousand troops,
Guarding my ninefold layers.
Repelling corpses a thousand *li*,
Dispelling misfortune.
Should any petty ghost
Dare to appear,
The Heavenly Great Axe,
Slays the five forms of ghosts.
The Fiery Emperor’s scorching blood,
The Northern Dipper burns bones.
The Four Luminaries shatter remains,
The Heavenly Plan annihilates species.
One stroke of the divine blade,
Ten thousand ghosts scatter.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command.

**Incantation for Self-Protection**
The Heavenly Emperor’s radiance,
Sun and moon illuminate.
No evil dares approach,
The Four Numinous Beasts guard my body.
The Southern Dipper preserves life,
The Northern Dipper extends it.
The Northern Dipper’s seven stars,
Erase the names of the dead.
Civil and Martial Curves,
Remove the records of death.
The Northern Dipper prolongs life,
All Heavenly Emperors.
*Luxing* and *Lianzhen*,
Alter the registers of death.
*Tanlang* and *Jumen*,
Embrace and protect my form.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Heavenly Emperor’s statute and command.

**Recitation for Erecting the Altar Incantation**
Heaven is profound, earth shallow,
Sun and moon revolve.
The five stars move,
I rely on the celestial patterns.
Establishing this altar,
Ten thousand ghosts submit and obey.
One stroke of the divine blade,
Ten thousand ghosts perish.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command.

Next, with the right hand, hold the paper-wrapped talisman,
Draw in the blue *qi*, and flick it with the *mao* character.
Recite the **Invocation of Luminous Light**:
The light of heaven’s numen,
The light of earth’s *hai* region,
The light of the *shen* sun and moon,
The light of the *wu* and *wei* stellar radiance,
The luminous light of the Five Directions and Five Dippers,
Clasp the Five Directions’ mudra, the Northern Culmen’s Heavenly Vigor divine light.
The *chen* hour’s light of my body,
The august light of the Supreme Saints,
Swiftly descend, luminous light.

**Recitation for the Talisman Paper Wick**
The light of the Orthodox Unity’s yang,
Flames rise as vermilion smoke.
Luminous Lads,
Twelve in number,
Illuminating the entire chamber,
And our bodies.
Hundreds of evils subdue and submit,
Ten thousand slaying ghosts.
Light bright and penetrating,
Communicating with the true and reaching the numinous,
Ascending into formlessness,
Uniting with the Dao in truth.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command.

**Recitation for Lighting the Lamp**
In spring and summer, begin with *kui*,
In autumn and winter, begin with *xu*,
Proceed to *chen*, clasp firmly,
Hold the breath, light one lamp, recite once:
The Supreme Emperor decrees,
Ignite the Dipper’s lamp.
The Seven Kings descend,
Rescuing and protecting all beings.
Left revolving, right assisting,
Manifesting majestic light.
The Heavenly Peng Marshal,
Commands the heavenly troops.
The Five Thunder Messengers,
The Six Jia and Six Ding.
The Great Sage of the Dark Warrior,
The Three Stars of the Terrace.
Dispelling illness and eliminating misfortune,
Reversing death to life.
The three *hun* souls return to the body,
The seven *po* souls are pacified.
Those who defy the decree die,
Those who comply prosper.
One lamp of the Dipper lit,
The body and dwelling shine brightly.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command.

**Talismans for Dissolving Adversity**
Vigor of the Vigor Mudra
Seven talismans beneath the lamp:
*Tanlang*
*Jumen*

chunks.original_text: 咒曰 召仙仙至，召圣圣临，化作真符，合明天心。 急急如律令。 右符黄纸墨书，请圣时化於香炉中。 或每遇七日夜静，於斗下焚之，默叩。 日后有请必降。 水盆符 右符用白纸，长七寸，阔三寸，朱书，以斗诀搅水三匝，却放符于水盆中，将米筛衣服盖之，看符指何方向，以定吉凶。 北斗七星，除臣死名。 文曲武曲，除臣死箓。 禄存廉贞，贷臣死名。 贪狼巨门，断臣死源。 天罡破军，煞炁不逢。 三台养我来，三台扶我来，三台护我来。 使臣厄年厄月厄日厄时不被灾害，回死上生。 急急如律令。 通目见鬼神符 日是吾父，月是吾母，五星是吾兄，吾行神将收鬼神。 急急如律令。 右法未行持之前，先书三道，欲行持，吞一道，醮了吞二道。 先咒七，然后吞之。 如未见，亦闻鬼神音响。 洗眼符 右符朱书，烧为灰，置水中洗眼，令净，洞见鬼神。 或治患，用此大验。 咒曰 三台神君，助笔通灵。 除灾却祸，馘灭邪精。 急急如律令。 占象斗真阴阳二景符 黄纸朱书。 右符阳以贵狼为例。 右符阴以巨门为例。 护身保命四灵符 男左女右带之。 咒曰 天帝光明，日月照临。 万邪不干，四明护身。 南斗保命，北斗延龄。 诸天帝君，拥护身形。 急急如律令。 解秽符 朝斗定炁通真符 咒曰 三魂正炁，七魄安宁。 保我长生，百神助吾。 邪念不动，通达　上真。 急急如律令。 脱厄符 解二十四厄真符 三灾厄 四煞厄

Invocation:
"Summon the immortals—immortals arrive; summon the sages—sages descend. Transform into the true talisman, merging with the luminous heart of heaven. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"

Inscribe the right talisman on yellow paper with ink, and when invoking the sages, burn it in the incense burner. Alternatively, on every seventh night when all is still, burn it beneath the Dipper and silently knock. Thereafter, whenever summoned, they will surely descend.

Water Basin Talisman
Inscribe the right talisman on white paper, seven *cun* in length and three *cun* in width, with cinnabar. Stir the water three times with the Dipper mudra, then place the talisman in the water basin. Cover it with a rice sieve and clothing, and observe the direction the talisman points to determine fortune or misfortune.

The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper erase the servant’s name of death.
*Wenqu* and *Wuqu* remove the servant’s register of death.
*Lucun* and *Lianzhen* defer the servant’s name of death.
*Tanlang* and *Jumen* sever the servant’s source of death.
The Celestial Pivot *Pojun* ensures no baleful *qi* is encountered.

"The Three Terraces nurture me to come,
The Three Terraces support me to come,
The Three Terraces protect me to come.
Let the servant’s inauspicious year, month, day, and hour be spared from calamity, turning death into life. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"

Talisman for Seeing Ghosts and Spirits with Open Eyes
"The sun is my father,
The moon is my mother,
The Five Stars are my brothers.
As I walk, the spirit-generals seize ghosts and spirits. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"

Before performing this method, first inscribe three talismans. When ready to perform, swallow one; after the offering, swallow the remaining two. First recite the incantation seven times, then swallow them. Even if unseen, the sounds of ghosts and spirits will be heard.

Eye-Washing Talisman
Inscribe the right talisman with cinnabar, burn it to ash, and place it in water to wash the eyes, purifying them to clearly see ghosts and spirits. For treating ailments, this is greatly efficacious.

Invocation:
"Spirit Lords of the Three Terraces, assist the brush to connect with the numinous.
Dispel disaster and avert misfortune, behead and extinguish evil spirits. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"

Yin-Yang Talismans of the Dipper’s True Forms for Divining Images
Inscribe on yellow paper with cinnabar.
The right yang talisman takes *Guilang* as its model.
The right yin talisman takes *Jumen* as its model.

Four Numinous Talismans for Protecting the Body and Preserving Life
Men wear it on the left, women on the right.

Invocation:
"The radiance of the Heavenly Thearch,
The illumination of the sun and moon.
No myriad evils shall assail,
The Four Luminaries guard my body.
The Southern Dipper preserves my life,
The Northern Dipper extends my years.
All Heavenly Thearchs and Lords
Encompass and protect my form. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"

Talisman for Dispelling Impurities
Talisman for Stabilizing *Qi* and Communing with the True While Facing the Dipper

Invocation:
"The three *hun* rectify *qi*,
The seven *po* attain peace.
Preserve my long life,
All spirits assist me.
No deviant thoughts arise,
Communing with the Supreme True. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*"

Talisman for Deliverance from Distress
True Talisman for Resolving the Twenty-Four Distresses
Distress of the Three Calamities
Distress of the Four Baleful Influences

### **The Secret Whispered Petition of the Mysterious Numinous #1**
#### **Preface to the Secret Whispered Petition of the Nine Heavens Mysterious Woman**
The Northern Dipper resides at the center of Heaven, governing the pivot of creation and transformation, serving as the master of human spirits. All fortune and misfortune, regret and shame in a person’s life are subject to its sway. The methods of petitioning the Dipper, transmitted by sages of former ages, each possess manifest efficacy. The purposes of such petitions vary, each with its own specialization.

Our Patriarch, Sun the Perfected, in his flight of spirit to audience with the Thearch, chanced upon the Nine Heavens Mysterious Woman, who bestowed upon him this swift and essential whispered petition. The method is named *Stove Register*, and the lamp is called *Thousand Eyes*, dedicated to memorializing the Controller of Fate. Though the text is brief, its efficacy is swift.

The Controller of Fate is the Nine Heavens Efficacious Fire Primordial Lord, commissioned by the Heavenly Thearch to memorialize the affairs of the human realm. All prayers and supplications are invariably answered, for this is the utmost Dao in its unadorned simplicity. The Perfected, moved by compassion for the people of the world, transmitted it to later learners. Those who obtain it should preserve and revere it; it must not be shown to the unworthy.

Respectfully inscribed by Li Xisheng.

---

### **The Precious Register of the Mysterious Numinous for Prolonging Life, Delivering from Distress, and Dispersing Calamities**
With utmost reverence, I present this petition, unable to refuse the sincerity of the supplicant. I have heard that the Great Thearch, in his boundless grace, expounds the teachings of the Supreme True, while the August Elder proclaims the decrees of the Jade Bureau, and the Northern Dipper bestows the *Book of the Mysterious Numinous*. Its profundities defy description; its sagely power is unfathomable.

Facing the Northern Culmen, I inscribe this talisman and register, recording the supplicant’s circumstances in accordance with ancestral protocols. Entrusted to the Controller of Fate for presentation, it ascends to the office of the Throat and Tongue, and descends to relieve the afflictions of the heart and viscera. May swift response be granted to fulfill this devout prayer.

All true talismans shall be duly proclaimed and enacted.

**Void Talisman**

This talisman and register are dedicated to resolving for [Name] the Three Calamities and Four Baleful Influences, the Five Phases and Six Harms, the Seven Injuries and Eight Difficulties, the Nine Stars in fate, destiny, and life’s allotted span, and all inauspicious spirits and malevolent forces encountered in the current year—distresses of Heavenly Nets and Earthly Snares.

I humbly beseech the Lord Controller of Fate to transmit this sincerity and memorialize it to the Star Lords of the Northern Dipper. Moved by pity for this ignorant mortal, may they assent to my plea. May they specially bestow sagely power and Dao-power, and by the efficacy of this talisman and dharma-power, protect and bless [Name]. May all afflictions be instantly healed, all distresses resolved, all enmities and grudges reconciled, all curses dissolved, all impurities shattered, all demonic influences expelled, all karmic retribution pardoned, all official plagues dispersed, and all ruin and decay steadfastly upheld. May all wishes be fulfilled, truly by the grace of the Mysterious.

[Name], daring to trespass upon your sagely might, prostrates in utmost submission, awaiting your decree.

Respectfully submitted on the [Day] of the [Month] of the [Year], at the hour of [Time].

The humble servant [Name], bearing the mandate, respectfully executes this.

**Rice Diminished (米失):**
For **Tānláng Star (Greedy Wolf)**: The Five Phases exhaust their mandate; celestial bureaus invoke curses. Wealth and property dissipate. The northeast altar grows cold.

For **Jùmén Star (Great Gate)**: Either offending earth and wood, or due to official litigation and curses—this arises when the Wood and Fire Stars converge and descend.

For **Lùcún Star (Wealth Storage)**: Entangled in the misfortune of nets; the household dims. Blood-light female ghosts bring calamity.

For **Wénqǔ Star (Literary Brilliance)**: The western altar turns cold; the household’s qi darkens. Petitioning the Great Yang brings fortune.

For **Liánzhēn Star (Integrity and Chastity)**: The Fire Star of fate shines upon officials; household members face disasters and fire misfortunes. The directional deities and yearly spirits are offended, causing illness in men and women.

For **Wǔqǔ Star (Martial Brilliance)**: Death ghosts in childbirth; the southern altar chills. Relatives perish in succession, harmed by Wood Guests.

For **Pòjūn Star (Breaking Army)**: Stars move inauspiciously—hanging ghosts bring legal punishments, disputes, and oral conflicts. The southern altar cools; ghosts afflict the young with misfortune.

For **Zuǒfǔ Star (Left Assistant)**: Celestial bureaus invoke northern yin vows.

For **Yòubì Star (Right Assistant)**: Knife wounds, fire burns, and ghostly malice.

For **Běnmìng Star (Life Star)**: Stars move inauspiciously; black departs without salvation, severing ominous omens.

For **Seven Stars (Collective Diminished)**: Frequent calamities plague the household; the young face unforeseen dangers. All affairs are unfavorable; the sick grow worse.

---

**Rice Stirred (米动):**
For **Tānláng Star**: Celestial bureaus impose punishments; past transgressions must be guarded against and repented.

For **Jùmén Star**: The Yuefu’s seventy-two offices and city gods issue yin retributions.

For **Lùcún Star**: Fortune spirits weaken; slaves, servants, and external ghosts bring harm. They should be pacified and sent away.

For **Wénqǔ Star**: Bewitched by others; the household grows restless, and husband and wife discord.

For **Liánzhēn Star**: Disturbing earth offends the official tally, bringing official disasters and severe illness to men and women.

For **Wǔqǔ Star**: The stars of the year’s fate and destiny’s limits turn unfavorable.

For **Pòjūn Star**: Small fortune.

For **Zuǒfǔ Star**: Ancestral graves and feng shui turn unfavorable, leading to tomb disputes and summons.

For **Yòubì Star**: Wood Guests and mountain demons cause disturbances and harm.

For **Běnmìng Star**: Petition the Dipper to exorcise and give thanks.

For **Seven Stars (Collective Stirred)**: [No additional text provided.]

---

**Rice Increased (米添):**
For **Tānláng Star**: Conduct a grand jiào ritual to give thanks; this invites wealth.

For **Jùmén Star**: Attracts fields and dwellings from external lineages.

For **Lùcún Star**: Brings added wealth and population.

For **Wénqǔ Star**: Pray for blessings to bear a noble son.

For **Liánzhēn Star**: Gains windfall wealth or uncanny arts.

For **Wǔqǔ Star**: Attracts wealth, property, and ancient artifacts.

For **Pòjūn Star**: Brings promotions and salary increases; for commoners, wealth and joyous events.

For **Zuǒfǔ Star**: Household members remain safe and fortunate.

For **Yòubì Star**: Legal matters disperse; household members thrive.

For **Běnmìng Star**: The household flourishes; wealth increases, bringing fortune.

For **Seven Stars (Collective Increased)**: [No additional text provided.]

---

**Method of Practice:**
Use one lamp, divided into nine branches. Place a Thousand-Eyed Lamp atop it, covering the Stove Controller’s altar. Arrange twenty-four portions of incense, lamps, pure tea, wine, and fruit. Set up a Dipper of white, pure rice in the designated location. The ritual master recites incantations silently, without uttering a sound.

Alternatively, burn these offerings directly. Use a set of golden paper money, horses, and Stove Ritual implements, burning them in the stove.

**Judgment:**
When the stars’ rice blackens, the master perishes.
When the stars gather, epidemics arise.
When the stars vanish, lifespans end.
When the stars remain still, the sick recover.
When rice increases, wealth and longevity bring all fortune.
When rice diminishes, misfortune surely follows.
If people do not trust Master Sun’s method,
How can later learners determine fortune or misfortune?

chunks.original_text: 振系 祖师王屋山太极真人王行真。 祖师正阳开悟传道真君锺离权　云房。 祖师太极内辅真人郑思远。 祖师纯阳灵宝真君吕岩　洞宾。 宗师通玄真人果老张果。 宗师琼管先生紫清定慧真人白玉蟾。 识三台法 三台六星，在斗柄之上，两两相连。 男子识之，免牢狱之迍。 女人识之，免产难之厄。 学仙修真之士，尤宜识之。 每见三台六星，即便拱手，存拜，密念咒曰： 上台虚精，中台六淳，下台曲生。 除臣死籍，注臣长生。 居位高迁，列居天廷。 心意开朗，耳目聪明。 三魂永久，延寿千龄。 上朝金阙，瞻谒玉清。 乘龙驾云，位登仙卿。 急急如律令。 三台生我来，三台养我来，三台护我来。 急急如律令。 咒毕，瞻望星躔，求见道恩，随意祷祝，心拜三过，叩齿三通，而退。 求帝座法 斗口二星，尊星在左，帝星在右，如日月照临有道之士，不照不善之人。 有见尊星，寿三百岁。 见帝星，寿六百岁。 每月初三、二十七夜，候见之。 须在夜间人静后，勿令人知。 侯二星出现，至心求道，勿与人言。 若不专久精诚，轻泄漏慢，中道懈怠，无戒行之士，乃不得见。 修真之士常密祝之，切勿以二星名闻於非人。 可常注念在心，如有事立可称名密告之。 不可向北便涕，解衣散发，裸露星光之下，此为至戒也。 每侯二星，先步斗，烧香，再拜，想斗口见二星，如日月。 次念咒曰：尊帝二星，北极之灵。 愿臣早见，见即长生。 注臣飞仙，勾臣死名。 福庆无穷，与天齐年。 速超仙都，飞行上清。 急急如律令。 又二拜，思二星降紫云炁，从自己泥丸官，入灌两眼。 又念咒曰： 尊帝二星，北极之灵。 忽显忽现，即得长生。 注臣飞仙，落臣死名。 福庆无穷，与天齐年。 早度三界，游行上清。 急急如律令。 咒毕，再拜，少立，凝神，注目斗口，默念咒七遍，了少时退。 如见，即又拜求，乞长生，愿心祷祝。 仍夜夜朝礼，毋令间断。 若问断则前功俱废矣。 有戒行修真之士，身能超凡入圣，上侍玉宸。 上达之士行之，乃得长生，功满上升。 世人行之，延寿长年。 勿示非人，宜宝秘之。 昔王屋山太极真人传与张果老先生，密而行之，后得飞升，为古圣仙也。 追鹤秘法#2 鹤有数种，东城有筠鹤，罽宾有芦鹤，淮山有扬鹤，青城山有羽鹤，此乃古今之通传。 如汉天师登九云之鹤，许真君驭凌风之鹤，葛稚川飞玉霞之鹤，锺离正阳君升太霄之鹤，信果有之。 谚云：鹳生三子，其一乃　鹤，特胎生之鹤耳，非蓬莱之羽翎，非紫微唳天之丹霞顶也。 非瑶台缟衣舞凤比也，非天枢啸烟之素裳也。 洞宾纯阳君之鹤，岂徒现也。 鹤之来者，则清秋而翔云，夜深而啸月。 仙有乘鹤而来去者，诚有得道修真将出尘之士，获遇斯文，可以飞符召至，翩跹而来，翱翔於空中，不特呜於九皋耳。 上清大洞法师神霄校籍节制雷霆军马海琼真人白玉蟾述。 师振 都仙教主华阳慈济道君长生度世仙王青华帝君真玄灵应天尊李喆。 祖师灵真教主九天金阙选仙都使正阳上灵妙感开悟传道真君保生司命护国仙王高上元皇应化天尊锺离权云房。 祖师九天上真高元紫虚清真元君魏华存。 祖师正真教主纯阳灵宝妙通演正警化真君吕岩洞宾。 祖师明真教主海蟾明悟弘道真君刘玄英。

The Lineage Masters:
Ancestral Master Wang Xingzhen, Supreme Perfection Realized Person of Wangwu Mountain.
Ancestral Master Zhongli Quan Yunfang, Perfected Lord of Upright Yang’s Enlightenment and Dao Transmission.
Ancestral Master Zheng Siyuan, Supreme Perfection Internal Assistant Realized Person.
Ancestral Master Lü Yan Dongbin, Pure Yang Numinous Treasure Perfected Lord.
Lineage Master Zhang Guolao, Penetrating Mystery Realized Person.
Lineage Master Bai Yuchan, Purple Clarity Settled Wisdom Realized Person, Master of the Jade Toad.

**Recognizing the Three Terraces Method**
The Three Terraces comprise six stars, positioned above the Dipper’s handle, aligned in pairs. Men who recognize them avoid imprisonment’s misfortunes; women who recognize them escape the perils of childbirth. Those who cultivate immortality and refine the true must especially know them.

Whenever the Three Terraces’ six stars are seen, clasp hands in reverence, visualize the bow, and silently recite the incantation:
*"Upper Terrace: Void Essence,
Middle Terrace: Sixfold Purity,
Lower Terrace: Curved Life.
Erase this servant’s name from death’s register,
Inscribe this servant’s name for eternal life.
Promote to lofty rank,
Enthroned in Heaven’s court.
Heart and mind brighten,
Ears and eyes grow keen.
Three souls endure forever,
Extending life a thousand years.
Ascend to the Golden Gate,
Gaze upon Jade Clarity.
Ride the dragon, mount the clouds,
Attain the rank of Immortal Minister.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

*"The Three Terraces gave me birth,
The Three Terraces nurtured me,
The Three Terraces protect me.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

After reciting, gaze toward the stars’ celestial path, seek the grace of the Dao, offer prayers as you wish, bow thrice in the heart, and click the teeth three times before withdrawing.

**Seeking the Imperial Throne Method**
The two stars at the Dipper’s mouth—the Venerable Star on the left, the Imperial Star on the right—shine like the sun and moon upon those of the Dao, but not upon the unvirtuous. Those who see the Venerable Star live three hundred years; those who see the Imperial Star live six hundred years.

On the third and twenty-seventh nights of each month, await their appearance. This must be done in the quiet of night, unknown to others. When the two stars appear, seek the Dao with wholehearted devotion, and tell no one. If one lacks perseverance, sincerity, or discipline, or grows lax midway, the stars will not be seen.

Those who refine the true should secretly pray to them often, never revealing the stars’ names to the unworthy. Keep them constantly in mind, and in times of need, silently invoke their names. Never face north to weep, disrobe, or let hair loose beneath the stars’ light—this is the strictest prohibition.

When awaiting the two stars, first pace the Dipper, burn incense, and bow twice, visualizing the Dipper’s mouth where the two stars appear like the sun and moon. Then recite the incantation:
*"Venerable and Imperial Stars,
Spirits of the Northern Culmen.
May this servant soon behold you,
And upon seeing, attain eternal life.
Inscribe this servant as a flying immortal,
Strike this servant’s name from death’s register.
Boundless fortune and blessings,
Equal to Heaven’s years.
Swiftly ascend to the Immortal Capital,
Soar through Supreme Clarity.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

Bow twice more, envisioning the two stars descending in purple cloud-qi, entering through your Mud-Pill Palace and bathing your eyes. Recite the incantation again:
*"Venerable and Imperial Stars,
Spirits of the Northern Culmen.
Now revealed, now concealed,
Grant this servant eternal life.
Inscribe this servant as a flying immortal,
Strike this servant’s name from death’s register.
Boundless fortune and blessings,
Equal to Heaven’s years.
Soon transcend the Three Realms,
Roam through Supreme Clarity.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

After reciting, bow twice more, stand briefly in stillness, focus the spirit, and gaze at the Dipper’s mouth while silently repeating the incantation seven times. Then withdraw for a short while. If the stars appear, bow again and pray for longevity, offering your heartfelt wishes. Continue nightly worship without interruption—any lapse nullifies all prior merit.

Those of disciplined conduct who refine the true may transcend the mortal and enter the sagely, ascending to serve the Jade Emperor. Those who practice this with utmost dedication attain eternal life and ascend upon merit’s fulfillment. Ordinary practitioners extend their years. Do not reveal this to the unworthy; treasure and guard it well.

Formerly, Supreme Perfection Realized Person of Wangwu Mountain transmitted this to Master Zhang Guolao, who practiced it in secret and later ascended as an immortal, becoming one of the ancient sagely transcendents.

**Secret Crane-Summoning Method #2**
Cranes come in many kinds: the Bamboo Crane of Dongcheng, the Reed Crane of Jibin, the Soaring Crane of Huaishan, and the Feather Crane of Qingcheng Mountain—these are the common traditions of past and present. As when Celestial Master Han rode the Nine Clouds Crane, Perfected Lord Xu mounted the Wind-Riding Crane, Ge Zhichuan flew the Jade Mist Crane, and Perfected Lord Zhongli Zhengyang ascended on the Grand Empyrean Crane—such accounts are indeed true.

The proverb says: "The stork bears three offspring, one of which is a crane"—this refers to the crane born of the womb, not the feathered crane of Penglai, nor the cinnabar-crested crane of Purple Tenuity that cries to the heavens. It is neither the white-robed dancer of the Jasper Terrace nor the white-garbed whistler of the Celestial Pivot. How could Pure Yang Perfected Lord Lü’s crane be merely a fleeting apparition?

When cranes come, they soar through autumn’s clear skies and cry to the deep night’s moon. Immortals who ride cranes come and go—truly, those who attain the Dao, refine the true, and transcend the dust may obtain this scripture and summon them with flying talismans. They will arrive in graceful flight, soaring through the heavens, not merely calling from the Nine Marshes.

*Recorded by Supreme Clarity Great Cavern Dharma Master, Divine Empyrean Registrar, Commander of Thunder and Lightning Troops, Sea-Jade Realized Person Bai Yuchan.*

Ancestral Master, Master of the Numinous True Teachings, Celestial Envoy of the Ninefold Golden Gate’s Immortal Selection, Supreme Clarity Wondrous Response Enlightenment and Dao-Transmitting Perfected Lord, Life-Protecting Controller of Destiny, Nation-Guarding Immortal King, Highest Primordial August Transformative Heavenly Worthy Zhongli Quan Yunfang.

chunks.original_text: 入意切绿世俗愚迷，不信道法。 今欲阐扬教风，庶得人民敬仰，大道兴行。 敢就贵岳，请借鸾鹤几只，於某日午时分，赴醮坛上下之问，左右回旋飞舞，献顶露身。 午朝事毕，即遣回司，不敢久留。 仍乞差委蓬莱司掌鹤灵官，同至醮坛，证盟斋事，须至申闻者。 右某谨谨具状，上申南岳司天昭圣帝圣前。 伏望圣慈，允兹虔恳。 特降指挥下掌鸾鹤案主者，立便照依所申事理，疾速放发，前来庶几，摄化人天，周圆斋事。 某干冒圣威，下情无任战栗之至，谨状。 太岁　年　月　日　具　位　姓 某状申。 申蓬莱山鸾鹤案主使真君同 右法次日再用帖，差直日某宿真官下直符，同中界直使功曹，只今前去，催借鸾鹤十二只，或二十四只，或三十六只，及请灵官一员，同赴齐坛，再发催符。 蓬莱山掌鹤灵官七员名号 第一灵官名辉霞，第二灵官名玉光，第三灵官名金融，第四灵官名卞文，第五灵官名宝光，第六灵官名岐阳，第七灵官名秀实。 右掌鹤灵官七员，每月初一日为始，轮流用之，惟晦望二日灵官名朱湖，不隶所治，则召之不应。 须作九幽黄箓罗天大醮，召之立至。 平昔漫浪戏谑，召之则不验也。 此法乃祖师铁拐都仙教主东华帝君，在青城山之巅，会集众仙，就南岳，关鹤乘空而至，事毕复还之。 其教后传锺离正阳君，及南岳紫虚魏元君。 次传之吕公洞宾纯阳君，次授与刘仙海蟾翁，翁授之於天台紫阳张真君。 历代自此相承，至第九代嗣教仙师琼管仙翁，以是流传于世，绵绵不绝。 愚於甲辰岁末，忽庆会于宝盖武阳之洞，奉事一心。 乙巳天腊日，具状投香，礼拜求师收录，点化金丹火候造化，自是心印默契，俱符证验。 因是念师之恩高於须弥，深於大海，虽粉骨碎身，莫能报德也。 师不云乎：勤而不遇，必遇至人。 遇而不勤，终为下鬼。 心常昼夜二六时中，不忘此戒，决志勉进，转加坚固，愿成清净解脱无上正真大道，以度玄祖父母、三师法友、亿劫种亲，普及法界众生，同往仙家之乐，岂敢此生容易蹉过耶！ 动静忽觉数年，复又所获仙师召鹤之书，岂偶然哉！ 二於是三伏于地，礼谢祖师仙师，得蒙付授，可以行持，钦崇仙化，证果登真。 凡召鹤之士，要是修真佩箓，道德及人，累有功积在天，德泽万民，祈祷雨旸，济度幽显，玄功广博，名列仙阶，官极一品二品，乃可行之。 甚验。 然要是祖师鹤会斋大善缘中，方可於三日前行持。 限定日时，方有准验。 若非高品职任道德之士，则不可召之。 得此法者，慎勿轻泄也。 若轻泄者，立遭天谴。 可不慎乎！ 秘之秘之。

May it deeply concern [Your Eminence] that the worldly and foolish remain deluded, disbelieving in the Dao and its methods. Now desiring to propagate the teachings and spread their influence, that the people may come to revere them and the Great Dao flourish, [I] humbly approach Your August Marchmount to request the loan of several simurghs and cranes. On such-and-such a day at noon, may they descend to the ritual altar, circling and dancing above and below, offering obeisance with bowed heads and bared forms. When the noon audience concludes, may they be immediately dispatched back to their posts, without daring to linger.

Furthermore, [I] beseech the dispatch of the Blue-Green Controller of Cranes, the spirit officer of Penglai, to attend the altar and witness the covenant of the fast. This petition is hereby respectfully submitted.

[Your] humble servant, [Name], most reverently presents this petition before the Sacred Thearch of the Southern Marchmount, Controller of Heaven’s Luminous Might. May Your Sagely Compassion deign to grant this earnest plea. Issue commands to the master of the Simurgh-and-Crane Bureau to promptly act in accordance with the matters herein submitted, swiftly dispatching them to ensure the ritual’s completion, transforming both humans and celestials, and perfecting the fast in all its aspects.

[I], [Name], presuming upon Your Sacred Authority, am filled with trembling awe. Respectfully submitted.

In the year of ___, the ___ month, the ___ day, [Name], of such-and-such position, submits this petition.

Submitted to the Master of the Simurgh-and-Crane Bureau of Penglai Mountain, the Perfected Lord of the Day.

On the day following the ritual, a second missive shall be sent, dispatching the Perfected Officer of the current stellar lodge, along with the Directing Talisman, and the Intermediary Director of Merit-Officials, to urgently summon twelve, twenty-four, or thirty-six simurghs and cranes, as well as one spirit officer, to attend the altar. Issue the summons again.

The Seven Spirit Officers of Penglai Mountain Who Control Cranes:
First Spirit Officer: Radiant Rosy Clouds
Second Spirit Officer: Jade Radiance
Third Spirit Officer: Golden Fusion
Fourth Spirit Officer: Bian Wen
Fifth Spirit Officer: Treasure Radiance
Sixth Spirit Officer: Qi Yang
Seventh Spirit Officer: Elegant Fruit

These seven spirit officers take turns beginning on the first day of each month. However, on the last day of the lunar month and the full-moon day, the spirit officer named Vermilion Lake does not fall under their jurisdiction and will not respond to summons. Only during the Nine-Yin Yellow Register Grand Offering to the Boundless Heavens will he arrive promptly. At other times, if summoned in jest or frivolity, the invocation will prove ineffective.

This method was taught by the Patriarchal Iron-Crutch Perfected Lord of All Immortals, the August Thearch of the East, who, atop Mount Qingcheng, assembled the host of immortals and summoned cranes from the Southern Marchmount, which arrived riding the void. When the affair concluded, they returned. The teaching was later transmitted to Zhongli, the Perfected Lord of Upright Yang, and to the Purple Void Perfected Lady Wei of the Southern Marchmount. It was then passed to Lord Lü Dongbin, the Perfected Lord of Pure Yang, who transmitted it to the Immortal Liu Haichan. He, in turn, bestowed it upon the Purple Yang Perfected Lord Zhang of Mount Tiantai. From generation to generation, it has been transmitted thus, reaching the ninth-generation lineage-holding immortal master, the Jade Tube Immortal Elder, through whom it has spread unbroken to the present day.

In the final days of the jiachen year, I unexpectedly had the good fortune to attend a gathering at the Treasure Canopy Grotto of Wuyang, where I served with wholehearted devotion. On the celestial腊 day of the yisi year, I presented this petition with incense, prostrated myself, and entreated my master to accept me as a disciple, to enlighten me on the firing times of the golden elixir’s transformations. From that moment, the secret transmission resonated within me, and all proved true. Thus, I reflect that my master’s kindness towers higher than Mount Sumeru and runs deeper than the vast sea; though I were to grind my bones to powder, I could never repay such virtue.

Did not my master say: “Diligence without encounter leads one to meet a perfected being; encounter without diligence consigns one to become a lowly ghost.” Day and night, through the twelve double-hours, I never forget this admonition. Resolutely, I press forward, my resolve growing ever firmer, vowing to attain the pure, liberated, supreme, and perfectly true Great Dao. Thereby may I deliver my primal ancestors, my three masters and dharma friends, and all karmically connected kin through countless kalpas, universally extending to all beings throughout the dharma realm, that together we may ascend to the joys of the immortals’ realm. How could I dare let this life slip by in vain?

Time passes swiftly, and after several years, I unexpectedly obtained the immortal master’s book on summoning cranes—was this mere chance? Twice, thrice, I prostrated myself upon the earth, paying homage to the patriarchal and immortal masters, and was deemed worthy of receiving their transmission. Thus empowered, I may practice and uphold it, revering the immortal transformations and attaining fruition as a perfected being.

Those who summon cranes must be cultivators of the true, bearers of registers, whose virtue extends to others, whose accumulated merits fill the heavens, whose beneficence nurtures the myriad people, who pray for timely rain and sunshine, who deliver the living and the dead, whose mysterious works are vast and profound, whose names are inscribed on the immortal ranks, and who hold offices of the first or second rank—only such may perform this rite. It is most efficacious.

However, it must be conducted within the great karmic affinity of the Crane Assembly Fast of the Patriarchs, and only then may it be performed three days in advance. The appointed day and hour must be strictly observed for the invocation to prove effective. Those who are not of high rank, office, or virtue may not summon them.

Whoever obtains this method must guard it carefully and not lightly disclose it. Those who do so will immediately incur heavenly retribution. How could one not be cautious? Keep it secret, keep it secret!

chunks.original_text: 法海遗珠卷之十四竟 #1《告斗求长生法》：宋元金丹派南宗所传。 #2《追鹤秘法》：宋元金丹派南宗所传。 法海遗珠卷之十五 奏传混炼法式 入坛念浄口咒 丹朱口神，吐秽除氛，舌神正伦，通命养神。 罗千齿神，却邪卫真。 喉神虎贲，炁神引津。 心神丹元，令我通真。 思神炼液，正气长存。 急急如律令。 浄身咒 灵宝天尊，安慰身形。 弟子魂魄，五藏玄冥。 青龙吉庆，白虎卫形。 朱雀顾护，玄武摄精。 血尸臭秽，凶恶潜宁。 七液得注，五藏化生。 我持神咒，元亨利贞。 急急如律令。 净天地咒 洞中虚玄，晃朗太元。 八方威神，使我自然。 灵宝符命，普告九天。 乾罗答那，洞罡太玄。 斩妖缚邪，杀鬼万千。 中山神咒，元始玉文。 持诵一遍，却鬼延年。 按行五岳，八海知闻。 魔王束首，侍卫我轩。 凶秽消荡，道黑长存。 急急如律令。 上香启祝 玉华散景，九炁凝烟。 香云密罗，径冲九天。 侍香金童，传言玉女。 接侍香烟，上闻帝前。 令臣所启，咸赐如言。

chunks.original_text: 具位臣姓某，谨谨焚香，再拜，上启三清上圣，十极高真，神霄九宸上帝，十方灵宝天尊，三十二天帝君，日宫太阳帝君，月府太阴皇君，天罡大圣，节度星君，上清九跃星君，南斗六司延寿星君，北斗七元解厄星君，三台华盖星君，十二宫辰星君，二十八宿星君，三元三品三官大帝，北极法主四圣真君，玄中教主五师真君，祖师正一静应显佑真君，太极左宫仙翁真君，雷霆三省真君，雷霆九司真君，紫府门下列位高真，雷霆圣众，五岳五山圣帝，地府酆都大帝，冥府十宫真君，水府扶桑大帝，承差雷神官将吏兵，三界十方一切真宰。 恭望圣慈，洞回灵鉴。 述意昔投度师某门下，奏授太上北极玉府玄灵太极三光五雷诸阶符法，皈身佩奉。 誓以代天宣化，助国救民，一切行持，济人利物。 凡伸恳祷，仰冀通灵。 伏望大道垂慈，诸天保举，怜臣钦崇之志，赦臣故误之愆。 黑簿削非，仙阶进职，先亲得度，动止咸安，所冀道炁资扶，灵光下烛。 俾身心之清净，万邪不干。 庶靖治之肃严，百神森卫。 仰赖生成之德，式符方寸之诚。 臣稽首顿首，再拜谨言。 次向东，叩齿，上曰： 臣谨上启日宫太阳帝君，伏望圣慈，允臣奏告。 特降太阳真炁，灌注臣身，驱逐一切邪炁，断除一百四病，觑山山崩，睹海海竭，视病病愈，看人人生，人皈依，鬼摈伏，邪不干其正。 以左手卯文，存左头上有一日，日中有蓬头将，九芒之炁，如九丝下灌注，自左六合官入，照映身心。 六合宫乃眉头一寸，是日归左六合。 秘咒白： 郁仪之神，离宫真灵。 灌报九芒，元亨利贞。 三遍 咒毕，侧目看左边头上，去一尺五寸，有九丝光芒之炁，即以口吸入心。 再咒曰： 唵。
