The Primordial Lineage

The Imperial Master, the Primordial Dao Ancestor of the Limitless and Supreme, Self-Originating and Self-Rooted, Who Gives Birth to Heaven and Earth, Who Gives Birth to the Dao and the Immortals—
The Primordial Qi of Chaos, the First Ancestor of Fuli, the Most Revered Iron Treasure Lord of the Golden Palace’s Primordial Yang.

The Sagely Master, the Golden Palace’s Mysterious Primordial Dao Ancestor, the Most High Nine Qi Venerable of Great Clarity, Who Opened the Chaos of Heaven, the Myriad Transformations of the Vast Primeval Flood—
The Supreme and Most Virtuous Great Sage Lord Lao, the Natural and Limitless Iron Master Lord.

The Lineage Master, the Most Compassionate and Benevolent Great One, the Heavenly Worthy of Salvation from Suffering of the Eastern Ultimate Palace, the Iron Ascendant Lord.

The Lineage Ancestors:
The Primordial Kalpa’s Five Spirits and Five Elders, the Iron Immortal Lords.
The Iron Peak Lord.
The Iron Cliff Lord.
The Iron Cavern Lord.
The Iron Convergence Lord.

The Dharma-Holding Master of the Chaos, the Preacher of the Profound Teachings, the Sovereign of the Mysterious Yuan Teaching—
The Iron Tablet Jade Stream Southern Perfected.

The Divine Host:
The Supreme Commanders of the Upper Thunder of the Primordial Qi of Chaos, the Great Thunder Deity Lords and Vice Commanders, the Thunder Deity Lords and Officers.
The Supreme Commanders of the Middle Thunder of the Primordial Qi of Chaos, the Great Thunder Deity Lords and Vice Commanders, the Thunder Deity Lords and Officers.
The Supreme Commanders of the Lesser Thunder of the Primordial Qi of Chaos:
The Heavenly Honored Tianpeng, the Radiant Spirit Lord;
The Heavenly Honored Tianyou;
The Venerable Guardian Lord;
The Assisting Sage Lord;
The Vice Commanders, the Nine Heavens’ Pengkan Enforcers, the Inspectors of the Celestial Palaces, the Great Unity and Moon Comet Thunder Lords.
The Heavenly One’s Purple Qi Thunder Deity.
The Sun Palace’s Great Yang Thunder Deity.
The Moon Palace’s Great Yin Thunder Deity.
The Heavenly Head’s Luocha Thunder Deity.
The Divine Tail’s Jidu Thunder Deity.
The Wood Virtue Thunder Deity of the East.
The Fire Virtue Thunder Deity of the South.
The Metal Virtue Thunder Deity of the West.
The Water Virtue Thunder Deity of the North.
The Earth Virtue Thunder Deity of the Center.
The Wind, Cloud, Thunder, Rain, and Lightning Deities.

The Method of Summoning:
Perform the Threefold Purification in Secret, offer incense, invoke the masters, declare the intent, and summon the generals to act.

The Summoning Incantation:
I am the spirit of the Primordial Yang Golden Palace,
Born of the Primordial Qi of Chaos.
Heaven revolves and earth rotates, the cosmos turns,
The First Ancestor commands me to summon the Star Perfected.
The Iron Master’s golden sword sweeps away demonic vapors,
Driving thunder and dispatching lightning to resound through the Great Clarity.
Dare any arrive late—first their form shall be destroyed!
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!

The Second Incantation:
With hair unbound, pacing the steps to seek the killing qi,
The sword’s tip ignites fire to refine the true script.
Lord Lao bestowed upon me the Chaos Method,
To command the Star Perfected and the Six-Six Thunder.
One qi, seven cycles—heaven and earth grow dark,
At the third watch and third point, summon the Thunder Deities.
Only the pivot of summoning thunder is known to few—
A profound and mysterious secret.
Cook poria in congee to refine the Star Perfected,
Always retain a single point to summon the Thunder Deities.
For one hour and eight quarters, fire follows the body,
The numinous talisman aligns with the orifices of the Heavenly Person.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Most High Dao Ancestor’s Military Statutes and Ordinances!

The Triple Summoning:
By the command of the Primordial Yang Emperor, swift as the Fire Star!
Should there be the slightest delay or disrespect, the Great Yang shall scorch and incinerate.
Reverently burn the true incense and proclaim the summons to the Primordial Qi of Chaos and the such-and-such Thunder Deity.
Let each and all who hear this present summons arrive with all haste!
Hasten, hasten, hasten!

chunks.original_text: 天地之髓，阴阳之精。 乾旋坤转，关召星真。 十一列曜，与帝同生。 混沌浩荡，一炁初分。 开天立地，摄鬼驱精。 发生万类，养育群灵。 混沌法律，万神成听。 急急如律令。 勑咒 吾代太上老君，九天之上天尊。 三十二天为顶，三十二天为身，我行混沌大法，统尽日月星辰。 万圣听吾差使，千真遵守坛门。 未有山川五岳，先有玄元老君。 吾奉始祖勑命，斩鬼斩邪灭精。 若不顺吾法律，斩首斩形无根。 为国祈雨速至，为民斩鬼疾擒，如有诸雷违令，罚为地府阴兵。 急急如律令。 又咒 吾代太上老君，九夭之上天尊。 三十二天为顶，三十二帝为身，我行无穷大法，斩鬼诛邪移星。 万圣听吾差使，千真遵守坛门。 未有山川五岳，先有洪蒙老君。 帝勑万丈刀剑，勑赐墨印随身，日下人间救苦，夜居天上移星。 唤集天真地将，显现神通降灵。 付吾斩缚恶鬼，星辰恶业除形。 万里如同寸步，翻身福国济人。 天下太平广阔，收入葫芦斩精。 息身布炁前后，蓬莱三岛仙人。 急急风火一摄，劈邪斩鬼为尘。 急急如道祖至尊行军律令。 咒毕，献茶酒，宣意，敕遣咒。 绿水秋波湛湛清，千觔铁斧背头轻。 傍河柳树风吹倒，抱着嫦娥也不惊。 轻时轻似空中尘，重时重似千秤铁。 白时白似天上雪，红时红似猩猩血。 织女四哥地下黑，勾娄吉利云蒙月。 登僧得色新夜月，大朴太初水火穴。 昆仑既济满山川，天地此时不敢说。 驱天驱地起云雷。 咒尽灵符召九都。 若人了得驱天法，役使南曹九帝君。 云龙叆叇勑五雷，冯夷鼓舞嚼九龙。 磊磊落落徧乾坤，日月变动役山岳。 掣电电光雷霹雳，破石泉源山海倾。 水吼龙呤飞石叫，山崩石裂社令摧。 城隍违令当衢斩，翻覆三千徧大千。 急急如道祖至尊行军律令。 嘱将咒 雷神雷神，轻似空中尘，重如千秤铁，白如天上雪，红似猩猩血，半夜喝风雷，哑子咬破舌，收入玉葫芦，秘之不可泄。 役雷咒 元阳一炁，洞达八荒。 孽类敢前，馘灭永昌。 急急如律令。 誓章
chunks.translated_text:
The Essence of Heaven and Earth, the Essence of Yin and Yang.
The Qian revolves, the Kun turns—
The Pass summons the Star Perfected.
The eleven luminaries arrayed,
Born with the Emperor in the same breath.
Vast and boundless, Chaos,
The Primordial Qi first divided.
Heaven opened, Earth established,
Ghosts seized, spirits driven.
All things brought forth,
All beings nurtured.
By the Law of Chaos,
All gods heed in obedience.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes ordain!

**Decree and Incantation**
I act in the stead of the Most High Lord Lao,
Celestial Venerable of the Nine Heavens.
Thirty-two heavens form my crown,
Thirty-two heavens form my body.
I enact the Great Law of Chaos,
Commanding the sun, moon, and stars entire.
All sages heed my dispatch,
All perfected observe the altar’s gate.
Before mountains, rivers, and the Five Peaks arose,
There was the Primordial Elder Lord.
I bear the mandate of the First Ancestor,
To behead ghosts, slay demons, and extinguish spirits.
Should any defy my law,
Their heads and forms shall be severed, rootless.
For the realm, summon rain with haste;
For the people, seize ghosts with speed.
If any thunder deities disobey,
They shall be punished as yin soldiers of the Earth Prison.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes ordain!

**Another Incantation**
I act in the stead of the Most High Lord Lao,
Celestial Venerable above the Nine Heavens.
Thirty-two heavens form my crown,
Thirty-two emperors form my body.
I enact the boundless Great Law,
To slay ghosts, punish demons, and shift the stars.
All sages heed my dispatch,
All perfected observe the altar’s gate.
Before mountains, rivers, and the Five Peaks arose,
There was the Venerable Lord of Primordial Chaos.
The Emperor decrees a blade ten thousand fathoms long,
Bestows upon me the ink seal to carry always.
By day, I descend to the human realm to relieve suffering;
By night, I dwell in the heavens to move the stars.
I summon the Perfected of Heaven and the Generals of Earth,
Manifesting divine power to descend in spirit.
Entrusted to me is the binding and beheading of evil ghosts,
To eradicate the karmic misdeeds of stars and obliterate forms.
A thousand miles become a single step,
A turn of the body brings fortune to the realm and salvation to the people.
The world is vast and at peace,
Ghosts are drawn into the gourd and slain.
I still my body and spread qi before and behind,
An immortal of Penglai’s Three Isles.
Swiftly, with wind and fire, I seize,
Cleaving demons and beheading ghosts to dust.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Most High Dao Ancestor’s Military Statutes and Ordinances!

The incantation complete, offer tea and wine, declare the intent, and dispatch with the decree.

Green waters, autumn waves, limpid and clear,
A thousand-catty iron axe rests lightly on the back.
By the riverside, willows sway in the wind,
Yet embracing Chang’e causes no alarm.
Light as dust in the void,
Heavy as iron of a thousand scales.
White as snow in the heavens,
Red as the blood of the crimson ape.
The Weaver Girl’s Fourth Brother darkens the earth below,
Goulou Jili veils the moon in clouds.
The monk ascends, gaining the hue of the new night’s moon,
Great Simplicity and Primordial Chaos—Water and Fire’s Cavern.
Kunlun’s completion fills the mountains and rivers,
Heaven and Earth dare not speak at this hour.
Driving Heaven, driving Earth, clouds and thunder arise.

*The Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls, Scroll Forty-Two*

*The Supreme Petition for Exorcism and Secret Memorial: Ritual Procedures*

The *Daoist Methods Compendium*, Scroll 110, *Great Rites of the Mysterious Primordial Chaos Writ*, belongs to the same dharma lineage. Its *"Lineage and Origins of the Dharma School"* traces the transmission from the Iron Treasure Supreme Emperor and Iron Master Supreme Emperor, following the Iron Ascendant Supreme Emperor, to the Patriarchal Dharma-Holder, Propagator of the Teachings, and Founder of the Xuanjiao School, Iron Tablet Jade Creek Southern Perfected, named Wen Biao. The succession continued with Iron Inscription Dongshan Perfected Li Yingxin, Thunder Marshal Supreme Minister of the Unified Qi Perfected Iron Alms-Bowl Thunder Master Yulong Tiemuer, and Thunder Marshal Supreme Minister Iron Mountain Thunder Master Li Mingzheng. It also includes the *"Precepts of the Supreme Primordial Chaos Teachings"*, which elaborates on the principles, laws, and ordinances of the Primordial Chaos School, serving as a valuable reference.

---

**Ritual Procedures for Petition and Memorial**

The method states: First, observe the precepts, bathe, and change into ritual attire. Prepare the memorial by using the middle joint of your middle finger as a one-inch measure, making the document nine inches in height and width. Avoid empty words; ensure utmost sincerity in truthfully recording the matter at heart, with simplicity and solemnity as paramount.

On a quiet night, compose yourself in stillness and contemplation. Do not allow those who consume meat, outsiders, women, individuals in mourning attire, or cats and dogs to witness the ritual. This is called a *"secret memorial from the heart"*, and an auspicious day may be chosen. In urgent cases, no day need be selected—simply focus the mind, offer one stick of incense and a cup of water, and face the pivot of the Dipper with utmost sincerity, performing the rite as prescribed.

---

**Incantation for Changing Attire**
*Qian yuan heng li zhen.*
The Fusang tree emits its essence,
Five-colored clouds envelop the body.
Clothing covers the form,
In all movements and travels,
May the hun and po souls be at peace,
All evil subdued,
Eternally enjoying the blessed court.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!*

After reciting this incantation, the master silently intones the *"Purification of the Mouth"* incantation, makes the *zi* mudra, draws northern *qi*, and swallows it. Then, the *"Purification of the Body"* incantation is recited while making the *zi* mudra with both hands, drawing northern *qi* and blowing it to sweep both shoulders.

Next, intone the *"Purification of Heaven and Earth Qi"* and the *"Slaying Mudra"*, drawing northern *qi*.

---

**Incantation for Dispelling Impurities**
The Nine Phoenix Perfected,
Phoenixes that break impurities,
Clad in vermilion, wielding swords,
Stand above me.
Nine heads spew fire,
Advancing before me.
Flaming, engulfing the earth,
Ten zhang of firelight.
The Nine Phoenixes break impurities,
Evil spirits perish.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances of the Supreme Emperor!*

Make the *wu* mudra and draw southern *qi*.

---

**Nine Phoenixs’ Vajra**
With the right foot stepping and the hand sweeping, the master visualizes the Nine Phoenix Perfected, clad in vermilion ritual robes, wielding fire swords, riding nine-headed vermilion phoenixes, descending from the south to cover the practitioner’s form. Each of the Nine Phoenixes spews fierce fire, burning away impure *qi* until all is purified.

Next, silently recite the secret incantation:
*He ming tian di ri.*

Recite this incantation in one breath, nine times, make the *wu* mudra, draw southern *qi*, and focus the mind so that the ritual space is illuminated as if under the sun. Then, step through the hexagrams.

chunks.original_text: 一炁三徧 右咒毕，从子文轮至亥文，入中指中节，局定，当心存青炁自泥九入，存赤为以鼻吸入，次将头团团转一次，吸炁一徧咽之，存神乘炁自鼻而入，归于所属，立伺报应。 书心奏行持 凡书心奏，行须凝神定思，次剔九凤罡，念合明天帝日，次念密咒，勑过纸笔墨，不可通声，然后书奏。 咒曰 天地大明，万炁混生。 我得真一，内景玉庭。 虚皇勑命，令我通真。 上元赤子，三元六府。 百神会并，混合我身。 上朝斗府，出入紫庭。 游宴八冥，三一上景。 太一玄真，奏我所意，上达斗真，心有所愿，默奉允呈，所得玄旨，副我心灵。 人间万事，一一开分，飞神玉坛，分身一形。 急急如律令。 右咒毕，取北炁吹之，次存玉星立於五方，日月在于左右。 心奏式 具位臣姓某。 右臣伏闻九晨在上，实为临照之司。 太上垂慈，因示祈禳之教。 凡有所求，许容陈告。 臣今奏为入意谨具状，奏告北斗圣位道前。 恭望道慈，赦臣亵渎冒犯一切罪愆，特赐哀怜，允臣所告。 即乞恩命，如何以副臣心。 冒渎威严，臣下情无任激切，望恩之至，伏候道旨。 年　月　日　具位臣姓某状奏。 封奏用治印，不用外函外封。 先以左手剔九凤罡，吹念合明天帝日咒，存用吹剔。 次以左手掐戌亥，为开天门诀。 次掐坤巽文，营左右目，为留人门。 次掐四指上节，存见侍香金童、传言玉女。 次掐中指上中下，为三天诀，剔起，为开三天门。 告斗香 茅香，茴香子，云香，松子，栢子。

Upper Prime Red Child,
Three Primes and Six Palaces—

Merging with my body.
Ascending to the Dipper’s palace,
Entering and exiting the Purple Court.

Upon completing the incantation, draw in northern qi and blow it forth. Then visualize the Jade Stars standing in the five directions, with the sun and moon to the left and right.

[Rank and Name], Your humble servant [Full Name], respectfully states:

I have heard that the Nine Dawns reside above, truly governing the oversight of illumination. The Most High, in compassion, has bestowed the teachings of prayer and expiation. For any matter sought, petition and declaration are permitted.

Your servant now submits this petition for [state intent], humbly presenting this document before the sacred presence of the Northern Dipper.

I reverently beseech the Dao’s compassion to absolve all my transgressions of irreverence and offense, and to grant special mercy, permitting the fulfillment of my petition. I earnestly implore the bestowal of grace and command, that it may accord with my heart’s desire.

For my presumption in troubling your august majesty, your servant’s feelings are overwhelmed with urgency and longing. I prostrate myself in anticipation of the Dao’s decree.

[Year] [Month] [Day]
[Rank and Name], Your humble servant [Full Name], respectfully submits this petition.

Seal the petition with the governance seal; do not use an outer envelope or wrapping.

First, with the left hand, perform the Nine Phoenix Rite, blow while reciting the invocation to the Radiant Heavenly Emperor, and visualize the act of consecration.

Next, with the left hand, press the *xu* and *hai* positions to form the Opening the Heavenly Gate mudra.

Then press the *kun* and *xun* characters, anointing the left and right eyes to form the Preserving the Human Gate.

Next, press the upper joints of the four fingers, visualizing the Golden Lad of Incense Offering and the Jade Maiden of Message Transmission.

Then press the upper, middle, and lower joints of the middle finger to form the Three Heavens mudra, and flick upward to open the Three Heavenly Gates.

Cogon grass, fennel seeds, cloud incense, pine seeds, cypress seeds.

**Matters Governed by the Dipper’s True Ones**

All methods of petitioning the Dipper depend on the practitioner’s application. Generally, those who fail to receive a response do so because they do not know which governing star presides over their affair. Just as human kings and ministers have officials assigned to specific duties, so too must one not petition indiscriminately. The celestial real ones, after all, have their own bureaus and offices. To draft a memorial, first determine the nature of the matter, then identify which star governs it, and petition accordingly—assurance of a response will follow.

**First Heaven:** The Celestial Commandant, the Star Lord of Greed-Wolf, and his consort, the Inner Consort, oversee the redress of wrongs, the vindication of right, the suppression of others’ evil, the advancement of one’s own virtue, the remission of sins, and the prayer for blessings. They hold office during the *Shi* and *Bi* mansions, and the *Kui* and *Lou* constellations.

**Second Heaven:** The Grand Steward, the Star Lord of Great Gate, and his consort, the Inner Concubine, govern the arts of yin and yang, official advancement, and the pursuit of schemes. They hold office during the *Wei*, *Mao*, *Bi*, and *Zi* mansions.

**Third Heaven:** The Minister of Works, the Star Lord of Prosperity-Keeper, and his consort, the Primordial Mother, oversee the study of the Dao, the quest for immortality, and communion with the true and attainment of the sagely. They hold office during the *Shen*, *Jing*, *Gui*, and *Liu* mansions.

**Fourth Heaven:** The Patrol General, the Star Lord of Literary Brilliance, and his consort, the Inner Consort, govern the subjugation of human and spectral foes and the execution of malevolent forces. They hold office during the *Xing*, *Zhang*, *Yi*, and *Zhen* mansions.

**Fifth Heaven:** The Dipper Lord, the Star Lord of Integrity-Chastity, and his consort, the Eldest Daughter, oversee the augmentation of lifespan, the establishment of merit, and the prayer for blessings. They hold office during the *Jiao*, *Kang*, *Di*, and *Fang* mansions.

**Sixth Heaven:** The Grand Master of Ceremonies, the Star Lord of Martial Brilliance, and his consort, the Middle Daughter, govern the alleviation of calamities, obstructions, illnesses, and misfortunes, and the prayer for relief and exemption. They hold office during the *Xin*, *Wei*, *Ji*, and *Dou* mansions.

**Seventh Heaven:** The Supreme Emperor, the Star Lord of Rupture-Soldier, and his consort, the Youngest Daughter, oversee the resolution of cosmic blockages and the regulation of qi and seasonal cycles. They hold office during the *Niu*, *Nü*, *Xu*, and *Wei* mansions.

**Eighth Heaven:** The Venerable Jade Emperor’s Outer Assistant, the Star Lord, and his consort oversee the exorcism of manifold disasters and the prolongation of life through medicinal practice. They hold office on the day of one’s original destiny and natal hour.

**Ninth Heaven:** The Perfected of the Grand Master of Ceremonies, the Inner Counselor, the Star Lord, and his consort oversee prayers for the people’s blessings and the salvation of all matters. They hold office on the day of one’s original destiny and natal hour.

**The Heavenly Stem Method**

chunks.original_text: 月月常加戌，时时见破军，月将如未过，且就本宫轮。 假如正月中亥时，欲取天罡，正月天罡戌时在寅，天道左旋，亥时正在戌位也。 又谓正月将在亥，天道左旋，二月将在戌。 假如正月中子时，欲知天罡宫之所在，便以正月将亥时加子上，右行逢辰，便是天罡之宫。 正月子时，亥加子数去，辰在巳上，其时天罡正在巳上。 右法存火光细如丝而下侧面，以鼻窍取中，仰视便是天罡炁。 北斗出游日宜祈告 凡告斗，每月吉日三七，庚申甲子，三元五腊之日，次及宿直事，更以每月建日。 正月二十五日、二十六日，寅卯辰未申酉亥子日吉。 二月初三日、初七日、二十三日、二十六日，丑寅卯申酉戌巳午未日吉。 三月二十六日，卯辰巳申酉戌日吉。 四月十七日、二十七日，寅卯辰酉戍亥午未申日吉。 五月初三日、十三日、二十日，辰巳午酉戌亥丑寅卯日吉。 六月初四日、初八日，卯辰巳戌亥子未申酉日吉。 七月初四日、二十四日，巳午未戌亥子寅卯辰日吉。 八月初三日、十九日、十一日、二十七日，亥子丑辰巳午申酉戌日吉。 九月初三日、十八日，午未申亥子丑卯辰巳日吉。 十月初十日、二十六日，子丑寅巳午未酉戌亥日吉。 十一月初一日、初九日、十七日、十五日，子丑寅辰戌午未申酉日吉。 十二月二十日，未申酉戌亥子丑寅卯日吉。 斗府灵章 唵。

Visualize the heart’s fire blazing like a flue, shooting straight through the *Yintang* point and ascending to meet the Dipper’s Mouth. From the flames, a Jade Maiden slowly emerges, her form taking shape like luminous essence. She faces the petitioner directly. Silently recite the *Great Merit Incantation* seven times, then imagine the Jade Maiden returning speech to you—thus is the connection established.

Practice this union at the noon hour for three days. Thereafter, perform it at will, with the hours of *yin*, *wu*, and *xu* all being efficacious. When practicing this method, three forms of response may manifest: *written response*, *dream response*, or *ash-altar response*.

For a *written response*, first purify the body and recite the esoteric incantation in the heart. Then invoke the *Yellow Emperor of the Central Palace, Controller of Destiny and Hearth Lord*. Next, summon the *Jade Immortal Bright Essence Youth* from beneath the throne. Silently recite the *Numinous Yang Swift Response Great Merit Incantation*, form the *Li* trigram mudrā, and draw the central yellow *qi*. Blow it toward the hearth in the direction of the ritual’s intent. Take a sheet of paper and inscribe the matter at hand, the officiant affixing their seal and rolling it up. Place a brush inside, sealing it together. In a short while, the response will arrive.

When first practicing, use the fifth *xu* day, offering a rice meal as sacrifice. Pray for transmission of the *Orthodox Mind Esoteric Canon* to a designated recipient on a specified date. For all petitions, swift responses are hoped for. Should one betray this trust, a memorial shall be submitted to the *Dipper Palace*, the *True Lord of Upholding Sageliness and Protecting Virtue*, the *Yellow Emperor of the Central Palace, Controller of Destiny and Hearth Lord*, the *Jade Immortal of the Sudden Ascent*, the *Bright Essence Youth*, and the *Venerable Alchemical Maiden*—may they clearly dispatch reproof, not through any malice of mine. If I am not sincere, may they impose punishment, and I shall harbor no resentment.

From this day forth, this decree is made known to all. Let it be openly declared and dutifully observed.

**Incantation for Purifying Body and Mind**
*Qingyang, Qingyang, belonging to the left direction.
Above dwells true essence, below coalesces numinous light.
The Dao naturally secures the true; water wondrously merges with golden light.
Pouring into body and mind, the dharmic visualization is fulfilled.
I now recite and unfold, harmonizing with the Dao’s resonance.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Yellow Emperor’s decree of the Central Palace.*

**Numinous Yang Swift Response Six Merit Incantation**
*Om. Hum. Zha. Śakra. Mīra. Mīra. Swift response, swift response.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the True Lord of Upholding Sageliness.*

For this incantation, form the *Li* trigram mudrā and draw the central yellow *qi*. Visualize the True Lord emerging from the Dipper Palace, appearing amidst the clouds, holding a *wish-fulfilling wheel* and commanding *Bright Essence* with hands clasped in obedience. Then imagine a stream of yellow *qi* from your own spleen meridian rising upward, merging with the cloud *qi* of the southeast. Visualize yourself transforming into a youth riding a tiger, ascending with the *qi*, uniting with the cloud-borne youth to become one. Draw this in through the mouth, then blow it onto the talisman. Burn the talisman, then place the paper and brush upon the hearth. The hearth must be kept pure, and women’s impurity, peering, or idle chatter are to be avoided. Wait two hours before retrieving the paper. If nothing is written, burn another talisman and recite the *Urgent Summons Incantation*:

*Between heaven and earth, departure and abiding are not fixed.
For all who make supplication, swiftly descend the cinnabar ladder.
Brush, ink, paper, and silk—grant the numinous response early.
As wished, as sensed, neither transgress nor disobey.
By imperial decree, the numinous youth swiftly descends.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the True Lord of Upholding Sageliness.*

**Esoteric Incantation**
*Tí bǔ lún □ shè.*

Recite this incantation once with a single breath, three times in total. After each *written response* ritual, burn three hundred gold coins and one *cloud horse* as offerings. For subsequent earnest requests, proceed in the same manner.

**Esoteric Talisman**
*Emperor Flame, Emperor Flame, Firelight’s Foremost.*

chunks.original_text: 今来合行叩问，谨涓某月某日戌亥二时，备信香信符，邀请中宫黄帝司命掌膳灶君殿下，玉仙明英童子姹女尊神，伏请遵依太上符命，闻召速临坛所，阐扬道法，早赐灵批，随愿随感，须至专牒者。 右牒上 中宫黄帝司命掌膳灶君殿下，玉仙明英童子姹女尊神，牒到仰详牒内事理，速降丹梯，立赐批降。 谨牒。 年　月　日　时牒。 具位　姓某押。 斗府翊圣保德真君掌教太玄仙圣。 司命祈禳大法 告斗灵文 此法出自西蜀，非世得闻。 后因成都丈人观九华仙人，往江西少室山显真观，流传在世。 师师口传，肘后急告斗法，世俗莫能晓。 师曰：世人罪福，皆达天司。 在天则为北斗七星，主掌人命。 在世则灶君职焉。 况司命六神之主，乃斗中七元使者应化。 斯神在人间抄录世人举措，运为昧心，凡诸罪咎，遇月晦日上天誊奏靡阙遗，大过则丧身绝嗣，小犯则横逆临身，岂得免欤。 近时富室贵官，偶遇年乖，遭此厄难，命道士师巫祈禳，或献星，或设醮，无过施财买物，役人措办，不劳於力，但只出身证盟。 其间不茹素灭裂嬉笑者有之，欲祈昭报，其可得乎。 但古之师资，乃达人高士，质朴淳素，不能圆转，致使其太上开度厄济生之恩，不能推广济惠，不能平等充足，普及生灵，若如此则利於富不利於贫。 以世法论之，家贪力乏，偶逢灾难，无浩大之资，则不能举行，束手待死而已，亦可怜哉。 太上好生育物，安分贵贱高下。 如此则玄灵中云：贫穷下贱，无力修崇，可以酌水献花一段，却成虚妄。 皆因世上庸师俗士，不肯屈己，参师访道，所以不知枢要。 只以服色声音、器具华饰，以为美观，无非坐参拐窃，妄意编撰，以诳后学。 近世见行玄灵默告河图密祭，依本书得几道符命，念得畿句秘咒，不知深浅，一味欺瞒主家，欺罔天真，无非点灯化纸，回向便了。 师曰：司命能奏人间罪福，则吾今秘法祝委司命，赍此情愫，上以通达星天，代为奏告，祈免灾咎，捷如星火。 予巡历师门，际遇高人，授肘后告斗一法，及得口传秘众，归身奉行，累沐玄应，所费甚省简，而当应人间。 不问男女，有此危厄。 须当预先斋戒三日，依法存念行持，无不昭格。 切在志诚，毋生轻慢之心，卤莽妄用。 苟若有犯玉律，非轻，天必知之，祸不旋踵，无所祷也。 今谨遵师授开列，凡有学士虔恪一心，恭敬崇奉，代天行化，摧诚救物，其功广大，言之不尽，慎之毋忽。 行持次第 凡行持，必预先斋戒沐浴，清净身心，绝去妄念，每於清晨，焚香面北，默坐少时，至诚诵经，然后书符。 变坛符 右符用黄纸朱书，长七寸，阔三寸，左手掐煞文，取北炁涂，内写陈仁用入符，存斗口五灵官降，以金勑字盖之。 书符咒 北斗七星，天中大神。 上朝金阙，下覆昆仑。 调理纲纪，统制乾坤。 大魁贪狼，巨门禄存。 文曲廉贞，武曲破军。 大周天界，细入微尘。 何灾不灭，何福不臻。 元皇正炁，来合我身。 天罡所指，昼夜常轮。 俗居小人，好道求灵。 常见尊仪，愿保长生。 高上玉皇，紫微帝君。 急急如律令。 解秽符 右符黄纸朱书，次念净天地咒，取北炁入符。 北斗大神咒 北斗七元，神炁统天。 天罡大圣，威光万千。 上天下地，断绝邪源。

**The Great Rite of Destiny Petition and Disaster Aversion**
**Celestial Petition to the Dipper**

This method originated in Western Shu and is not commonly known in the world. Later, the Nine Radiant Immortals of the Zhangren Abbey in Chengdu transmitted it to the Xianzhen Abbey on Shaoshi Mountain in Jiangxi, where it spread among the people. Master passed it to disciple by oral transmission, a method for urgent petitions to the Dipper, unknown to the secular world.

The master said: The sins and blessings of humanity are all reported to the celestial authorities. In Heaven, they are governed by the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, who oversee human destiny. In the world, this office is held by the Hearth Lord. Moreover, the Lord of Destiny is the chief of the Six Spirits and the manifested agent of the Seven Primes within the Dipper. This deity records the actions of humanity, whether upright or deceitful, and on the last day of each month, ascends to Heaven to submit a complete report. Major transgressions result in the loss of life or the severing of one’s lineage, while minor offenses bring misfortune upon the self. How could one escape?

In recent times, wealthy households and noble officials, when encountering inauspicious years and suffering calamities, have sought Daoist masters and shamans to perform rites of petition and aversion. Some offer prayers to the stars, others hold grand jiao rituals, expending wealth to purchase offerings and mobilizing servants for preparations. Yet they exert no personal effort, merely providing their presence to bear witness. Among them, some fail to abstain from meat, act carelessly, or even laugh irreverently. How can they expect their prayers to be answered?

The masters of old were cultivated persons of high virtue, simple and sincere, yet their methods were inflexible. Thus, the grace of the Most High—who opens the path to deliverance and aids the living—could not be widely extended or equally bestowed, failing to universally benefit all beings. In this way, the advantage lay with the rich, not the poor. By worldly standards, those of modest means, when struck by disaster, lack the vast resources to perform such rites and can only await death helplessly—how pitiful!

The Most High cherishes all life and values contentment, whether noble or base, high or low. Yet the *Mysterious Numinous* scripture states: For the poor and lowly, who lack the means to perform grand rituals, even offering a cup of water or a single flower is dismissed as empty pretense. This is due to the world’s mediocre masters and vulgar practitioners, who refuse to humble themselves, seek teachers, or inquire into the Dao. They concern themselves only with attire, voice, and ornate implements, creating an illusion of beauty. Their practices are mere plagiarism and fabrication, deceiving later students.

In recent times, the *Mysterious Numinous* method of silent petition and the secret rites of the *River Chart* have circulated. Some obtain a few talismanic commands from its texts or memorize a few lines of esoteric incantations, yet they understand nothing of their depth. They deceive households and delude the celestial perfected, performing nothing more than lighting lamps, burning paper, and reciting dedications. The master said: If the Lord of Destiny can report humanity’s sins and blessings to Heaven, then I shall entrust this secret method to him, conveying these sentiments to the stellar heavens and petitioning on their behalf to avert disasters. The response shall be swift as shooting stars.

In my travels among the masters, I encountered a person of high attainment who transmitted to me the *Elbow-Pocket Petition to the Dipper* and other oral secrets. I have since devoted myself to its practice and repeatedly witnessed its numinous efficacy. The cost is minimal, yet its responses are timely. Regardless of gender, those facing peril should first observe three days of purification and abstinence, then perform the method with focused intention. There is no instance where the deities do not respond. The key lies in sincerity—do not harbor disrespect or act recklessly. To violate the celestial statutes is no small matter; Heaven will surely know, and disaster will follow swiftly, leaving no room for prayer.

Now, in strict accordance with my master’s transmission, I set forth these instructions. For all scholars who approach this with reverence, single-minded devotion, and respectful observance, acting as Heaven’s proxy to transform and save beings, the merit is vast and beyond description. Take heed and do not neglect this.

**Sequence of Practice**
For all practices, one must first purify body and mind through abstinence and bathing, dispelling all distracting thoughts. Each morning, burn incense, face north, sit in silent meditation for a short while, and recite the scriptures with utmost sincerity before inscribing the talismans.

**Altar-Transforming Talisman**
This talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on yellow paper, seven inches in length and three inches in width. Hold the paper in the left hand while forming the *sha* mudra, draw in the northern *qi*, and write "Chen Renyong enters the talisman." Visualize the Five Numinous Officials of the Dipper’s mouth descending, and seal it with the Golden Edict character.

**Talisman-Inscribing Incantation**
The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper,
Great deities of the celestial center.
Above, they attend the Golden Palace;
Below, they cover Mount Kunlun.
They regulate the cosmic order,
Governing Heaven and Earth.
Great Kui, Greedy Wolf,
Giant Gate, Wealth Repository,
Literary Brilliance, Integrity and Chastity,
Martial Brilliance, Breaker of Armies.
They encompass the great celestial realm,
Penetrating even the finest dust.
What disaster cannot be eradicated?
What blessing cannot be attained?
The primordial *qi* of the August Sovereign
Comes to merge with my body.
Wherever the Celestial Pivot points,
It revolves day and night without cease.
Though I am a humble person,
I seek the Dao and yearn for the numinous.
May I always behold your august presence
And wish to preserve long life.
The Highest Jade Thearch,
The Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord.
Hasten, as the law commands!

**Purification Talisman**
This talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on yellow paper. First recite the *Purification of Heaven and Earth Incantation*, then draw in the northern *qi* to infuse the talisman.

**Incantation of the Great Dipper Deities**
The Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper,
Whose *qi* governs the heavens.
The Great Sage of the Celestial Pivot,
Whose majestic radiance is boundless.
Above Heaven and below Earth,
They sever the roots of all evil.

chunks.original_text: 乘云而升，来降坛前。 降临真炁，穿水入烟。 传之三界，万魔擎拳。 斩妖灭踪，回死登仙。 急急如律令。 书斗 每一星存天星宫降一道真炁，师以鼻吸之，微微吹入斗上星内，仍迭书斗讳於鹤背上，次念梵咒涂之，取各星之炁入。 斗中大神梵字咒 俱祗帝赊苏咤阿若密咤呜都咤俱耆咤波赖帝咤耶微若咤乌都咤俱罗帝咤耆摩咤娑诃。 脱厄符 右符存息人立在坛前，次存斗中降金丹一颗，纳入患人身中，次书符，内加一勑字，并患人姓名涂入，以斗盖之，就仰斗府，禳灾度厄司，特与患人，代替身中灾厄。 次念： 天灵节荣，愿保长生。 太玄之一，守护身形。 五脏神君，各保宁。 急急如律令。 咒曰 太灵九宫，太一守房。 百神森卫，魂魄和同。 长生久视，塞灭邪凶。 一阴一阳，永保吉昌。 急急如律令。 验灯法 频剔不明：天灾。 灯明不灭：大吉。 分两炬长短：旧愿动。 结花如垂珠：大吉。 半黑半红：口舌。 焰摇不定：疾病缠绵。 垂泪黑花：大凶孝服。 左侧长上：阳人有灾。 右侧长上：阴人有灾。 灯花红：失财。 灯花白色：失脱。 灯花青白色：先亡不安。 爆后无光：病人有变。 灯奔上四边者：有不正神及客亡鬼为祸。 应梦占验 日出：男病可安，女病得轻。 月出：女病半吉，男病不然。 火发：红焰吉，黑暗凶。 大蛇：半凶，家有不正神为妖。 鸟兽：病患进退。 蛇鼠：土地不安。 犬走：祖先为祸。 白衣女人：乃斗真降。 青衣人：中吉。 黄衣人：土神为灾。 黑衣人：命绝追取。 红衣人：岳神来取追对。 入官府宅舍见女人：斗真降格，灾厄消除。 入寺院：阴小有灾，作福保过。 沐浴：有灾失脱。 光明如昼：金色大吉，病患可退。 犬马：墓宅不安。 徧天黑暗：主病患不退。 飞鸦：当境康神为害。 牛豕：瘟疫疟疾。 鸦鸡：在凶，主有横事生。 无梦：病重不省，无变亦凶。 焚燎看灶上：有蚁子，有蜈蚣飞蛾青蛙，并是土神庙社。 其余吉凶，以意详之。 灶疏札皆如常式。 凡行持，先令人酒扫灶所，然后依式行事，次将灯一盏，安於锅内，仍将米筛盖之，勿令生人及妇人见之。 法海遗珠卷之四十二竟 法海遗珠卷之四十三
chunks.translated_text:
Ascend upon the clouds to descend before the altar.
Descending with true *qi*, piercing water and entering mist.
Transmitted through the Three Realms,
All demons bow in submission.
Severing demons and erasing traces,
Turning death into ascension to immortality.
Hasten, as the law commands!

**Inscribing the Dipper**
For each star, visualize the Celestial Star Palace descending a thread of true *qi*. The master inhales it through the nose and gently exhales it into the star of the Dipper. Then, inscribe the Dipper’s taboo name upon the crane’s back, recite the Sanskrit incantation to anoint it, and draw in the *qi* of each star.

**Sanskrit Incantation of the Dipper’s Great Deities**
*Ju zhi di she su cha a ruo mi cha wu du cha ju qi cha bo lai di cha ye wei ruo cha wu du cha ju luo di cha qi mo cha sa ha.*

**Talisman for Deliverance from Calamity**
Visualize the afflicted person standing before the altar. Next, visualize a golden elixir descending from the Dipper and entering the sufferer’s body. Then inscribe the talisman, adding a command character and the afflicted person’s name to anoint it. Cover it with the Dipper, facing upward toward the Dipper’s palace, the Bureau of Exorcising Disasters and Delivering from Calamity, to substitute for the sufferer’s bodily misfortunes.

Next recite:
The numinous nodes flourish,
Wishing to preserve long life.
The Supreme Mystery’s One,
Guarding and protecting the body’s form.
The spirit lords of the Five Viscera,
Each safeguarding peace.
Hasten, as the law commands!

**Incantation**
The Supreme Numinosity of the Nine Palaces,
The Great One guards the chamber.
A hundred spirits stand in solemn defense,
Soul and spirit harmonized as one.
Long life and enduring vision,
Sealing and extinguishing evil and misfortune.
One yin and one yang,
Forever preserving auspicious prosperity.
Hasten, as the law commands!

**Method for Interpreting Lamp Omens**
Flickering dimly: celestial disaster.
Lamp bright and undying: great fortune.
Two flames of unequal length: old vows stirring.
Flower-like beads suspended: great fortune.
Half black, half red: slander and strife.
Flame wavering unsteadily: chronic illness.
Tears of black soot: great misfortune and mourning.
Left side elongated: disaster for a yang person.
Right side elongated: disaster for a yin person.
Red lamp flower: loss of wealth.
White lamp flower: loss or separation.
Pale blue-white lamp flower: ancestral spirits unsettled.
Exploding without light: change in the patient’s condition.
Lamp flame leaping to all four sides: malevolent spirits or wandering ghosts causing harm.

**Dream Interpretation for Verification**
Sunrise: male patient may recover, female patient’s condition lightens.
Moonrise: female patient half-fortunate, male patient otherwise.
Fire appears: red flame auspicious, darkness inauspicious.
Great serpent: half-misfortune, household troubled by malevolent spirits.
Birds or beasts: patient’s condition fluctuates.
Snakes or rats: earth spirits unsettled.
Dogs running: ancestral spirits causing harm.
Woman in white: Dipper immortals descending.
Person in blue: moderate fortune.
Person in yellow: earth spirits causing disaster.
Person in black: life exhausted, spirits pursuing.
Person in red: mountain spirits coming to claim or confront.
Entering an official residence or house and seeing a woman: Dipper immortals descend to resolve calamity.
Entering a temple: minor yin misfortune, perform rites to ensure safety.
Bathing: disaster or loss.
Bright as daylight: golden brilliance, great fortune, patient’s condition may improve.
Dogs or horses: ancestral graves unsettled.
Darkness across the sky: patient’s condition will not improve.
Flying crows: local earth spirits causing harm.
Oxen or swine: epidemics or malarial fevers.
Crows or chickens: inauspicious, unexpected misfortune may arise.
No dream: patient gravely ill and unconscious, no change also inauspicious.

**Fumigation and Stove Inspection**
Observe the stove: ants, centipedes, flying moths, or frogs indicate earth spirits or local shrines.
Other auspicious or inauspicious signs are to be interpreted with discernment.
Stove purification and written petitions follow standard forms.

**Procedure for Ritual Practice**
First, have someone sweep and clean the stove area. Then proceed according to the prescribed method. Place a lamp inside the wok and cover it with a rice sieve, ensuring no layperson or woman sees it.

chunks.original_text: 太玄煞鬼关帅大法#1 将班 北帝酆都馘魔提刑上将太煞鬼关，讳羽，字云长。 赤枣面，勇猛相，乘赤马，洞灵帽，青结巾，皂靴。 召咒 北帝敕召关羽大将，御地统天，馘魔煞鬼，威振魔王。 闻令一召，速出幽关，疾速降临。 急急如北阴酆都大帝律令。 唵。 折丑捉坤急卯盘巳中□子哩兑茹艮 兰离神摄。 午出 唵。 吽□咤哩。 关羽速降摄。 唵。 折啄急津□咖哩咤帝摄。 一炁九徧 唵。 吽摩呢哒哩吽□咤摄。 一炁九徧 唵。 霹雳金光□速现。 唵。 吽吽咤钵。 大将关羽，速降狞刑摄。 存肘后黑炁，吸入肾宫，良久，吹右肘后，存北斗中有本帅，於斗中现形于前。 啡啡喤喤，关羽狞强，手执金刀，斩灭凶殃。 朗灵君，朗灵君，关羽大将，速现真形。 唵金咤，唵金咤，结咤降临来摄。 大誓咒 朗灵朗灵，馘魔将军。 酆都肃煞，黑煞奔凝。 白袍铁马，红额青巾。 提魂拷勘，摄祟附身。 驱魔缚鬼，不问□亲。 功成岳将，令属幽阴。 九泉号令，煞炁氤氲。 悲风凛凛，百万雄兵。 闻今有召，速现金身。 急如紫微大帝律令。 敕召唵□吼啒轮托钵大将，速现真形。 疾。 散形

**Great Rites of the Supreme Mystery for the Ghost-Gate Marshal #1**

**Marshal Guan of the Northern Emperor’s Fengdu Demon-Subduing Judiciary**
The Great Ghost-Gate Marshal of the Northern Emperor’s Fengdu, Slayer of Demons and Executioner of Judgment, bears the taboo name *Yu* and the style *Yunchang*. His face is like a crimson jujube, his aspect fierce and valiant. He rides a red steed, wears a *Dongling* cap, a turquoise headscarf, and black boots.

**Summoning Incantation**
By decree of the Northern Emperor, Marshal Guan is summoned—governing earth, commanding heaven, beheading demons, and slaying ghosts, his might shaking the demon kings.
At the first call of this command, swiftly emerge from the hidden pass and descend with haste.
*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes of the Northern Yin Fengdu Emperor!*
**Oṃ.**
*Zhe-chou zhuo-kun ji-mao pan-si zhong-□ zi li-dui ru-gen*
*Lan-li shen-she.*
*Wu-chu*
**Oṃ.** *Hūṃ-□ cha-li.*
Marshal Guan, descend swiftly and seize!
**Oṃ.** *Zhe-zhuo ji-jin-□ ka-li cha-di she.*
*One breath, nine recitations*
**Oṃ.** *Hūṃ ma-ni da-li hūṃ-□ cha she.*
*One breath, nine recitations*
**Oṃ.** *Pī-lì jīn-guāng-□ sù xiàn.*
**Oṃ.** *Hūṃ hūṃ cha-bō.*
Great Marshal Guan, swiftly descend to execute fierce judgment and seize!
Visualize black *qi* behind the elbow, draw it into the kidney palace, and after a long moment, exhale behind the right elbow. Envision the Marshal within the Northern Dipper, manifesting his form before you.
*Fei-fei huāng-huāng*, Marshal Guan is fierce and mighty, wielding a golden blade to sever misfortune and calamity.
*Lǎng-líng Jūn*, *Lǎng-líng Jūn*, Great Marshal Guan, swiftly manifest your true form!
**Oṃ jīn-cha**, **Oṃ jīn-cha**, *jié-cha* descend and seize!

**Great Oath Incantation**
*Lǎng-líng, Lǎng-líng*, Demon-Subduing General.
Fengdu’s solemn execution, black *qi* congeals in haste.
White-robed, iron-steed, red-browed, turquoise-scarved.
Seizing souls for interrogation, binding spirits to bodies.
Driving out demons, restraining ghosts, sparing none, near or far.
When the task is done, the mountain general’s command belongs to the netherworld.
The Nine Springs resound with orders, *qi* of slaughter swirling thick.
Mournful winds howl, a million-strong army.
At this summons, swiftly manifest your golden body!
*Swiftly, as decreed by the statutes of the Purple Tenuity Emperor!*
**Decree-summoning:** **Oṃ-□ hǒu-tū lún-tuō-bō**, Great Marshal, swiftly manifest your true form!
*Hasten!*

Guan Yu of the Northern Capital—mighty and fierce.
Fifty million soldiers, banners arrayed in ranks,
Swiftly descend in majesty to sever and purge demonic thieves.
Pursue souls, seize spirits, chase across the Eight Directions,

*Zhou Jue, Biao Di Chen, Liang’s affairs weigh heavy upon Ah.*
*Flaming as smoke in the firmament, surging like radiant splendor.*

*The Seven Wrongs traverse the wondrous canopy, linked and spreading demonic sway.*
*The Six Heavens bar the northern path—this is the abode of ghosts and gods.*

*Oṃ, Tiānjī Dìnī, swiftly seize!*
**Zi-Wu Dipper**
*Oṃ hūm hūm □-cha, seize!*

Names of the Northern Dipper, Southern Dipper,

Heaven’s Dao, Earth’s Dao, Humanity’s Dao,

Marshal Tiānyóu executes the rotating *sha*.

At *chén*, the earth upends.
At *xū*, throttle the plague’s throat,
Seal the plague’s nose, block the plague’s ears.
Solemnly invoke General Copper Nail to nail shut the ears of all ghosts.
Unknowing of my coming, unknowing of my going.

chunks.original_text: 次握隐祖诀一宫隐吾祖，二宫隐吾父，三宫隐吾母，四宫隐吾妻，五宫隐吾妾，六宫隐吾子，七宫隐吾孙，左三宫隐吾宅，右三宫隐吾身，行司关羽，速变吾身。 存为本帅身。 次发诀，便作用五黑。 天黑地黑，人黑鬼黑，天地山河如墨黑。 断后诀 一断山魈路，二断石精门，三断人踪迹，四断百鬼孙，五断天师来时路，六断地师去时踪，七断冤家并咒诅，八断八庙八猖门，九断南郊大庙口，十断北郊大庙村。 天道天神断亥，地道地神断巳，人道人神断申，鬼道鬼神断艮。 断绝天瘟地怪，邪师鬼贼。 不回头转马，向上向下，劈天作两片，劈地作两边，断却冥阳五路所，百鬼世走路。 断却庐山邪法路，断却庐山百鬼门。 有名无姓称庐山。 扯头向下定根源。 次两手起铜篱铁障业风，吹转断斗，即锁断地脉断。 五方吏兵九亿万众 九狱主吏疾速加备 如有违令九天电辉摄赴幽冥急急如北帝律令唵金毗突嚧咤聻吽吽疾速降真形唵哼帝哩敕天蓬寅文 唵嚧喑哩天文猷文唵吽哩咤敕翊圣中文唵呮哆哩勑佑圣巳文酆都大帝敕黑律严重火急施行 唵吽吽勾底那白底那岌岌那喽那悉怛那底悉那拔头那跋耶摄。 唵吽吽俱底帝赊苏咤呵惹密帝呜都咤俱耆咤娑赖帝咤耶微惹咤俱耶咤嗜摩咤娑诃。 酆都行司断法变身藏形诀 吾从天门来亥，身从地户出巳，春雷在吾左卯，秋雷在吾右酉，夏雷在吾前午，冬雷在吾后子，天雷在吾头双局盖头，地雷在吾足双局覆地。 地祇温帅大法#2 师派祖师三十代天师虚靖张真人。 祖师初心张先生。 宗师一派陈先生。 宗师自然孟先生。 宗师方乎张真人。 宗师惠明梁先生。 将班 地祇司翊灵昭武显德上将火鸦蛮雷使者一炁温元帅，名琼。 青面，红发，黄眉，獠牙，怒相，紫帽，红锦袍，绿绰袍，绿靴，左手掐煞文，右手执金骨朵。 或简鞭。

Then grasp the Hidden Ancestor Mudra:
First palace conceals my ancestors,
Second palace conceals my father,
Third palace conceals my mother,
Fourth palace conceals my wife,
Fifth palace conceals my concubine,
Sixth palace conceals my sons,
Seventh palace conceals my grandsons,
Left three palaces conceal my dwelling,
Right three palaces conceal my body.
Marshal Guan Yu of the Administrative Bureau,
Swiftly transform my form—
Visualize as the body of this marshal.

Next, emit the mudra and activate the Five Blacks:
Heaven black, earth black,
People black, ghosts black,
Heaven and earth, mountains and rivers—ink-black.

The Sealing-Off Mudra:
First, sever the path of mountain *xiaos*,
Second, seal the gate of stone spirits,
Third, cut off human tracks,
Fourth, break the lineage of all ghosts,
Fifth, block the path of the Heavenly Master’s coming,
Sixth, erase the traces of the Earthly Master’s going,
Seventh, sever grudges and curses,
Eighth, shut the eight temples and eight *chang* gates,
Ninth, close the mouth of the great southern suburban temple,
Tenth, bar the village of the great northern suburban temple.
Heaven’s Dao, heavenly spirits sever at *hài*,
Earth’s Dao, earthly spirits sever at *sì*,
Human Dao, human spirits sever at *shēn*,
Ghost Dao, ghostly spirits sever at *gèn*.
Cut off heavenly plagues and earthly anomalies,
Heterodox masters and ghostly thieves.
No turning back, no wheeling steeds—
Upward cleave heaven in two,
Downward split earth in half,
Sever the five roads of *ming* and *yang*,
Banish all ghosts from the world’s paths.
Block the heterodox arts of Mount Lu,
Seal the hundred ghost gates of Mount Lu.
Named but nameless—called Mount Lu.
Drag the head downward to fix the root source.

Next, raise both hands to summon the bronze fence and iron barrier,
The karma wind whirls to sever the Dipper,
Instantly lock and cut off earth’s veins.
Five Directions’ clerks and soldiers—nine hundred million hosts,
Nine Hell’s chief clerks—hasten to prepare.
Should any disobey, the nine heavens’ lightning will seize and deliver them to the nether darkness.
*Swiftly, as per the Northern Emperor’s statutes—*
*Oṃ kumbhi tuludhā nṛtya hūṃ hūṃ hasten to manifest true form!*
*Oṃ hūṃ dili catur Tiānpéng yín-wén!*
*Oṃ ludhili Tiānwén Yóu-wén!*
*Oṃ hūṃ lidhā catur Yìshèng zhōng-wén!*
*Oṃ zhīduōlī catur Yòushèng sì-wén!*
*Fēngdū Dàdì catur—black statutes, solemn and weighty, execute with utmost urgency!*

*Oṃ hūṃ hūṃ goudīnà báidīnà jíjínà lóunà xīdánà dǐxīnà bátóunà báyē shè!*
*Oṃ hūṃ hūṃ jùdī dīshē sūzhā hērě mìdì wūdūzhā jùqízhā suōlàidìzhā yēwēirězhā jùyēzhā shìmózhā suōhē!*

The Fengdu Administrative Bureau’s Severing Dharma, Transformation, and Concealment Mudra:
I come from Heaven’s Gate at *hài*,
My body emerges from Earth’s Portal at *sì*,
Spring thunder at my left in *mǎo*,
Autumn thunder at my right in *yǒu*,
Summer thunder before me at *wǔ*,
Winter thunder behind me at *zǐ*,
Heavenly thunder caps my head with a double canopy,
Earthly thunder covers my feet with a double base.

Earth Spirit Wēn Marshal’s Great Dharma #2
Lineage: Ancestral Master, the 30th Heavenly Master Xūjìng Zhāng, the Perfected.
Founding Master: Mr. Zhāng of Initial Heart.
Lineage Master: Mr. Chén of the First Transmission.
Lineage Master: Mr. Mèng of Naturalness.
Lineage Master: Perfected Zhāng Fānghū.
Lineage Master: Mr. Liáng Huìmíng of Radiant Wisdom.
Officers:
Earth Spirit Bureau’s Winged Numinous Illustrious Martial Manifest-Virtue Supreme General,
Fire Crow Barbarian Thunder Envoy,
First *Qi* Wēn Marshal—named Qióng.
Blue-faced, red-haired, yellow-browed, fanged,
Fierce countenance, purple cap,
Red brocade robe, green sash,
Green boots, left hand forming the *sha* mudra,
Right hand wielding a golden bone mace—or a simple whip.

chunks.original_text: 副帅 铁元帅名定。 毕元帅名光。 黑元帅名显。 方元帅名雄。 刘元帅名泽。 张元帅名渐。 赵元帅名广。 史元帅名宏。 周元帅名昌。 五猛大将直符听令小亭侯张先。 入坛三净召功曹 道香一炷，十方肃清，法鼓三通，万神咸集。 焚香当坛，宣召五雷下直日奏事功曹使者香官土地等神，闻令召请，疾速来临。 唵吽吽。 功曹速至。 娑诃。 右咒一炁七徧，存西北上功曹至，一吸吹向前，祝白： 功曹使者，已到行坛。 仰烦传此心香，上诣雷府，宣请某将，速至坛前，有事差委。 召法 北帝□□，万炁之根。 神通变化，自然至真。 五云腾绕，列宿森森。 急急奉北极紫微大帝律令。 魁连□□，子天元磊磊。 午腾金徧压，卯轰轰震动。 酉谨离壳轰，中劈碎昆仑。 顶勑煞摄。 北帝钦轮普灵神摄。 戌辰斗 唵希夷啼兰陀耶摄。 戌辰斗 唵□苏咤勑煞摄。 戌辰斗

Three rolls of the Dharma drum—may the myriad spirits all assemble.

Merit Officers, come swiftly.
*Svāhā.*

The Merit Officer Envoy has arrived at the ritual altar.
I humbly beseech you to convey this heart-incense upward to the Thunder Bureau, and summon such-and-such Marshal to swiftly come before the altar, for there is a task to be entrusted.

The Northern Emperor □□, root of the ten thousand *qi*.
Divine transformations, wondrous shifts—naturally attaining perfection.

chunks.original_text: 右剔向左，想青炁蒙蒙，见泰山翊灵院内，本师怒相，却吹偯字照之，再念： 唵吽咤哩贺安嗢□帝摄。 谨召地祇司翊灵昭武上将温琼速至疾。 右嘘青炁于东方，以两目金光射左，存青炁中帅见，即吸秘字归胆宫，祖炁混合金光，作雷音运动，木炁犯土，金光犯木，存元师用咽唏咦三字，拥帅威容赫烈，至坛左于前现，念心咒： 呼吽嚤唏摄。 右咒一炁七徧，白意随事指挥。 本身符 一条铁棒重千斤， 专打天下不正神。 打入出笔，向坤剔摄字，向巳打出，出笔向艮剔摄字，依斗岳照。 秘咒 □役□召□□音伊，出煞炁□□处靖一□天星□地曜聻紫微□真王□岳令霐。 唵呼嚧哩咤吠□□□唏□乾毕哩咤□温琼疾摄。 炓。 祝白本帅前去某人家摄捉，以天蓬咒遣之。 唵。 □□温琼摄。

Within the azure *qi*, the Marshal appears—draw in the secret syllable to the Gallbladder Palace, where Ancestral *Qi* merges with golden light, surging in thunderous resonance. chunks.original_text: 汝若不摄，土皇地祇自摄。 急急奉后土皇地祇律令勑煞摄疾响振。 凡人家重病，批此於司命家神前，及与患者吞服。 □。 壳字右棒觜上入，取艮宫煞炁入符，念急急奉 东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝律令摄。 右念毕，大喝一声字，左右手书太阳太阴，令相合揩热，却运身中水火升降混合，作一雷声打入符中，以左脚踏地一声，以两手掐子文，运大指过四指伏，掐作局，运肾心交合向心，作雷声打入符中。 事若至紧，用此文入符及岳讳，念急急奉 太素玄定夫人张氏道辉付男温某准虎口号令奉行。 手书□字，口念前文，凡召温元帅，去人家扫荡狂邪祟，及天行时炁瘟疫者，入此五雷於符，当有阴雷报黄，邪鬼自退矣。 书毕，念唵吽咤哩四字入符中，中书一字，存祖炁中有一字，金光郁郁，却五雷猪头形，各负王鼓，自坤宫而至於字香上，合而为一，却一吸入符，只以天蓬咒勑遣 ㄇ，以两手如前作用，喝作雷声，打局入符，为八点金，何以为八点金，为之八圈子者是也。 勑制地祇 唵。

Should you fail to seize them, the Earth Sovereign and Earth Deities shall seize them in your stead. *Swiftly, swiftly, in the name of the August Earth Sovereign and Earth Deities, by statute and command—strike, seize, and dispatch with thunderous might!*

For households afflicted by grave illness, inscribe this before the deities of the Bureau of Destiny and have the sufferer ingest it. □.

The *ké* character enters at the tip of the right rod; draw the baleful *qi* from the *Gèn* Palace into the talisman. Recite: *Swiftly, swiftly, in the name of the Eastern Peak, Mount Tai, Heavenly Culmen, Benevolent and Sacred Emperor, by statute and command—seize!*

Upon completing the recitation, let out a great shout—*hūng*—and with both hands, inscribe the Greater Yang and Lesser Yin, rubbing them together to generate warmth. Then circulate the Water and Fire within the body, ascending and descending to merge them, and with a clap of thunder, strike them into the talisman. Stamp the left foot once upon the earth, and with both hands form the *zǐ* mudra, passing the thumb over the four fingers to complete the seal. Circulate the union of Kidney and Heart toward the Heart, and with another thunderclap, strike it into the talisman.

In matters of utmost urgency, incorporate this text into the talisman along with the taboo name of the Peak. Recite: *Swiftly, swiftly, by the authority of the Lady of Primordial Mystery and Serene Stability, Zhang Shidao Hui, entrusted to her son Wen [so-and-so], in accordance with the Tiger’s Mouth mandate—enforce!*

Inscribe the □ character by hand and recite the preceding text. Whenever Marshal Wen is summoned to a household to sweep away violent demons and malevolent influences, or to dispel pestilential *qi* during epidemics, infuse this Five-Thunder talisman. There shall be a response from the Hidden Thunder, and the demonic spirits will retreat of their own accord.

Upon completing the inscription, recite the four characters *Oṃ hūṃ lú zhà* into the talisman. At its center, inscribe a single character, visualizing within the ancestral *qi* another character, resplendent with golden light. Then summon the Five Thunders in the form of boar-headed figures, each bearing a royal drum, advancing from the *Kūn* Palace to converge upon the character atop the incense. Merge them into one, then draw them into the talisman with a single inhalation. Employ the Heavenly Canopy Mantra to dispatch them: ㄇ. As before, use both hands to perform the mudra, shout with thunderous force, and strike the seal into the talisman, forming the Eight Points of Gold. What are the Eight Points of Gold? They are the eight encircling strokes.

*Command and restrain the Earth Deities:*
*Oṃ.*

chunks.original_text: 乾元亨利贞勑煞摄。 唵吽咤哩□咤哩叱□哩哩咭唏。 吾奉雷霆勑煞摄。 三天大圣，四圣元尊。 天蓬天蓬，九玄煞童。 天关地轴，在吾掌中。 五丁都司，高刁北翁。 七政八灵，太上皓凶。 长颅巨兽，手把帝锺。 素枭三神，严驾夔龙。 威剑神王，斩邪灭踪。 紫炁乘天，丹霞赫冲。 吞魔食鬼，横身饮风。 苍舌绿齿，四目老翁。 天丁力士，威南御凶。 天驺激戾，威北衔锋。 三十万兵，卫我九重。 辟尸千里，驱却不祥。 敢有小鬼，欲来现状。 镢天大斧，斩鬼五形。 炎帝烈血，北斗燃骨。 四明破骸，天猷灭类。 神刀一下，万鬼自溃。 急急如九天尚父灵魁尊神含元大虚大元帅勑煞摄。 密密哩。 急缚速捉。 山魈魍魉，五瘟六疰，一十五种，无道精邪，速速昏昏迷迷摄。 格正机罡衡卫文。 右诀寅卯辰巳，从大指根往，却掐煞文，剔斗断罡亦妙。 嘘即肝胆之炁天罡在辰 右书符了，却入此秘，再迭书魁斗一座，却念大圣北斗七元星君咒。 六畜保兴生，用天蓬咒遣之。 治猪牛瘟，加三字。 平常用，不须用此讳炓。 如事务急切，用火斗，立现威孚。 五炁造化 木旺春为东方，其色青，其炁和，其应肝嘘。 火旺夏为南方，其色赤，其炁热、其应心呵。 金旺秋为西方，其色白，其炁肃，其应肺呬。 水旺冬为北方，其色黑，其炁寒，其应肾吹。 土寄旺四时为中央，其色黄，其炁温，应脾呯。 虚靖天师传变形符 一煞鬼存笔为戈戟煞伐三千肃煞吏兵入井又出笔 唵吽吽咷咷夕青灵罡诀唵□苏咤勑煞摄子午 唵心吽祖宫咤胆哩鼻出吸，左足顿地，怒而撼动出。 大尊帝令，八首元君勑。 九徧，存金光一轮，诸将现在内。 存心日轮，以益字出，存肾宫月轮朗明，以札字出胆瓶升上。 坐功 晨昏静坐，一尘不染，万念俱默，金光三七，擎起两掌，叩齿九通书。 虚日鼠用 忌燕危月 右两掌心水火合炁擦，但见左掌心有太阳一团光，太阴化生咒，天蓬咒，心咒四十九徧，存温琼在右掌中光现，心祝某事，念天蓬咒，吸光入胆中。 又取东方青炁九口入胆，存胆为瑠璃瓶，中有龟蛇交运，结成金光一团如银珠，嘻出香上，圆如明镜，中有温帅现。 法海遗珠卷之四十三竟 #1《太玄煞鬼关帅大法》：北帝振所传。 #2《地祇温帅大法》：北帝振所传。 《道法会元》卷二五四《东岳温太保考召秘法》灵文序曰：温帅乃东岳统兵天下都巡检掌急取人案典主，威猛异象，凡有告求，无不副心。 唐时因蜀叶法善天师所请，收管瘟疫之鬼，『救病父，蜀民不经月皆获痊愈，后复现身曰：愿辅佐天下法官行持，捉祟治病，今有符文秘法，望为阐扬。 叶天师乃将此法流传后学，呼吸之顷，响应昭然。 』同书所收《地祇温元帅大法》亦属同一法统，同资参证。 法海遗珠卷之四十四 纠察地司殷帅大法
chunks.translated_text:
Invoking the Creative Power to Subdue and Seize:
*Oṃ hūṃ lú zhà* □ *zhà lǐ chì* □ *lǐ lǐ jī xī.*

I invoke the Thunderous Might to subdue and seize.
The Three Heavens’ Great Saints, the Four Sagely Primordial Lords.
Heavenly Canopy, Heavenly Canopy, Nine Mysterious Subduing Youths.
Celestial Pivot and Earthly Axis lie within my grasp.
The Five Ding Generals, Gao Diao and Northern Elder.
The Seven Governors and Eight Spirits, the Supreme White Might.
Long-skulled Beasts of Vast Proportions, wielding the Emperor’s Bell.
The Three White Owls, sternly mounted upon Kui Dragons.
Mighty Sword Spirit-Kings, severing evil and eradicating traces.
Purple *qi* ascends the heavens, cinnabar clouds surge forth.
Devouring demons and consuming ghosts, their bodies stretched across the wind.
Green-tongued and jade-toothed, the Four-Eyed Elder.
Heavenly Ding Warriors, warding off misfortune from the south.
Heavenly Couriers, fierce and wrathful, bearing blades from the north.
Three hundred thousand troops encircle and guard my ninefold layers.
Expelling corpses a thousand *li* away, driving off all inauspiciousness.
Should any petty ghost dare appear,
the Heaven-Splitting Great Axe shall sever its fivefold form.
The Fiery Emperor’s scorching blood, the Northern Dipper’s burning bones.
The Four Luminaries shatter its remains, the Heavenly Plan annihilates its kind.
With a single stroke of the divine blade, ten thousand ghosts scatter.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Nine Heavens’ Supreme Father, the Numinous Might, the Venerable Spirit, the Primordial Void, the Great Marshal commands to subdue and seize.
*Mì mì lǐ.*
Bind swiftly, seize without delay.
Mountain specters, *wangliang*, the Five Pestilences, the Six Afflictions—fifteen kinds in all—wayward spirits and perverse demons, swiftly beclouded and bewildered, seized.
Rectify the Mechanism, align the *Gang* and *Heng*, guard the Pattern.

*Right Mudra:*
From the root of the thumb, proceed through *yín*, *mǎo*, *chén*, and *sì*, then press the subduing pattern. Tracing the Dipper and severing the *Gang* is also efficacious.
*Hū* pertains to the *qi* of liver and gallbladder; the Celestial *Gang* resides in *chén*.

After inscribing the talisman, seal this secret within. Then inscribe again a *Kui* Dipper, and recite the *Dharani* of the Great Sage Northern Dipper’s Seven Primordial Star Lords.
To safeguard the prosperity of the six livestock, employ the Heavenly Canopy Mantra to dispatch them.
For treating swine and cattle plagues, append the three characters *xū*, *xiàng*, *xié*.
In ordinary use, this tabooed brilliance need not be employed.
In urgent matters, use the Fire Dipper; its awe-inspiring power manifests instantly.

**The Five *Qi* Transformations:**
Wood flourishes in spring as the East, its color green, its *qi* harmonious, corresponding to the liver’s *xū*.
Fire flourishes in summer as the South, its color red, its *qi* hot, corresponding to the heart’s *hē*.
Metal flourishes in autumn as the West, its color white, its *qi* solemn, corresponding to the lungs’ *sì*.
Water flourishes in winter as the North, its color black, its *qi* cold, corresponding to the kidneys’ *chuī*.
Earth, lodged in the flourishing of the four seasons, is the Center, its color yellow, its *qi* warm, corresponding to the spleen’s *pēng*.

**Transmission of the Perfected Void Heavenly Master’s Shape-Shifting Talisman:**
Inscribe the character for "subduing ghosts," envisioning the brush as a halberd, subduing three thousand *li* of stern subduing officials and soldiers, entering the well and emerging again with the brush.
*Oṃ hūṃ hūṃ tāo tāo xī qīng líng gāng jué Oṃ* □ *sū zhà chì shā shè zǐ wǔ.*
*Oṃ xīn hūṃ zǔ gōng zhà dǎn lǐ*, exhale through the nose, inhale through the mouth, stamp the left foot upon the ground, and shake with fury to expel.
By the Great Honored Emperor’s command, the Eight-Headed Primordial Lord issues the decree.
Nine times, visualize a golden wheel of light, with all the generals manifest within.
Envision the solar wheel in the heart, emitting the character *yì*; envision the lunar wheel in the kidney palace, luminous and clear, emitting the character *zhá* to ascend the gallbladder vase.

**Seated Practice:**
At dawn and dusk, sit in stillness, unstained by a single speck of dust, all thoughts silenced. For three cycles of seven, raise both palms, and knock the teeth nine times.

**Application of the Void-Day Rat:**
Avoid the *Yàn* and *Wēi* months.
Rub the palms together, uniting the water and fire *qi*. Upon seeing a sun-like orb of light in the left palm, recite the *Dharani* of the Taiyin’s Transformation, the Heavenly Canopy Mantra, and the Heart Mantra forty-nine times. Envision *Wēn Qióng* manifesting within the light of the right palm, and silently petition for the matter at hand. Recite the Heavenly Canopy Mantra, and draw the light into the gallbladder. Then draw nine breaths of the Eastern green *qi* into the gallbladder, envisioning it as a lapis lazuli vase, within which the tortoise and snake intertwine, coalescing into a golden orb of light like a silver pearl. Exhale it onto the incense, round as a bright mirror, within which Marshal *Wēn* appears.

*Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls*, Scroll Forty-Three concludes:
#1 *The Great Law of the Dark Mystery’s Ghost-Subduing Marshal*: Transmitted by the Northern Emperor.
#2 *The Great Law of the Earth Deity Marshal Wēn*: Transmitted by the Northern Emperor.

*Compendium of Daoist Methods*, Scroll 254, *Secret Methods for Summoning and Examining the Eastern Marchmount’s Marshal Wēn*, Preface to the Numinous Text states:
Marshal *Wēn* is the Eastern Marchmount’s Commander of Troops, the Celestial Inspector General of the World, and the Keeper of Urgent Human Cases. His might and strange manifestations are unparalleled; whatever is petitioned, none fails to meet the heart’s desire.
During the Tang, at the request of the Heavenly Master *Yè Fǎshàn*, he was entrusted with governing the ghosts of pestilence. "To save a sick father, the people of Shu were all cured within a month. Later, he manifested again, saying: 'I wish to assist the world’s ritual officers in their practice, capturing malevolent spirits and curing illnesses. Now, I possess secret talismanic methods; I hope they will be propagated.'" Heavenly Master *Yè* thus transmitted this method to later disciples. In the space of a breath, its responses were resoundingly clear.
The same work’s *Great Law of the Earth Deity Marshal Wēn* belongs to the same lineage and serves as a mutual reference.

*Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls*, Scroll Forty-Four:
*The Great Law of Marshal Yīn, Inspector of the Earth Bureau*

chunks.original_text: 主法 祖师南昌仙伯廖真人。 将班 北极御前显灵体道助法馘精灭魔地司太岁主吏至德殷元帅，名郊。 孩儿相，青面，红发，丫角乾结蹙绵头□，青身体，露哨腿，皂绿绯袍，红裙扎腰，项带十二骷髅，左手金锺，右手执黄钺，身肥短，立黑云中，有黄旛、豹尾侍左右。 副帅斗中通灵显应急捉蒋使者，名锐。 如紧那王相，獠牙，朱唇，跣足，两耳有大金环，紫色或青面，抹额，赤发，红花袍，吊橔靴，持索，左右有功曹。 黄旛大将卢明。 豹尾大将李仲文。 黄钺大将关隆。 金钟大将陈橐畿。 东方九炁大将宫文王。 南方三炁大将张宗义。 西方七炁大将西门豹。 北方五炁大将吴正文。 中央理炁大将刘忠。 七十二候主将宋文行。 二十四炁大将韩宝。 此法捉三炁九良，驱五瘟六症。 召咒 岁君猛吏，统领众神。 黄旛前引，豹尾后随。 七十二候，二十四炁，恶煞当先，凶神翊卫。 黄钺诛精，金锺击祟。 五方使者，诚毒威灵。 上帝有勑，疾速降临。 助吾大道，扫灭妖精。 敢有拒道，斩首来呈。 玄都律令，煞鬼无停。 急急如北极紫微大帝律令。 勑召上清北帝地司猛吏殷郊速至。 疾。 望中天黄云炁，师目书殷郊二字，吹去云中帅现，吸归脾宫混合，呼出坛前，再吹东北无合之，同蒋帅立现。 聻。 唵吽□□嚩咒摄。 艮炁吹罩定□天雹地□人□。 本帅符 北极勑召 殷郊速至 众神捧令 杀鬼吞精 拒逆者死 帝君勑令 唵吽吽岁君猛吏咒涂黑 聻入用直年太岁押 密咒

The Master of the Law is the Patriarch, Immortal Lord of Southern Prosperity, *Liào Zhēnrén*. The Marshal in Command: *Yīn Yuánshuài*, the Earth Bureau’s Inspector of the Year-Star, Supreme Virtue of the Northern Culmen’s Divine Presence, who aids the Dao, annihilates essences, and extirpates demons—his name is *Jiāo*. He appears as a youthful visage, with a green face, red hair, twin topknots bound in a coiled headwrap, a cyan body, bare legs, clad in a black-green crimson robe, a red skirt cinched at the waist, and a necklace of twelve skulls. In his left hand, he holds a golden bell; in his right, a yellow halberd. Stout and short, he stands amidst black clouds, with a yellow banner and leopard-tail attendants flanking him.

The Deputy Marshal: *Jiǎng Shǐzhě*, the Swift-Seizing Evocator of the Dipper’s Numinous Manifestation—his name is *Ruì*. He resembles a *Kinnara* king: fanged, crimson-lipped, barefoot, with large golden rings in his ears. His complexion is purple or green-faced, with a headband, red hair, a floral red robe, and upturned boots. He wields a noose, with *gongcao* officials at his side.

The Yellow Banner General: *Lú Míng*.
The Leopard-Tail General: *Lǐ Zhòngwén*.
The Yellow Halberd General: *Guān Lóng*.
The Golden Bell General: *Chén Tuòjī*.
The Nine-*Qi* General of the East: *Gōng Wénwáng*.
The Three-*Qi* General of the South: *Zhāng Zōngyì*.
The Seven-*Qi* General of the West: *Xīmén Bào*.
The Five-*Qi* General of the North: *Wú Zhèngwén*.
The Central *Qi*-Governing General: *Liú Zhōng*.
The Seventy-Two Seasonal Sovereign Generals: *Sòng Wénxíng*.
The Twenty-Four *Qi* Generals: *Hán Bǎo*.

This method seizes the Three *Qi* and Nine *Liáng*, dispels the Five Pestilences and Six Afflictions.

**Summoning Incantation:**
Fierce officers of the Year-Star, marshaling all spirits,
With the yellow banner leading, the leopard-tail following,
The seventy-two seasons, the twenty-four *qi*,
Malevolent *sha* at the fore, baleful gods as guards.
The yellow halberd executes essences; the golden bell strikes *sui*.
Envoys of the Five Directions, potent and awe-inspiring.
By the Emperor’s decree, descend swiftly,
Aid my great Dao, sweep away demonic essences.
Whoever resists the Dao shall be beheaded and presented.
By the statutes of *Xuándū*, slay ghosts without delay.
*Hasten! Hasten!* In accordance with the statutes of the Northern Culmen’s Purple Tenuity Great Emperor.

**Decree:** Summon *Yīn Jiāo*, the fierce officer of the Earth Bureau under the Northern Emperor of Supreme Clarity, to arrive swiftly. *Hasten!*

Gaze into the yellow *qi* of the central heavens; the master’s eyes inscribe the characters *Yīn Jiāo*, then blow them into the clouds—the Marshal appears. Draw him into the spleen palace to merge, then exhale before the altar. Blow toward the northeast, where the union is absent, and together with Marshal *Jiǎng*, they manifest instantly. *Nì.*

**Mantra:** *Oṃ hūṃ* [syllables obscured] *vam*, the incantation of subjugation.

**Gèn *Qi* Blow:** Seal and fix [obscured] *heavenly hail, earthly* [obscured] *human* [obscured].

**Marshal’s Talisman:**
By decree of the Northern Culmen, summon *Yīn Jiāo* swiftly.
All gods bear the command—slay ghosts, devour essences.
Whoever resists shall die. By the Emperor’s decree.
*Oṃ hūṃ hūṃ*, incantation of the fierce officers of the Year-Star, applied in black ink.
*Nì*, used in conjunction with the Year-Star of the current year’s cyclical sign.
**Secret Incantation.**

chunks.original_text: 帝勑殷郊，普救群生，驱除凶恶，疾速赴坛。 殷郊元帅，疾速到坛，呼吸报应，速急降临，速疾报应，火急奉行。 考附 日月星辰速移魂，左手斗诀，右手剑诀，想体身顶至脚腿，念天地灵将收摄魂。 自脚腿以剑诀复至顶上方，存三魂如道士形，青黄白三色，自顶随剑诀出，师舌柱上腭，为金桥一吸，存三道士下师腹内金楼玉殿藏之，即指挥将吏押案入体。 雷车雷霆，水神将军。 祟入阳体，清凉如冰。 天将内拷，通吐姓名。 急急如上帝律令。 报犯符 面书三勑符，背加后符。 起土 霐□天星□地曜聻常用散律和 治瘟。 纸剪八角，书符贴外，用猫竹脑一片，长一尺二寸，闰月加一寸，书符勑了，将去犯方，师打四十九下斧，念玉诰一次没了。 次飞辰戌斗，又戌辰斗，贪巨禄文廉武破。 偷修用贴符东边栋柱上，又以符於起土处，用斧打三下。 如动土以符贴用工之所，以动头挖三下。 如天瘟，先酬谢后驱遣，用符如法。 如地瘟，因动土开基，家下灯火不明，宜申土皇元帅，取本人家动土方土投坛中。 如船瘟，行牒遣符如意。 如牢瘟，遣帅监城隍收摄。 如六畜瘟，竹片书插牢圈中，用符打醋炭即安。 取奴婢在逃，书符倒贴灶额上，立见。 如猫犬走失，白纸书符灶额上，立见。 治邪，铁版书符钉。 诸虫雀食践田苗，遣当处土神。 右一一作用，以本法印三颗，一连顺下，召役任意。 有大事奏申行牒发遣符中，大槩随事批祝，次加三勑字盖之，三勑符背书合明天帝日，可用八角符，贴四方。 地司符篆 八角符见本法
chunks.translated_text:
By the Emperor’s decree, *Yīn Jiāo* shall universally save all beings, drive out evil and malevolence, and swiftly hasten to the altar. *Yīn Jiāo*, Marshal of the Origin, hasten to the altar—by breath you shall respond, swiftly descend, and urgently report. Hasten to act without delay.

**Examination and Binding:**
May the sun, moon, and stars swiftly shift the soul. With the Dipper mudra in the left hand and the sword mudra in the right, visualize the body from crown to feet, reciting the invocation to the numinous generals of heaven and earth to gather and seize the soul. From the feet, reverse the sword mudra upward to the crown, imagining the Three Hun in the form of Daoist adepts—azure, yellow, and white—emerging from the crown in sequence with the sword mudra. Press the tongue against the upper palate to form a golden bridge, then inhale, drawing the three adepts into the golden tower and jade hall within the master’s abdomen. Immediately command the officers and clerks to press the case into the body.

**Thunder chariots and thunderclaps, the Water Spirit Generals.**
When malevolence enters the yang body, it becomes as cool as ice. The heavenly generals conduct internal interrogation, compelling it to reveal its name.

**Hasten! Hasten! As the Emperor’s statutes and decrees command.**

**Talisman for Reporting Offenders:**
Inscribe the three decrees on the front and affix the subsequent talisman on the reverse.

**Breaking Ground:**
*Huò líng líng* [syllables obscured] *tiān xīng* [obscured] *dì yào*, *niè*—commonly used for dispersing miasmic harmony to cure pestilence. Cut paper into an octagon, inscribe the talisman, and affix it outside. Take a piece of cat bamboo, one foot and two inches long (add one inch in a leap month), inscribe the talisman upon it, and strike the offending direction forty-nine times with an axe while reciting the *Yù Gào* once, until it is exhausted. Then dispatch the *chén* and *xū* Dipper, alternating *xū* and *chén*, followed by the stars *Poverty, Giant, Wealth, Literature, Humility, Military, Ruin*.

For clandestine repairs, affix the talisman to the eastern pillar of the ridgepole, then strike the ground at the breaking point three times with an axe. When moving earth, affix the talisman to the worksite and dig three times at the starting point.

For celestial pestilence, first offer thanks, then perform the exorcism using the talisman as prescribed. For terrestrial pestilence caused by breaking ground or laying foundations, where the household’s lamps and fires dim, appeal to Marshal *Tǔ Huáng* of the Origin, taking soil from the direction where the earth was disturbed and casting it into the altar.

For ship pestilence, issue a document and dispatch the talisman at will. For prison pestilence, send the marshals to oversee the city god’s seizure. For livestock pestilence, inscribe a bamboo slip and place it in the pen, then strike the talisman into vinegar and charcoal to restore peace.

To recover runaway servants, inscribe the talisman and affix it upside-down above the stove—it will appear at once. For lost cats or dogs, inscribe the talisman on white paper and affix it above the stove—they will appear at once.

To cure malevolence, inscribe the talisman on an iron plaque and drive it in with nails. For insects or birds damaging crops, dispatch the local earth god.

**Right:** Each of these methods requires three impressions of the master’s seal, stamped in sequence to summon and employ agents at will. For major matters, submit a memorial and issue a document with the dispatch talisman. Generally, adjust the prayers according to the situation, then affix the three decrees and seal them. chunks.original_text: 三台北斗星，吾奉上帝勑。 太上有命，岁德尊神，奉行符命，扫灭妖精。 毋令生灾，枉害吾民。 唵部临。 火急押起，报谢土府。 一切神煞。 敢有违令，永送北阴。 民安物泰，道炁长存。 急急如律令。 火急收回天地年月日时一切煞。 如治瘟，加后秘字入。 魅。 玉诰玉诀，病人面赤头疼者，犯天星，以天符解之。 □。 病人犯地曜，地符解。 病人颠犯鬼祟，以此治之。 三勑内秘 天皇勑。 旋斗历箕，回度五常。 应九天之上，日月星辰，皆可役动，朝谒章奏，驱役雷霆，事并隶马。 人皇勑，中理五炁，混合百神。 应九官八卦，经络身田，调和元炁，斩馘尸瘟，事并隶马。 地皇勑，勑制地祇，侍卫送迎。 应九州分野，九垒土皇，阴阳方隅神煞。 皆属节制，馘伐鬼神皆可。 右以三勑，次祖讳，辖北帝勑盖，起土勑，五阳在上补谢，五阴在下禀令。 八变 唵□诋□咖吽摄。 右艮方起土用。 唵□□嚩哩啼□摄。 右乾方报犯用。 唵嚤呢哒哩吽摄。 右兑方谢土用。 哮□啼□哩□摄。 右治病，冷用上，热用下。 咤喏吽咄咤哪摄。 右艮方治祟用。 嚤呜□吽吽□摄。 右巽方起丧。 □□咤啰嚤摄。 右艮方追取。 唵□咤唤□嚝咜□□哒□□啰摄。 右治瘟用。 帝讳 □阴日用。 □阳日用。 一皆用。 □二天星。 □三地曜。 霐常用。 唵吽咤哩五。 总号封符。 □皆用。 □□六畜灾用，二字涂左右。 雷箭大法 夫天地动荡，阴阳激剥，皆属凶星大曜，旺气毒雷，雷箭雷煞，宗师皆有所传。 指射图局，调和造化，燮理阴阳，斩落妖星，勘符克应。 且如流火煞星，太阳者是也。 金虎大煞，乃天罡统其神，即西方太白流金之星，太阴掌之，乃霆煞也。 黑雷雷虎之煞，乃翻天覆地煞神也。 流火凶星符命犯金虎，乃雷雨黑煞而应缘，此星属金，彼符属火，火克金之义也。 翻天覆地之神，并以飞剑斩尸之符，犯之则煞伐雷家眷属也。 并以天皇号令盖蔽，否则法官自受其殃。 更得甲巳，龙飞鸡正啼，到於黑雷黑虎金虎之地，尤其妙速。 大抵太岁停宫便起，正寻霆煞泊处，以雷箭射之亦紧。 诸箭各有起例局图。 行移节次 且如限某日报应，顶先一日，寻流火白虎方所，却以本身符召，如至，存想各将服色，献茶白事意。 次运九炁吹刀上，割鸡，右手执刀，左手割之，滴血於酒丙，将鸡置於凶方。 又运九炁於酒内，将鸡於流火白虎方噀之，喝流火白虎，於某日时大彰报应。 用牒四道，书玉帝勑、火伯符、雷字符、九炁符四道符命，可分作八片，四片粘在牒前，留下四片，上坛召将用之合同。 如牒本坛官将，用火伯符一道，分作二片，如前法用之，背后各书记为妙，却向直符方焚符，召直符斋牒文，各处投进。 仍备太岁牒一道，内统领今年旺炁白虎流火官符使剑朱雀雷霆四箭，於某方兴云吐雾，大震雷声，事备功成，不忘报效。 牒前粘太岁全符一道，对太岁方烧之，至听令时候，看白虎方起发了，回靖运经，天明时看有炁无炁，可将回煞符四道，同於香炉内暗化之，决然大应。 如炁黑煞，炁来得凶恶，急将解符於炉内暗化之，少时化欻火押雷符，总催雷雨，符运不息。 如是六乙行移，先日备檄一道，依时焚化。 如是不应，次用辛符催檄，后用邓符催檄。

To sweep away and annihilate demonic essences.
Let no calamity arise,
Nor wrongfully harm Our people.
*Oṃ bhuḥ tvaṃ.*

Hasten to press forth, report and give thanks to the Earthly Mansion.
All spirit-slayers—
Should any dare defy this command,
Be forever consigned to the Northern Darkness.
May the people know peace, all things flourish,
And the Dao’s qi endure eternally.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees command.*

Hasten to recall all slayers of Heaven, Earth, Year, Month, Day, and Hour.
For treating pestilence, add the secret characters below.

**Demon (魅).**
*Jade Edict, Jade Formula:*
If the patient’s face is flushed and head aches, they have offended the Celestial Stars—resolve with the Heavenly Talisman. □.
If the patient has offended the Earthly Luminaries, resolve with the Earthly Talisman.
If the patient is afflicted by ghostly hauntings, treat with this.

**Three Secret Decrees Within**
**Heavenly Emperor’s Decree:**
Revolve the Dipper, traverse the Winnowing Basket,
Reverse the course of the Five Constants.
Responding to the Nine Heavens above,
Sun, moon, and stars—all may be commanded and moved.
Memorials may be presented, thunder and lightning driven and employed,
All matters assigned to the Steed.

**Human Emperor’s Decree:**
Govern the Five Qi at the center,
Blend and harmonize the hundred spirits.
Responding to the Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams,
The meridians and fields of the body,
Regulate and harmonize primordial qi,
Sever and decapitate corpse-pestilence,
All matters assigned to the Steed.

**Earthly Emperor’s Decree:**
Decree and command the earthly deities,
Escort and receive with attendance.
Responding to the Nine Provinces’ astrological divisions,
The Nine Ramparts’ Earthly Emperors,
The spirit-slayers of yin-yang and the four directions—
All are subject to control,
Ghosts and spirits may be decapitated and subdued.

To the right, inscribe the Three Decrees,
Followed by the ancestral taboo name,
To seal the Northern Emperor’s decree,
Invoke the Earth-Decree,
With the Five Yang above to supplement and give thanks,
The Five Yin below to receive the command.

**Eight Transformations**
*Oṃ □ dī □ kā hūṃ grabha.*
To the right: for earth-breaking in the *Gèn* (Northeast) direction.

*Oṃ □ □ va li tí □ grabha.*
To the right: for reporting offenses in the *Qián* (Northwest) direction.

*Oṃ ma ṇi da li hūṃ grabha.*
To the right: for earth-gratitude in the *Duì* (West) direction.

*Xiāo □ tí □ li □ grabha.*
To the right: for treating illness—use the upper for cold, the lower for heat.

*Zhà nuò hūṃ duō zhà nǎ grabha.*
To the right: for treating hauntings in the *Gèn* (Northeast) direction.

*Mā wū □ hūṃ hūṃ □ grabha.*
To the right: for initiating mourning in the *Xùn* (Southeast) direction.

*□ □ zhà luō mā grabha.*
To the right: for pursuit and retrieval in the *Gèn* (Northeast) direction.

*Oṃ □ zhà huàn □ hōng tuō □ □ dà □ □ luō grabha.*
To the right: for treating pestilence.

**Taboo Names of the Emperor**
□: for yin days.
□: for yang days.
*Kǎn* (☵): all may use.
□: second, Celestial Stars.
□: third, Earthly Luminaries.
*Yù* (玉), *cháng* (常): commonly used.
*Oṃ hūṃ zhà li wǔ.*
*Qì* (炁): general seal for talismans.
□: all may use.
□□: for livestock calamities, apply the two characters to left and right.

**Great Method of Thunder Arrows**
When Heaven and Earth convulse,
Yin and yang clash and flay,
All pertain to baleful stars and great luminaries,
The flourishing qi of poisonous thunder,
Thunder arrows, thunder-slayers—
All are transmitted by ancestral masters.
Point and shoot according to the diagrams,
Harmonize and transform creation,
Balance and regulate yin and yang,
Sever and cast down demonic stars,
Verify talismans and observe correspondences.

For example, the *Liúhuǒ* (Flowing Fire) baleful star is the Great Yang.
The *Jīnhǔ* (Golden Tiger) great slayer is governed by the Celestial Stem—
This is the star of the Western *Tàibái* (Venus), the flowing metal,
Presided over by the Great Yin, the thunder-slayer.
The *Hēiléi* (Black Thunder) and *Léihǔ* (Thunder Tiger) slayers
Are the gods of the *Fāntiān Fùdì* (Heaven-Overturning, Earth-Covering) slayer.
When the talismanic mandate of the *Liúhuǒ* baleful star offends the *Jīnhǔ*,
It responds through the black slayer of thunder and rain.
This star pertains to metal, that talisman to fire—
The principle of fire overcoming metal.

The gods of *Fāntiān Fùdì*
Are to be met with the flying-sword talisman for severing corpses.
To offend them is to slay and subdue the thunder master’s family.
Cover and shield with the Heavenly Emperor’s command,
Or the ritual master will suffer the calamity.
Moreover, on *jiǎ-sì* days,
When the dragon soars and the rooster crows at dawn,
Arriving at the land of *Hēiléi*, *Hēihǔ*, and *Jīnhǔ*,
It is especially swift and efficacious.

Generally, when the Grand Year resides in its palace, arise,
Seek the dwelling of the thunder-slayer,
And shoot it with the thunder arrow—this is critical.
Each arrow has its own method of activation and diagram.

**Procedures for Mobilization**
For example, if the response is due on a certain day,
The day prior, seek the direction of the *Liúhuǒ* White Tiger.
Then summon with the master’s own talisman.
Upon arrival, visualize each spirit’s attire and colors,
Offer tea, and state the purpose.

Next, circulate the Nine Qi and blow upon the blade,
Slaughter the chicken with the right hand holding the knife,
The left hand cutting, dripping blood into the wine vessel *bǐng*.
Place the chicken in the baleful direction.
Again, circulate the Nine Qi into the wine,
Spray the chicken toward the *Liúhuǒ* White Tiger’s direction,
And command: *Liúhuǒ* White Tiger,
At such-and-such day and hour, manifest the great response!

Prepare four documents:
Inscribe the Jade Emperor’s decree,
Fire Earl’s talisman,
Thunder character talisman,
Nine Qi talisman—
Four talismanic mandates, divided into eight pieces.
Four pieces affixed to the front of the documents,
The remaining four reserved for summoning the generals at the altar.

For the document to the altar’s official generals,
Use one Fire Earl’s talisman, divided into two pieces,
Applied as before.
Inscribe notes on the reverse for efficacy.
Then, facing the direction of the direct talisman, burn it,
Summon the direct talisman, and present the memorial text,
Submitting it to the respective offices.

Also prepare a Grand Year document,
Commanding the leadership of this year’s flourishing qi,
White Tiger, *Liúhuǒ* official talismans,
Sword, Vermilion Bird, and the Four Thunder Arrows,
To arise in such-and-such direction,
Raising clouds and spitting mist,
Greatly shaking the thunderous sound.
When the matter is complete and the merit accomplished,
Do not forget to report and requite.

Affix a complete Grand Year talisman to the front of the document,
Burn it toward the Grand Year’s direction.
At the appointed hour, observe the White Tiger’s direction for activation.
Return to pacify and circulate the scriptures.
At dawn, observe whether qi is present.
Prepare four recall-slayer talismans,
Secretly burn them together in the incense burner—
The response will surely be great.

If the qi is black and the slayer’s arrival fierce,
Hastily burn the resolution talisman in the burner.
After a moment, transform it into a sudden fire,
Press the thunder talisman, and urge the thunder and rain unceasingly.

For *liù-yǐ* mobilizations,
Prepare a summons the day prior, and burn it at the appointed time.
If unresponsive, next use the *xīn* talisman to urge the summons,
Then the *dèng* talisman to urge the summons.

chunks.original_text: 西方 北方 中央 展旗搅瓮咒 唵吽吽。 山川之炁，百宿之精。 结为华盖，动土成云。 驱雷使者，结炁灵君。 奉承帝勑，毋致稽停。 急急如上清玄都律令。 罗土宿，煞炁腾空。 唵叱嘟咤哩吽吽摄。 此呢大作，吼虎声念。 斩虹 将头发一根，对虹霓，眼视顶中天有此字炓，过去乾位，天门上有白红炁一道，吸吹发上，喝请使者斩虹，其虹自断。 勑符咒 符命勑灵，符命勑灵。 雷主大帝，赫赫威声。 五雷社令，不得留停。 进奉教诧，百里威灵。 火轮斧鼓，速显威灵。 吾奉上帝勑。 此咒一炁三徧，掐玉帝诀。 焚符咒 灵灵五炁，一炁分形。 太初溟涬，玄极渺冥。 周环六合，普殖神灵。 千变万化，一炁布分。 五方社令，统领雷兵。 轰雷掣电，驾风鞭霆。 闻吾呼召，速到坛前。 默召咒 唵咤哩哆□吽吽□咤□罗利娑诃。 稽首社令阳雷君，分形五方一孛神。 驱驰神鼓响皆应，降下真炁入吾身。 凡吾召处立感应，百里威声无不闻。 存雷主现。 唵咤吽。 摄召杨纪大将孙德将军，西方洪谨坎将朱熙，中央主帅马广大神。 雷光万道，雷炁纷纷，雷声大震，雷火飞奔。 一十三位，副将雷神，崩山倒海，伐木摧林。 飞雷激电，霹雳威声，巽风速起，虎啸艮宫。 震雷哮吼，雨阵如倾，吾今符到，天地肃清。 大震雷鼓，速彰报应，五方交博，击鼓灵窿。 五方响应，荡涤秽凶。 黄雷青炁，东冲北冲。 白雷黑炁，馘灭邪踪。 黑雷黄炁，动按九宫。 赤雷白炁，上游上穹。 都天雷公，烜赫震风。 青雷赤炁，霹雳符同。 唵雷奔电动，亨轰滑辣救竟勑摄。 五雷奉灵，勑受奏申。 州郡正神，钦奉帝勑，不得迟程。 五方社令，速照施行。 玄从玄正。 飞从大千。 急急如太上雷主律令劲。 五雷秘旨 先天玉清勑命咒 青帝之巾，赤帝之帻。 白帝之衣，黑帝之勒。

Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Supreme Law!

**Five Directions’ Brick Talismans:**
Inscribe these Five Directions’ Thunder Talismans upon bricks.
Use fifty *jin* of charcoal,
ignite until red-hot,
then cast into jars placed in the five directions.
The Daoist assembly chants the Wooden Lad Incantation,
the master forms the Five Directions’ mudras,
stirs the jars with a sword—
thunder and rain arrive at once.
